reviews.review: Nothing special. Just a big grass field. Location is between a few musea as the name obviously states. The surrounding shops are worth checking out though.

The Place to be seen. Great museums, restaurants and shopping, Museumplein has it all
I recommend the Park Hotel Amsterdam for its location and service
Fun place to chill.. Lots of attractions, museums etc. Fun place to chill out. Plenty of places to eat and drink. A good central hub to aim for at the start of your day or trip.
Nice place . Very nice place between the Van Gogh and the riskjmuseum full of bars, stores and supermarkets also in here you can found a car parking slot
Heart of cultural activity. Museumplein is the heart of Dutch culture, housing a number of museums including the most renowned Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum. The Diamond Museum is also close by.

Something for Eveyone!. This plush museum quarter was created following the completion of the National Rijksmuseum in 1885 and is located on the south side of Amsterdam.It's considered the cultural hub of the city and home to the two other major museums- the Van Gogh Museum (1973) & Stedelijk or City Museum of Modern Art (1895/2012) as well as the Neoclassical Royal Concertgebouw from 1888 w/ 650 concerts p/year.Other prominent buildings along the square incl. the fortified U.S. Consulate General, the House of Bols w/ its Dutch gin museum/tasting room, the Diamond Museum and Coster Diamonds where you can buy the quality stones.The square was reconstructed in 1999 to incl. an underground parking area & supermarket. The spacious outdoor grass area is often used to stage large events such as festivals, celebrations, music concerts, demonstrations and even a polo match.In the winter, part of the area is transformed into a cosy artificial ice skating rink for kids.Finally, the place is also surrounded by numerous hotels, restaurants and cafe's as well as exclusive clothing stores & boutiques!

A chilled out square where everyone can enjoy. located between several relevant museums and a classical music venue not to mention near vondelpark ( central park) it is a cool place to hang out meet people from all over . IAMSTERDAM giant 3 d physical logo is there it has been featured in many Hollywood and international films ( Iamsterdam is a promotion slogan for tourism in amsterdam ) . Highly recommended area of Amsterdam. If hungry hop to Albert heijn supermarket under the square, they got many good to go snacks there .

Go here to relax. As a local I go here every week to relax, play some Footbal with the kids and have a drink at Cobra. Square is visited mostly by people who visit the surrounded musea, so the crowd is very different from the regular Red Light District crowd. The square is used for festivities such as Holland Festival and on Kinsgday.
Very nice square. Extremely expensive parking, huge crowds in lines for various museums, tourist cafes and nice green spots.

Really nice zoo - but lacks the "wow" factor. This is a really bug zoo with lost of animals. It's located in. Some sort of a park, which is impressive on it's own. We literally spent half a day there (and were really tired afterwards!).There is also an aquarium in there and some closed places with tropical wildlife roaming freely, some of them you can pet.The downside is that there is nothing out of the ordinary here. No exotic animals and no huge shark in the aquarium or something.Also, they want you to pay 2 EUR for the map :|

Average Park, Annoying People. The park is very nice with some really cool trees. Sadly, the IAMSTERDAAM sign seems to bring the most obnoxious crowd imaginable. People climbing all over the place shouting and not allowing others to take photos of the sign. Also, the sign had several stickers on it which made it look like it is not being maintained.

Musemplein is a great open space with lots of interesting options for the visitor. We love it because we always stay in hotels in the Museum or Vondel Park areas, Museumplein provides us with food, coffees & the famous Chubby Dog from street food stalls; infinite people watching opportunities whilst the local families come out to play, picnic on the benches, walk the dogs and generally make use of this lovely, clean and well tended public space.The location also serves as a hub for numerous trams & buses/hop on/off canal boats etc. so it is practical as well as beautiful.

A check point for tourist or out of extraordinary for traveler?. This is not my first time to Amsterdam but I will pass by this place every time. It is one of the spot gathered tourist from different places. Well, if you are familiar with Amsterdam, I would suggest you to look for other places too. To go beyond the beaten path.

Great area. Visiting a museum or two in Amsterdam is a must, and the museumplein is where to go...Beyond the museums, there's lots of benches and outdoor space, places to eat and drink.Plus there's the I amsterdam sign, the perfect tourist photo spot.

Must visit if the weather is good. Nice area. All the top museums of the city are here. There is a vast open grassy area, nicely decorated with trees and flowers. The famous "iamsterdam" sign is also here. I guess every single tourist who visits the city gets their picture clicked in front if it :)

Europe 2016. A nice stop. Easy to find on all forms of transportation.The Reischmuseum is easy to find and is adequately labelled, but some of the other museums on the plein, Van Gogh, etc., could have better signage for directions. There are lots of eateries and souvenir shops at this plaza. Very clean and safe place. A good distance from the train station, where most transportation services base.
Lovely. Lovely place to visit and the museums are fabulous, especially the MOCO which had Banksy and Warhol when we visited.

Nice area. We walked through here on a nice sunny day in Amsterdam. The buildings are beautiful and provide many photo opportunities. The open grassy area is good for a rest and just sit and take it all in. So many museums and galleries, you could spend days here.

Must See. Great to visit even if you are not going to art galleries. Lovely grounds, near Vondel Park. Great shops nearby with lots of bars and restaurants. Plenty of private galleries too if you want to buy a painting. Recommend Okker Art Gallery in Vizelstraat and Jaski Gallery in Singelstraat but such is the variety you are sure to find one that suits your taste. Spend time in this area sightseeing and relaxing.

Hip area; definite go-to IF the weather is good. The Museumplein is a hip and iconic area of Amsterdam. If it is raining, you will hardly see anyone and it will be too cold to stay outside long, anyway. But if the sun is shining, the grass will be loaded with small groups of picnickers and folks just enjoying the day outside. Note that the cool, sloping grassy roof near (or part of?) the Stedelijk Museum that you can sit and picnic on, too! The local tram stops at the Museumplein, and there is even a grocery store there, too!

Collection of museums. Museumplein is a square with a collection of museums. It contains a nice field, to sit on the grass when the sun is shining and enjoy the view of the Rijksmuseum.
Some small foodstalls are on the square too, to enjoy a small bite.

Many excellent museums in one place. Museumplein (Museum Quarter) in Amsterdam is a home of three most significant museums in the city - Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and Stedelijk Museum. It's strongly not recommended to visit all of them in one day, so you may prefer returning there 2-3 times, if time permits. The atmosphere of the Quarter is really very special. Must visit at least once.
Amsterdam at its best!. So much to do and to see. Don't miss the I'Amsterdam photo. Late ate evening is the best time. Great museums and lovely architecture.

Street food with a buzz. Great little spot for chilling. Pond in the middle of the square surrounded on one side but great little stalls and really lovely street food. Give it a try....great buzz to the space

A Culture hub. One could describe the Museumplein or museum Square as a hub for Music and Culture ( concert hall), Art ( important museums such as the Rijks, Stefelijk and Van Gogh, Architecture and shopping, that is if you have any money left to spend on designer goods, leather bags and diamonds. We found it to be a very lively, popular and busy square with lots of cafes to sit and enjoy pastries/waffles, coffee or natural juices etc etc and watch the world go by.
Green area surrounded by culture. Great choice of museums here, including a Banksy one which I'd like to see sometime. Plenty of cafes to enjoy, fountains and grass to lounge around on.
Nice place to relax in the sun. Such a nice place when the weather is nice. A wide open area with lots of space for everyone! Always something to see or do. The back garden of Amsterdam!

Great place to chill + photo opportunity. We had a family stroll through Museumplein after visiting the Rjicksmuseum. Very green. There is also the iconic IAmAmsterdam sign which you can climb or pose next to.

Great spot to wind down and recharge. The public area around the Museumplein is a beautiful and clean resting place for when you're inbetween museums, or need a break from the bustling city center.Even if you're in the area mostly for the shopping or dining, it will be difficult to avoid standing still for an obligatory photo of the iconic "I amsterdam" sign.

Family stroll night after music festival. . Lots to see and do. Great to people watch, climb the I am Amsterdam sign for a photo opportunity . Loads of food stalls to choose from( not sure if they are permanent as after a big festival) great to sit and watch the street entertainment. Little adventure park for children and all set with the Rijksmuseum in the back ground.

Uit Markt Festival. Our family was staying in Amsterdam near the Museum District during the annual Uit Markt Festival. What an amazing use of the museum plein, for every member of the family. And the imposing facade of the Reijksmuseum in the background just added to it for us.
Weekend music festival . Open air festival with really good artists and atmosphere. Right next to the two major museums and you have grass to sit on with a glass or beer!

Good place to people-watch. After multiple visits to museums in the area, this is where you will want to have something to drink, watch people climb up on the IAMSTERDAM sign, buy souvenirs, and even purchase tickets for various events. Also excellent place to catch trams and buses to other parts of Amsterdam. Mind the bicycle riders!

A square full of art. The biggest square in Amsterdam, for me way better than dam square~ love the views, the logo of I AMSTERDAM is cool. I doubt the reality of the grass in front of the pool haha. It's nice to visit when it's a sunny day! Had a nice picknick!

So MANY options in one square!. Museumsplein holds some of the best Museums in the City. Such as but not limited to: Van Gogh Museum, Stedelijk Museum or the famous Amsterdam sign. You can spend a full day here and you will not be able to cover all museums. My favourite was the Stedelijk which has a huge collection of contemporary art and the Moco which had an exposition of Banksy and Andy Warhol. The Van Gogh museum is usually the most popular amongst tourists which is why you will want to reserve in advance.

It is refreshing!. I loved the vibrance of the place. It was full of people of all ages and colours. The sun was shining and there was a live musician right there.. The big bubbles being blown away.Something happened to the fountain though. It wasn't there and the water was smelly and stale. Rest, the place deserves the 1 time visit and the picture as well.

Amsterdam Museum Square is in the middle of loads of culture. Very spacious, green, well-kept park with places to sit and picknick and surrounded by very important Amsterdam Museums. This 'square' is really a park now and you can go to the Rijksmuseum (with Rembrandts Night Watch), the Van Gogh Museum, the Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam (Amsterdam City Museum, that looks like a giant white bath tub) and the Concertgebouw (Concert building). Underneath the park is a large parking for cars and buses and there is even an underground supermarket in one corner of the park ('Albert Heijn').

Museumplein. A large, lovely open space where several museum (art galleries) live. Each museum is well worth a visit and can take some time, depending on your interest. We booked tickets early so as to plan our days there. Entry to the Van Gogh museum is at set times. All the museums offer fantastic access to paintings, sculpture, jewelry, carvings, etc.Around Museumplein there are plenty of bars, restaurants, Vondel Park and it's right on the edge of the Grachtengordel and entry into the main part of Amsterdam.

So Much To See. This is a very large area which includes the Rijks and Van Gogh Museums and the I Amsterdam sculpture. There is another museum there which we very much enjoyed called MoCo. The exhibitions when we were there included Banksy and Warhol. It is located in a mansion and is on a much smaller scale than their neighbors. It was easy to see all of the exhibits and there was a nicely curated gift shop as well.
Great architecture. Even if you are not wanting to wait in line for the museums, just wandering in around the place and taking in the amazing architecture and layout is worthwhile.

Great Green Space. This is an easily accessible large green space. It is right near the Van Gough Museum and the Anne Frank house. People were out in drones, eating, sleeping, reading, paying sports and just hanging out with their families or friends. It was a very relaxing and familiar environment.

A nice square with the Amsterdam logo in front of Rijks museum. A lot of tourists came here to take the picture with the I AM Amsterdam logo in front of the Rijks museum as you bound to see it with its bright red logo. You can avoid the crowd if u want to take a nice solo photo either during the early hours before the museum start or night time. :p

Large Green Space. This is not a square you would travel to see but given its proximity to many museums you are quite likely to find yourself here at some stage during your stay in Amsterdam. Home to the large 'I Amsterdam' sign the park is usually very crowded and a nice spot to chill out the grass between museums. For a less crowded experience, go to the gardens of the nearby rijkmuseum which are free even if you are not visiting the museum itself.
A place to breath. Your eyes adjust from the dim Museum interios to the natural hopefully sunfilled breathing space that is the green lung of the Museum area
Museum square . Van Gogh museum and some other museums are located on this square. I Amsterdam slogan is also located here, on museum square

This is quite a nice area to walk in and maybe picnic. This area houses all the major museums in amsterdam including the two most famous: Rijks and Van Gogh. There is a lot of open green spaces where people tend to sit and picnic or just chill. One of the nicer areas in Amsterdam.

Happy place to be :). It is an open space where Iamsterdam sign stands tall. It is crowded with tourists all the time for pics. Along with that there are various cafes and many small little live performances keep on happening. It is a good pit stop after a hectic museum visit.

Beautiful square. Eventually, you will go there to have a picture with the the giant climbable iamsterdam (or should you?) well this square is also home to the rijkmuseum, the Van Gogh museum, a modern art museum, and the concertgebouw. It is very near to vondelpark as well.

Check out the food carts. This is just a grassy public park in front of the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh museum, and Stedelijk Museum with a reflecting pool. BUT check out the food carts and other vendors in the park.- Buy the warm Dutch waffles with sour cherries and ice cream. (OMG)- Try the warm Dutch waffle sandwich with caramel in the middle- Try the lemon muffins.

Take a break between museum visits. Large green space between the museums with the "I Amsterdam" sign at the end nearest the Rijksmuseum and the museum shop. Always busy at that end during popular times but lots of grass to sit on all around when the sun shines and your feet tell you it's time for a rest. On sunny days there's an underground Albert Hein supermarket opposite the Concergebouw at the opposite end of the plein from the Rijksmuseum. If it’s time to eat then it's a cheaper option to cafes if you shop there for a picnic, it's well stocked and competitively priced.

Interesting place to visit. It has been described by some as the Museum Quarter of Amsterdam where one can stroll outdoors and enjoy the sunlight and crowds. Surrounded literally by three main Museum Attractions; Van Gogh, Rijks and Stedelijk. Underground supermarket provides supplies for snacks and drinks or even a quick lunch or even a picnic.

very interesting . this is a very good place
we enjoyed very much here
we visit three museum here
we also visit very beautiful lawn
we wish to come again here
due to its amazing charm

Big Crowds. I have been to Amsterdam many times over the past five years, and have even visited two museums. But I had never walked over to see the famous sign. So I did on this trip. The size of the crowd surrounding the sign was a surprise. You can see from my pics, it was impossible to get really any kind of a shot of the whole sign.

Beautiful area to experience all by itself. Fantastic outdoor area to stroll through in-between museum visits. Tip: there's an underground supermarket a few steps away from the Van Gogh museum, right alongside the park. Skip the expensive cafes and head down there to get pre-made lunches, beer, wine, then go hang out in the park!
Nice Place. Huge place with lot of people, good place tobe to start foto-sessions. Many interesting places for taking photos. Very nice!
Easily can spend a day here. You can easily spend an entire day here in this entire area. Awesome museums and can find good cafes in the museum complex itself

A Great Place for Everything Dutch. It is an amazing area. Here are all the main museums of Amsterdam that can teach you about the art and history of this beautiful country. The middle of the Museums Square is a beautiful park where people come to chill, play ball games and have picnics. It is kid friendly as it also has a playground and a skate park. There is a big supermarket nearby to buy anything necessary for a picnic. Great food is also available in the surrounding areas. A good place to hear some great music made by street artists.

Fantastic. What a great setup with the park, fountains and the magnificent museums all in the one area. One HOT day and thousands of people all enjoying themselves. And a fire brigade truck hosing people for fun and to cool us down. Fantastic.
Fun and History. its completely filled by people having lots of fun amidst old palaces. Very large open garden nearby where you can relax
Center of activity!. A lively place with museums all around, a big open park, and cafes. I went there multiple times while visiting different museums.

Smack in the middle of everything good!. The Museum Square has a lot to offer. Have a picknick on the grass (it's quite a large area) and be surrounded by the Van Gogh Museum, The Rijks Museum, The Stedelijk Museumk (Contemporary Art). Underground, so nicely out of view, there is a very large supermarket so you don't even have to bring your picknick food!Yuo can spend all they there museum hopping and relaxing in between.

My favorite area in Amsterdam. This elegant part of town is the home of Amsterdam 's finest museums. I love going to Museumplein because there is always something to do and to see. It's just a few steps from the luxury shopping street P.C. Hoofdstraat, nice restaurants and the Concert hall. There are several tram stops just a few steps from the museums, very practical indeed.

Many Museums line this park-like expanse. The Museumplein, as its name suggests is the hub for many museums including the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum. There is a very nice fountain in fromt of the Rijksmuseum which provides a photo op of the iconic IAmsterdam sign. It is a nice place to sit and relax between Museum visits.

Fantastic area of Amsterdam. Having three world class museums (at least) in one locality is a big plus for Amsterdam (and the same applies to Berlin). The area is easily accessible by tram. It doesn't take long to get there from Centraal Station. And you could take along a picnic and take a break in between visits to each collection, or just sit in the sun for a while. A great place in a great city.
Feel free. Behind Rijksmuseum you find excellent area to just enjoy your day. To eat, to read, to be with your friends or your family. To have a rest between visiting museums.

Nice place to go if it's sunny not so much when it's raining. A huge square, stretching from the Rijksmuseum to the Concertgebouw on the other side.The I Amsterdam sign seems to attract most tourist also because it has the beautiful Rijksmuseum building in the backdrop.On a sunny day it's a nice hangout for half an hour or in between museums.When it's windy or raining, take shelter or you'll get blown across the vast grassy area like tumbleweed.There's nothing much else to do except when you want to go high end shopping because Amsterdam's snottiest street in right around the corner :-) (PC Hooft straat)So yeah, a breather in between walking around Amsterdam or seeing museums but not a real attraction attraction in itself

A superb place to just lay on the grass and rest/take a nap, after a long walk. This is definitely THE rest place in Amsterdam. Plan a day of event and then make your way here to relax, just sit down, lay down, or even take a nap! People respect your personal space (our experience). Just be there to enjoy the sight (beautiful museums all around), and the people (kids playing, tourists walking by, etc.) Also hot dog carts here tend to sell cheaper hot dogs (3 euros) compare to 4 euros per at the Rijksmuseum entrance.

Great place to relax and explore. How great is it to have three world class museums in one place? The are around it is well kept and pretty. The tram stops right beside the Van Gogh and is a must see are on any trip to Amsterdam!
3in1. You are extremely close to 3 museums, that's great. And what is even better is that at thise "plein" you can relax with other people when the weather is good and that is just brilliant!

3 in 1 location.. How handy is it for Amsterdam to have 3 world class art museums in one location. And also how handy for visitors. When the Van Gogh Museum was crowded one day last week we went to the Stedjelik instead and returned to the Van Gogh a few days later after making online timed entry reservations. Nice to have such choices.Also has a nice grassy area to relax in between museum visits.

Lovely place to sit and chill!. Awesome area - really nice to sit in the park or at one of the little food places after visiting a museum/gallery. There was a burger place and a place with veggie/vegan food that we liked. Plus a few little tourist souvenir stalls. Overall though the area is just very pretty, easy to walk between the three galleries/museums and perfect for a lunch break. When we were there, there was an ice rink which we didn't visit but just watching other people skate as you wander through adds to the atmosphere. Would recommend booking / buying tickets if you plan to visit the galleries - saves a bit of queuing!

An Amsterdam tour. . This place in the middle of Amsterdam is a place you can look at the "Rijksmuseum " and the " Concert building ".It's also a place where great events happen.It's a big and green place, sometimes a lot of people are on this place to enjoy together.

Very nice!. Museumplein is the area of the city where the Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh Museum, and the Stedlijk Museum ( modern art) are located. The museums are arranged around a large park. There is a restaurant/cafe there as well as several food stands with tables and chairs for eating outside, and also souvenir stands. We enjoyed visiting the museums and walking around the park area. Several street musicians were performing along the walkways in the park. Beware of bicycle traffic in front of the Rijksmuseum and in the park area. It can be a little tricky crossing the street!

Free electricity for charging mobile devices. At the base of the parasols (patio umbrellas) on the left side of the pool in the museumplein facing the main entrance to the Rijksmuseum there are Northern Europe outlets free to use for mobile devices and/or laptops. Useful for when your battery life is very nearly at it's end.

Lovely!. Museumplein is where the Van Gogh and Rijks Museums are located but apart from that it's a huge park, very scenic, surrounded by beautiful buildings and the location for the now iconic IAmsterdam sign, where tourists love to get clicked. There's also a play area for the young ones, and some eating places as well. A great place for a small picnic, if you'd like. But do not go here on a wet day, unless you're going only for the museums.
The highlight of our stay. We spent the morning here visiting all the sites and it was a great place to stroll around. very peaceful and plenty to see.

Green pasture with a lot of people enjoying the area. Wonderful place, relaxing by just looking at it. If it is not raining you can lay or seat on the benches or on the grass. Surrounded by RIjksmuseum, Stedlijk and Van Gogh Museum, is giving a pittoresque air to all the area.
Enjoy the day here. It is actually a big park, lots of green, free wifi, place to sit-eat. You have opportunity to meet new people, play with them etc.
Museums around !!!. Pleasant place for chill. Rijksmuseum , Stedelijk museum, Van Gogh museum and many others. You can take picture infront of/on the famous Iamsterdam
Delicious place to be!. Lovely to rest after a long walk and visit to the museums around. It's like a park where we can seat and enjoy a lovely day.

Calm Place Near the Art Museums. This is a nice place to stroll and sit down if sunny and there is the large I Amsterdam sign but the best surprise was that on the third Sunday of the month they have the Museum Market there. There were a lot of crafts and interesting items for sale and a number of food vendors which added to our experience.

THE PLACE TO BE. It's not exactly a squire but a space between three major museums of Amsterdam. It's decorated with flowerbeds, green grass and the monumental sign I AMSTERDAM. You can purchase tickets to any of the three museums here in the tourist Information kiosk located among the souvenir booths. It's a meeting place, resting point and people watching spot. On the corner of the modern art museum, there is an underground market where you can buy groceries (local souvenirs are less expensive here than in museums, by the way).

Nice large area to stroll. Similar to the mall area of D.C., where D.C. is by far the most impressive. The Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum are at the opposite ends and children were splashing in the large pool in the middle. Soothing place to rest with a few vendors to offer some refreshment.

Spend an enjoyable day here!. One stop for visiting the major museums and art galleries. The tunnel under the Rijks celebrates the connection between the old city of Amsterdam and the "new" district. Not only are the collections priceless, the architecture is varied across the different instituions, so those on a budget don't have to spend on entrance fees to the museums to enjoy this space. Each institution has a cafe so there are no worries about going hungry. Besides, the grounds make a perfect spot for picnics or child's play. Lots of photo-opportunities!

glorious sunny day in the park. During my visit in Amsterdam, the weather was more than generous. And what a better way than spending it outside in a park. Before or after a visit to the adjacent museums. Everybody's enjoying the sun and having fun. Many activities to keep you going. Come. Relax and enjoy.

An open park at the museum area. The Museumplein is an open space between several museums in the area. A nice place to sit and see people walking and playing during the day. It is accessed by bus and trams. If you like an open big space to stroll around, this one is for you. There are also a few nice restaurants around once you are tired of watching people and walking yourself.

Best part of Amsterdam. It was a sunny glorious day when I was here. So pretty and the touristy-ness didn't bug me as much here as in Dam Square or other places. Mellow, beautiful and full of culture.

Great park close to museums. This is a great public space close to the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh museum and the Stedelijk museum. It is usually full of people relaxing and having fun. Nice place to recover once you have finished visiting the museums. There are booths were you can get sandwiches and ice cream cones at a reasonable price as well.

Starting point of Art tour. Actually I was traveling alone. I did not have much of idea and roaming around this big place. Lots of Museums in and around. Do visit all. I was infact coming back here as a starting point to my next destination. made it easy as a reference point.

Nice place to sit and get your breath back. We sat here and had a picnic while people watching, it's a great place for that extremely busy at the weekend but no shortage of places to buy snacks or ice cream
What a great city park. Huge open area with museums all around it. On a sunny day, just teeming with smiling, happy people. Such a nice park in the city of Amsterdam

I wish every city had a Museumplein!. What a wonderful idea to have great museums and galleries all close to each other. We spent several days in this wonderful space and still didn't have time to see everything!

Wonderful place to relax in Amsterdam. Nice to just picknick or hang out on the grass in the middle of Amsterdam in front of the Rijksmuseum. Beautiful, large and clean (the days we went there, at least). What do you want more? Definitely recommended, especially on a hot and sunny day!

So many museums, so little time!. I'm quite happy that there is so much to see now in Museumplein. I'm a culture vulture, so when I go back this month, there'll be another museum for me to visit. Thank you, Amsterdam, for feeding my soul!

Spent several happy hours here. This is a lovely space with outdoor cafes and many museums - also the now famous I Amsterdam sign. The weather was sunny and it was relaxing to wander around taking photos and consuming coffee between museum visits. If you enjoy art, history, culture or architecture you should visit this area of Amsterdam,

Love this place!. The main attraction of this place is the I am Amsterdam photo spot. However, this expanse also has plenty of spots to take break from touring/walking. It is a spot to stop and enjoy the view, to people watch or dimply to gaze at the water or the flowers. Love this place!
Nice area. This is the area around several museums. There are several restaurants close by. It's a nice area to wander around and sit outside enjoying the weather and people watching.

Lot's of space and tourists. A really big square with spectacular museums alongside. One of the places with most tourists in Amsterdam, but there still is more than enough space to breath easily. Dip your feet into the water of the pool to relax from all the walking or sit in the vast grassfield in the sun.
Museum Museum Museum. As the name suggest this place holds amsterdam's three famous Museums. Easily accessible in Tram and Bus. Nice place to spend time.
The museum quarter. If youre looking for lots to see and do, you can't go wrong with the Museumplein (Museum Quarter). From van gogh to the rijk museum its all here.

Great Area to Explore. We spent a lot of time in the Museumplein as our hotel was nearby. There are multiple excellent museums, some good restaurants, and nice areas to sit outside and enjoy nice weather and people-watching.

Kind of grows on you. Okay, the museums are great. Okay, spectacular. But the park is what we're talking about. Very crowded at the Rijksmuseum end. Much less so toward Concertgebouw. Seems like just another big city square with grass which is nice in itself. But this place is oddly relaxing. A pretty neighborhood around it.
Busy but great. This area is a real touristy area. Great things to see around this area and nice place for a stroll around

Go on a Sunday. We went on a sunny Sunday afternoon just planning to walk around the museum district and enjoy the weather. What we found was a large arts/crafts/food fair with dozens of vendors selling hand made goods and food that was to die for. It was nice to go and not have to worry about the stress of standing in line while watching other people stroll across the grass and enjoy themselves. I would plan a separate day just for the park itself and do it on a day when the market is there.

Enjoy the architecture in the square and hang by the I Amsterdam letters. This square is famous for the numerous museums in the area, but one can also enjoy just sitting in the grass and watching all of the tourists pass by. There are also a couple of cafes in the area and do not forget to take a selfie in from the letters!
The tourist picture spot!. No one misses the photo op! Everyone has to have their picture taken with the I Amsterdam sculpture!

awesome spot and great pictures. loves this area so fun and relaxed and the best sport to get some great pictures of your trip. I enjoyed just sitting in the grass and overlooking everything and of course the must have picture with the IAMSTERDAM sign!

Just a big square. Not much really to say about this tourist crossroads. I live across the street. As it rains everyday in Holland, this green square quickly fills under water which was caused by an engineering flaw. After so many years, they were never able to correct the problem.

Oasis. Great place to stroll in the summer or hang out, especially when the weather is great. Watch the que at the Van Gogh museum, chat with some local artists, play ball with the locals. It is an oasis in an overfilled city

Great spot. This is a great spot to absorb the sights and sounds of Amsterdam. Plenty of lovely monuments, fountains and people to keep you interested. You could walk around or simply sit somewhere and watch all the action. Most of the major museums are in this area.

Make it happen!. This place has an unbelievable amount of things to do and see. So many museums and beautiful scenery outside of these historical spots! Bring some food and drinks, have a picnic out on the super green grass, and then go learn about Van Gogh and his "crazy" life.

Conjunction of museums and the 'I amsterdam' logo! Excellent place!. You cannot miss coming to Museumplein since the 'I amsterdam' logo/landmark is located here. Always crowded with tourists getting photos at the I amsterdam landmark. Rijskmusesum and Van Gogh museum are the highlights here! One can easily spend an hour here just feeling the city vibe near the I amsterdam landmark!

Lovely place for great memories. This is a nice place where you can spend an afternoon. Very beautiful, tulips, fountains, beautiful building and museums around. I Amsterdam sign is also here. Take some time to visit it, it's worth it

Great open space between the museums. This is located between some of the most important Amsterdam museums and is a great place to be when the weather is good. It's quite close to Dam square if you don't mind walking a bit.
Beautiful, relaxing place. This is a big field around many museums in Amsterdam. It's lively and has great views of the Rijsmuseum and the Van Gogh museum. Also nice green areas to walk and rest.

Place to be for museum lovers. This museumplein - a culture hub. Is great to relax and have a picnic (there's is a supermarket next to it to fill a basket) after the variety of museums and concert halls. Its easily accessible via tram. Just poke your head and ask the conductor if it goes to museumplein, most likely it will. (Pre-buy your tickets at central station to avoid hassle).A good center location for museum goers.
We spent an entire afternoon here. We only meant to go for an hour or so but there are food, drinks available for purchase and free chairs and music so we sat, relaxed and just enjoyed the sights.

A great place to hangout. This is where the famous I amsterdam sign is located and all the famous museums are nearby. After a long walk this was the perfect place to relax. Kids have a small playground near by and the small pool facility was really great.

A green park with food trucks. We grabbed a quick bite to eat at one of the food stalls on the side of the park between visiting the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. We observed people sightseeing, enjoying the green space, and allowing their dogs to run. It was a relaxing respite in the midst of the city's hustle and bustle.
A touristic sight place. Nice area to relax on the grass after visiting museums with couple of cafes around. Relaxed and clean environment. I recommend there in a sunny day.
Relaxing. Museumplein is a great place to just take a break & relax in (and maybe grab a snack), whilst visiting the museums!

Great open space. We spent some time here after visiting the Van Gogh museum. Lovely open space, well designed, and the warm, sunny weather helped! Had coffee and dutch apple cake from a vendor and sat people watching for an hour

Museumplein For The Creative!. The Museumplein or Museum Square is the place to go for a shot at getting your photo in front of the most famous I Amsterdam sign. Go early or late to avoid the crowds. The square is so alive with tourists' performance artists, painters, vendors and people watchers. There are gorgeous museums to visit and you must go into the tunnel and watch all the bikes whizzing through. It's positively transcendental!
Excellent for Kids. Great place for kids to let off steam. Great play area, beautifully landscaped. Places for refreshments. The "I Amsterdam" sign was a must have in terms of a photo op.

Worth walking around . If you plan on going to any of the main museums in Amsterdam, you'll inevitably visit the Museumplein. It's worth to wall around, when we were there a skateboarding event was happening on the green, a fun watch. There are a few food carts by the Rijksmuseum, the crepes are overpriced but really delicious!

Music, Art and food. It is a huge park followed by a small water pool with loads of activity happening around. People dance there and then come to relax and spend quality time. It has small eateries which serve delicious burgers and coffee. There are good art museums around this area to explore. Sundays are special as there is a small flea market sort that is organised with lots of good food. Overall, its a nice place to relax and admire the beauty of Amsterdam.

Relaxing. It is really relaxing. I visited Amsterdam twice and they were both winter. Even tho there were people outside with their doga hanging around. People taking pictures. People enjoying their beers. Totally relaxing

Wonderful open space with world class museums and concert hall. The Museumplein makes it as easy as possible to take in the great art and music of Amsterdam. It's a wide, open green space surrounded by gracious 19th.C housing and the place to find the Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh and Stedelijk Museums - and the great Concertgebouw at the far end.Lively atmosphere with people of all ages, many tourists but far more locals. You have a sense that this is one of their favourite places in the city. Good range of cafes and restaurants in the museums, the Concertgebouw and nearby. Excellent, frequent public transport.

Beautiful day. So much to see around here. We went on a beautiful day and spent most of the day sunbathing on the grass around the museumplein. Here is the I am amsterdam sign. Also close to canals tours and lots of restaurants

Amazing concentration of prime world´s art institutions. Such an amazing concentration of top institutions exhibiting the most renowned pieces of art around a square in a middle of a city... Otherwise the place/square itself is a meeting place for a broad variety of people with all kind of various activities, the majority of them just enjoying themselves without caring much for van Gogh and other masters. My favourite there for its relative simplicity is the Stedelijk Museum with its ground floor mixt exhibits per periods...

Beautiful & Relaxing. Museumplein's very aptly named - all the interesting museums are around here. The area in itself though is so pretty that you could be forgiven for skipping the museum lines and soaking in the beauty. Tree lined avenues create a perfect romantic or picnic spot depending on whom you have for company here!

Great place to learn and relax. As you sit on a park bench enjoying a stroopwafel from a local food stand, you see three museums to visit and other visitors posing to have a picture made of themselves by the I amsterdam sculpture/sign. Enjoyed our visit to Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum. Nice green area to reflect on you have just seen.
So many wonderful options.. Open layout accommodates such lovely options. Easy to get to and move about. Plenty of space outside museums to regroup and contemplate your visits.
Museum Plein. Very neat park with water where kiddies can cool off in. Nice cafe's and benches for resting the tired legs
Living place. Beautiful place, full of young people all around, nice to visit in a sunny day. Gives wonderful photos.
Museum area. You got to get to this square to visit most museums in Amsterdam. The square is interesting and there are restaurants and cafes around.
lovely on a sunny day. When the sun is shining it is a great place to stop for a picnic or relax and take in the beautiful buildings.

New to us and wonderful!. We have family in Amsterdam so seeing how the city has knit the 3 major museums together in a people park is great planning and a really wonderful place to see everyone out on a fine sping day.

The square that overlooks some of the world's best museums. This open green space provides the necessary distance to appreciate the architecture of the museum buildings. Of note is the Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam (Modern Art) that looks like an upside down bathtub. On a hot day in summer, the square becomes a sea of people picnicking on the grass. There is a tram stop of the same name located on the west side of the square.
Literally nothing . Go here for the museums, not the square. Of all the places you can sit in the grass this is the least interesting. Just take a short walk to the vondelpark instead

good place to laze around in the sunshine, but gets busy. This contains the I love Amsterdam sign, which was so overcrowded that it was hard to get a good picture. Nice place to sit by the water soaking up the sun, and of course to visit the van Gogh or Rijksmuseum (which has a nice garden which is free to visit) but not much else. A short walk and you have the park. But it had a nice atmosphere.

Ideal place especially in spring. What can I say about the most famous place in Amsterdam. In spring you can lay down and get some rest at the grass or by the artificial pond. The hordes of tourists may interrupt your shooting, so you have to be patient. You can also climb the letters of "I AMSTERDAM" to take a shot. Do not miss it!
Great platz. Large plaza surrounded by museums of all types. Part grass, part gravel. Food kiosks with covered and in the sun picnic tables. Lots seem to be going on with musicians playing.

People watching place. I love this place. I have been there several times, but my favorite was when the Netherlands were playing in the World Cup. They had some huge tv screens on the plein. Thousands of people dressed in orange casually showed up to watch the game. It was so refreshing to see people gathered together so peacefully and relaxed.

Nice place for a walk. This is a big open area surrounded by some of the best museums in the world. Duck pond and Amsterdam sign photo-ops at the center. Decent gift shop with highlights from all the nearby museums inside. Not a must-do, but worth 15-20 minutes of your time.
Beautiful square. Full of tourists, but crazy beautiful and clean!!! Awesome to relax and bike! And take awesome pictures, of course :)
Nice square. It is a little bit touristic, but a very good place to relax, and have some rest if you walk around in the city.
Very pretty, great for relaxing or picnic. We enjoyed eating ice cream out on the square. It isn't too crowded and has a great atmosphere. The surrounding buildings are impressive and beautiful.
Beautiful but crowded. great view to stroll around rijks museun and van gogh museum. However, as expected struggle to take picture alone with the 'i am amsterdam' sign.

Crowded "I am amsterdam". The park is in the middle of all the museums, therefore its nice view. But be prepared to fight through heaps of tourist to take a pic of yourself with the "I am amsterdam" sign. If you are lucky you there will less people taking photos. Can't miss when you are visiting atleast one of the museums.
Cool place to check out. Nice space to walk around and relax. There are tons of museums there as well to go into. And, of course, you can take pictures by the Amsterdam sign.

Beautiful Square!. Just spend a couple of hours strolling through this Square. Its beautiful. But we did enjoy wonderful warm sunshine on our visit. The sign 'I Amsterdam' is located here. So if you want a pic! Buy a big ice cream and just watch the world past by!
Touristy. It is surrounded by a lot of museums. So there are always a lot of people here. The Iamsterdam sign is very popular. There is a central green space where one can relax.

Lots to do any season. Museum plein is more than a square surrounded with museums. Sure, you can have your pick ou of three, but it's also the entrance to the fancy Oud-Zuid neighborhood where the richer and some famous people live, the American consulate is around the corner and so is the large theatre .But moreover museum plein houses a playground where you can take a break with your kids. There's a tea house and even in winter kids are the center of attention because the playground becomes an ice skating place.Do put your garbage in the bins though. Let's keep it neat for the children.
Nice landscape for a walk and photographs. Very touristic area of Amsterdam. Nice place for going for a walk and take photographs, especially with dry weather.

A Big plaza surrounded by Museums!. This in the central plaza that is in the relative center of all the main museums. You can grab food from one of the cafes or eateries in the plaza.. its well manicured and with flowers and tables to sit around and enjoy the hustle and bustle !
Fantastic and full of energy!. This is a delightful area where many come to stroll between the museums or hang out with friends. The I AMSTERDAM letters are wonderful for taking pictures!

Great Place. Well if you want to explore a bit of Amsterdam you have to come here at least once. Museums are great and area is amazing in a spring time. You can grab a coffee there and sit outside next to the fountain.

It's a beautiful place in the middle of amsterdam. It's a beautiful place in the middle of amsterdam that is close by to a lot of museums and the iamstersam sign. It's very nice to have a picnic here!!

Fun place to people watch. To be completely clear, this is a big square that separates a number of the larger museums. I wasn't entirely clear on that before I went. This is also where you'll find the infamous "I am Amsterdam" sculpture that every tourist poses with. (Yes, I did too!)There are usually other things going on in the square, particularly on weekends. When I went, there was a skateboarding expo set up which was fun to watch. It's also not a bad place to take a sandwich and rest in between your stops.Right behind the I Am Amsterdam sign and next to the Rijksmueum is a small garden which you should totally check out. There is a fountain there that is on a timer. It's cool to watch the water display, and if you're quick enough you can jump in the middle and catch the water show from inside the fountain!

A park that links the many museums in the area.. A great place to stroll around and for photography. Can't miss the I AMsterdam letters. Great place for a selfie. The Rijks museum, the Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam, and the Van Gogh museum are all near by. A couple of food shops in the area that offers a chance for a quick bite. The huge reflecting pool allows a spot to chill and people watch. And it's easily accessible via tramps and buses.
A mandatory site visit. In Amsterdam you have to go to that place, although it is not among any of the fantastic museums that are there. Gotta take a picture in "I" Amsterdam "
The square which separates or joins the museums. It's a happening place where you will find mimes and music, fun and frolic as well as a respite from museum eyes.
Museumplein - never disappoints. There is always a hive of activity around the plein and a huge diversity of functions and people milling around. Great cafes and just peaceful and relaxed..
surounded with museums and a concert hall. well worth a visit if in the area the square is well sign posted so easily found with plenty of shops and bars
Museumplein . Lovely square surrounded by museums and concert hall which offers free concerts on Wed. Short walk to the Heineken tour and also a stop for the canal tour boats.
Really neat complex!. This square has a lot of museums! And also of course the Iamsterdam sign. The sign is filled with tons of people so I would go early if you want picture with less people.

in touch of brilliance. At Museumplein you are literaclly within a stone's throw of three world class museums/gallerys. The Van Gogh museum has now been augmented by a wonderful additonal gallery that holds special exhibitions, The rijksmuseum is world class and Stedelijk is also a must see. But too much for one day! Take your time.

City of culture . In Berlin there is Museuminsel. Amsterdam has Museumplein. Great for people who love art. Love modern? Go to Stedelijk. Does Van Gogh make your art heart tick? His oeuvre and his contemporaries are in the Van Gogh. Want to see the Nightwatch by Rembrandt or a Vermeer? Then go to het Rijksmuseum. So many choices! And if you have more time, check out the P.C. Hooftstraat for high end shopping fun or a high tea at the Conservatoriumhotel. Don't forget the "Kodak" selfie moment with the IAmsterdam in front of the Rijksmuseum.

Lovely square. We went here on a lovely sunny day, got some waffles near to the Rijksmuseum and chilled by the Iamsterdam sign. It was busy near the sign and reflection pool, so if you want a good pic with the sign, I would arrive early in the morning. There were cherry blossom trees near the Van Gogh museum as well near the lawn square. They were in bloom, which was really nice. Generally a very pretty, tidy plaza.
the iAmsterdam sign is classic photo op.. pretty setting, but the iAmsterdam sign is classic photo op. It sits in the middle of several beautiful museums.
Christmas visit. Lots of atmosphere, lots going on, lots to see. Good shopping too. Busy but everyone friendly. I have been several times and always feel safe

are you short of time in AMS? minimally get yourself here to understand the museum investment of this country. If the weather outside is grand and you just can't do a museum, enjoy this beautiful 'plein' and begin to grasp the history and worthiness of their investment in art and culture. Grab a bit to eat and enjoy the gardens, the people and the opportunity for the world to gather and exchange ideas about how we have come to this point in time.

Pet Friendly Walking!. I got to walk through this area and it was great. Lots of repairs and construction but no worries. I got to experience many new things and the people are very friendly and so are the other dogs.

The Best!. This area encompasses many classic Amsterdam museums, hotels, canals, parks, restaurants, bars! I recommend that you look it up on Trip Advisor for more detailed information, and maps. Most of it is walkable!

Beautiful but crowded square. Don't expect to get a good picture with the iamsterdam sign unless if you come very early in the morning or late at night. Great place to take pictures of the Rijksmuseum.
Perfect spot. The location is ideal, it's great to have so many museums in one location and it's a fantastic spot to get a photo for a tourist.

So much to see. Home to the three main museums of amsterdam, Van Gogh, Rijks and Stedelijk museum, the name speaks for it self, we dedicated a lot of time to this neighbour hood as there is so much to see and a lovely place to visit.

great place to be outside. Lots of museums in this area and also a great place to sit outside and enjoy the view and take pictures. The IAMSTERDAM sign is here. If you want to take pictures. We also went to the house of bols tour here and had a few drinks :)

Nice open area. We went in December so the area felt very festive with mini stalls and the ice rink. The classic I Amsterdam sign is also nice to have your photo taken but in the middle of the day you will be surrounded by plenty of people climbing everywhere trying to get a shot! even in the heavy rain!

Just behind the Museaum, fun park paddling pool or ice rink in winter. Do not miss this out see review under the Museum. Much fun, free,very open space,,and enjoyable to be amongst the crowds having coffee or just relaxing.

Beautiful place!. It's in front of Rijksmuseum.
This is the place where is located de famous "I Amsterdam" sign.
It's always crowded. It's hilarious to watch people taking funny group pictures in front, above or inside the "I Amsterdam" sign.
Great place to relax before or after visiting the nearby museums.

Museum Square - a must see both day & night!. Large gathering area for people. 'I Amsterdam' sign is there to take your photo with. As others have said, night is best for a sign without others around. The large reflecting pond had large planters of blooming tulips during our April visit... so beautiful! There are always vendors selling touristic goods and food/drinks. It is a festive and busy square for a relaxing, having a picnic, or people watching.

Largest square in Amsterdam, go see it before it is built full.. Amsterdam suffers from agoraphobia, i.e. it fears open spaces. Look at Leidseplein, Frederiksplein, Rembrandtplein (huh are those squares?), even Dam Square. In the end they all get used and filled with statues, commercial stuff, or even new buildings, like it happens to the last example in this row: Stadionplein. Museumplein is relative open space, with beautiful view on the four large art temples here: Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh, Stedelijk and Concertgebouw. Although, the view from Rijksmuseum downward is spoilt by the ugly letters 'Iamsterdam', that attract thousands to make stupid souvenir pictures. On the side of the square there is a row of tourist kiosks and in winter large part of it is covered with a kitschy ice rink. But the grass is nice and the atmosphere friendly.

Free Park with big sculptures, outdoor dining and of course, the "I am Amsterdam" sign. It requests that you do not crawl or walk on the letters....but that won't stop the crowd from crawling around on the "I Am Amsterdam" structure. You will want to also. Little cafes, outdoor shops and lots of dogs, segways, and people taking selfies. Of course you want to go and if you are headed to any of the great museums, you will stumble into this space. It is free and has a great energy. Just be mindful of all the activity and uneven steps. Beautiful day or night - much more active during the day.
Attractive open space between the museums. Nice place to hang out and rest your tired feet and have a snack. Good location in the heart of the city and close to the turist attractions.

Go at night - no one is on the sign!. Beautiful square and outdoor location just to sit - even in the rain. This central square is between several museums and very close walking to several others. The most popular attraction is the Iamsterdam sign, which can get fairly crowded with lots of people on it. We happened to be walking by around 8 pm and there was NO ONE at the sign, and it was lit up!
I AMsterdam.... Nice place to stroll and to take photos. It felt good to just roll down the slopes next to the Stedelijk.
the best place for a picnic. Arrived into museumplein on a beautiful sunny warm day and it was busy busy busy. Lots of families and friends out enjoying the good weather.

Go take a pic at the I AMSTERDAM sign. Museumplein is a large open, free area around the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum. There is a large I AMSTERDAM sign that every single tourist must take a photo in front of. There are plenty of cafes lining the plein.

Great place to soak up the culture!. This square is so lovely. A big I Amsterdam sign dominates one end providing a brilliant photo opportunity. The bikes disappearing through the arches of the historic rijksmuseum is a sight to behold and so Dutch! The fountains, ponds, lawns all give a lovely setting for the many museums and it is just a lovely place to hang out for a drink, spot of lunch or just to soak up the culture!

Free and beautiful space. This is the area in front of the Rijksmuseum and the I AMsterdam sign. It has a nice park (Vondelpark) in the area so you can sit outside and enjoy Amsterdam. Great for people watching as well.
interesting. This is different kind of museum, with big pictures inside, or sculptures. Different perception of art. In one room, you can paint also and stick your ''masterpiece'' on the wall.

A must-visit on a clear day. Visited during Spring and was blessed with stellar weather. Despite the throngs of people, this affords tourists an opportunity to take photos with the massive "I heart Amsterdam" - an obligatory souvenir for anyone visiting this city. Nestled between the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh so a stop here is almost inevitable for any first time tourist.

Lots of activity!. Aside from the museums, it is also place to just sit and watch the tourists. The little park by the Riks has a fountain you can stand in the center of and it was so much fun watching everyone. You can also get a coffee there.

Jump in the fountain.. There's a dancing fountain which if timed right you can actually jump inside the fountain. Exciting and lots of adrenaline because if you don't time it well, you could be spending the day very wet.

A place to relax. This place is great to relax between visits to the museums. In the area there's the famous I Amsterdam sign (almost impossible to take a picture without having somebody else in the frame as well). There is also a cafe so you can drink a coffee. Hard Rock Cafe is a few minutes walk from there. You can take tram lines 16 or 24 from Amsterdam Centraal to get there.
Spacious, relaxing. Good area to sit and relax for a few minutes after exploring the musuems. Good market on Sundays with plenty of fresh food trucks offering plenty of of choice.

Happening area. A massive public space, home to Rijks, Van Gogh and the Stedelijk museum, which are a must see when visiting Amsterdam, also within the grounds is the I Amsterdam sign, which is very popular with tourists climbing all over it and photos with.

Great place to be on a sunny day. When you visit the Rijksmuseum, you should also visit this park which is allways busy on a sunny day and little restaurants where you can have lunch or tea. Children love to play with the fountain in front of the museum.

Nice place for a break. There are a few food stands off to the side with seating for a quick, but relaxing bite to eat. The museumplein is a very pretty place to roam around a bit, and to take pictures at the iconic Iamsterdam sign.

a green area of happiness. After the PC Hoofstraat (trendy shopping street) I advise you to walk there and stroll around the street and sit on the park benches. When sunny it will make you extremely happy to be there.
a must. Even just lying on the grass was wonderful. beautiful square surrounded by several museums, great view!
Beautiful square near museums. Beautiful square near key Amsterdam museums. It's good bonus if you are visiting one of the museums.

A most go place in Amsterdan.. Big area with lots of museuns around! Whas really nice go to Amsterdan and if you like museums this is the place! You will find the most important and big museuns there and if you go during the winter ther is also an ice ring near the Rijsmuseun. If you don't wanna go for museums you can seat at the grass and enjoy the day.

A bit of everything. A grassy field surrounded by 3 great musea (Rijksmuseum, van Gogh and Stedelijk), the Concertgebouw, Koster Diamands, the US consulate, numerous cafes and tourist traps, ice skating in the winter, etc. Underneath are a parking lot and supermarket which has a fabulous supply of picnic food.For the very rich the surrounding area is full of upmarket boutiques.

all things together in a close area.. i stay close at this place ,and meet many tourist from all over the world.the square is nice and big ,you can see the rijksmuseum and the van GOGH museum as well.you have a famous shopping street nearby ,and the vondel park.the is allso a music hall,and mostly for classical music.mine advice is for your all,walk arround ,and it is easy to get there with public transport

One of the things that makes Amsterdam special. In addition to gathering some great museums, this space housing them is beautiful and friendly. On a nice day (like the one in April when we visited) there are people sitting in the sun, drinking wine or coffee in the outdoor restaurant, taking photos in front of the huge IAMSTERDAM sculpture, or playing in the fountain in front of the Rijksmuseum. Amsterdam is a city that invites you to kick back and take time, live at a slower pace than other big cities, and this is one of the places to do it.

A good open Cosmopolitan area. The 'Square' or 'Park' where the 3 largest Museums of Amsterdam are found.Lovely open area, with a tidy pond and loads of large pots of various types and varieties of Tulips. Nice cafe (don't miss the Porridge breakfast. It's a delight). The museums, are, like all Museums are, very crowded. Queues to enter the Museums are long and boring. From the front of the 'Park' you can catch any means of transport to take you anywhere in the City. Beware of the bicycles, they have their dedicated 'paths' and you enter them at your own risk. On the other side of the main road there is a plethora of cafes and Restaurants.

Plan your trip so you catch the markets on museum square.. We were just plain lucky to be there on our first day for the museum market. A great arts and craft market with non-tourist items and pretty good prices (for the medium to great quality). Also ate one of the nicest burgers I have ever even as my first taste of local food (there are lots of burgers in Amsterdam)Also surrounded by several museums so you will end up here if you want see see of visit the major museums.

So much to see, so little time.. It's clever to put all the museums in one big square, problem is each one needs a huge chunk of time to give it justice. Lots to do and see outside the museums too. The day that I was there a Korean TV crew was collaring tourists to wear sunflower hats and pose on a giant vase in imitation of the famous Van Gogh painting - you can't make stuff like this up!

Fab area - lots of attractions. Our hotel was a short walk from the Museumplein area - there's lots of museums and things to see. Really nice area.The open spaces and green fields are lovely to relax about in and enjoy, especially if it's sunny!Would definitely visit the area again.

Get your picture taken in front of the Iamsteram sign. very pretty park next to many places to visit. well worth visiting here to get your picture in front of the I Amsterdam sign. (along with Hundreds of others) bring a snack and sit in the park and enjoy all the sights.
Tulips were gorgeous!. We spent a day in the museum district in April. The plantings were gorgeous as the tulips were just in bloom. Loved it!!
Great for people watching. My grown daughter and I wandered around there after visiting Rijks. Always something going on, pop-up kiosks, food etc. great view of Rijks, Van Gough, convenient to tram
Good place to spend an hour. Great view of Rijksmuseum and across a park to the concert hall and van Gogh museum. The I Amsterdam sign is here and very popular.
Lively place. It is a lovely place specially during the sunny day.Can have picnic there.Nice to go with the family.good place for taking pictures and lot of museum close by
nice park. This is a lovely park in between museums, grab a sandwich and a drink and sit down for a relax moment

Gorgeous park in Amsterdam. What a great park and place to relax, people watch, and visit the museums. Walk along the side streets and see the many Embassies. Lot's of shops and cafes also in the area.

Photo Op for sure. I suppose this is where most of the photos of Amsterdam are taken. The giant city letters are spelled out in front of the Ryjksmuseum. There is a huge grassy area, plus an elevated grassy area with steps (a grocery is located at one end, so you can grab a quick bite and have a nice place to sit and enjoy the sun).

Plenty to see and do, and free wifi. Museumplein is a great area to walk around, and especially lovely on a sunny day. Great to be near the major museums, and there are also plenty food options nearby. Free wifi in most areas too.

Museum quarter situated between three of the cities top museums.. Museumplein is a museum quarter in Amsterdam, where you find a large public space situated between three of the cities top museums, the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and Stedelijk Museum. This pubic square includes a large reflection pool, the iconic 'I amsterdam' sign, near to the Rijks, an area of souvenir and food stands and plenty of open green space for those seeking to get off the city streets. During our recent visit in late March, the trees remained bare of leaves, leaving Museumplein much less attractive compared to warmer months of the year. This reduces the appeal of spending time here at this time of year. However, we still enjoyed having a quick bite to eat at the foodcrib stand at Museumplein and being outside for a bit in between museum visits. Tip: For museum goers, there is a Museum Shop near the I amsterdam sign that is jointly operated by the Rijks and Van Gogh Museums. Here you can buy entry tickets to both and skip the very long queues that form at both when attempting to buy tickets at the museums' main ticket sells counters.
Nice green park.. Large expanse of grass in front of the Rijksmuseum. In morning people exercising their dogs. Later filled with young people exercising the right to be obnoxious, slovenly, pests.
Beautiful place. I've visited this place many times and for a some reason I like this place, last year I was exited by skateboard event.

Hans Brinker Look Out!. On New Year's eve, Dec. 31, 2015, we went ice skating there. The ice is not the greatest, but it was quite an experience ice skating outdoors in the cool Winter air. There is a pub there, too, and had a good time...
Busy but beautiful. A great area where a range of museums are accessible. While I was there in Febraury there was an ice rink. Great location for Amsterdam photographs.

Photo opportunity . This area is nice to relax in when the sun is out, there is a big grass area to have a picnic on or read your book. It is quite a busy area though so if you're not good with crowds I wouldn't stay around for too long. You will find the "i am Amsterdam" letters here they are very popular. There is actually another one of these signs near the opera if you are ever going that way I'd just wait and get your photos there where there will be no one else in your photo.
Beautiful area. This is a beautiful area with wide open areas and three museums. Also the I Amsterdam sculpture is located here for pictures. Upscale shopping within two blocks of this area.

Must See!. Beautiful area to visit with wonderful museums. My daughter and I enjoyed the main museum and it's dancing fountains. Take a picture in front of(or on top of) the letters spelling out, "Amsterdam". Not sure if there is a schedule but we happened upon a live band playing on the outdoor stage across the street from the main museum.

IAMSTERDAM Letters!. Museumplein has IAMSTERDAM Letters where you can literally climb upon the letters.. sleep, sit, dance, pose.. whatever you want & click number of snaps with these letters! Extremely relaxing place.. loved the atmosphere!
Nice morning walk. Nice morning walk with very few people. Gets crowded in the afternoon and evening. Nice tulip display.

Most pleasant walk amid expressions of culture. Taking a stroll I entered the esplanade following the hordes of people of all ages into the bicycle "avenues" through the RijksmuseumWas impressed with the beauty of the ensemble of architecturally significant museum structures set in a park setting with people basking in the sun and biking.Worthwhile to take a stroll, sit down and read or maybe visit one of the museums or art exhibits.

A great place to hang out in between museum visits. This is where the "I amsterdam" sign is located. It has a small playground where children can burn some of their energy. We just happened to be here during the "tulip festival", so there were lots of tulips in and around the pool area. Great photo-op.
Amazing square. Amazing square with 3 great museums.The space is beautiful but with lots of tourists..Here you can find the well known sign I amsterdam :)
Great place in the heart of the city. Nice to chill-out in the centre of Amsterdam and its main spectaculair museums. Relax on the grass and let the culture sink in
Fun area to hang out and observe!. Lots of families, friends, kids running around having a blast. Nice place for a stroll and to relax.
People Everywhere. A great place to take photos and just enjoy the Dutch Culture. Shops and restaurants all in walking distance. A lovely place to just spend the afternoon and just walking ...

Everything in one place. The Van Gogh and the Rijksmuseum are all here, as well as the famous I Amsterdam sign. Catch a tram from the Centraal Station, and be prepared to walk! The plaza is large and it takes some time to walk from one museum to the next. Bring a rain hat in the spring! (An umbrella is too awkward in the museums, so wear a rainproof coat and a foldable hat instead.)
Nice place to rest up. Nice cafes where you can take a break. Prices are a bit above the not so touristy places. With so many tourists about , its a good idea to keep your bag close.
I amsterdam. The sign as well the museums is incredibly busy! But you always can take a few photos.van gogh museum just a few meters from there ;)

Where you can find Iamsterdam. When you are exhausted from all the museums. You can stay there a while and relax. There are small shops where you can buy coffee or something to eat. If it is sunny, it is good to sit on a bench. Even if it is raining you can take a quick photo, but be aware the place is crowded and it is not possible to take a photo with Iamsterdam sign alone.

Museumplein. Arrived onto museumplein on a beautiful sunny warm day and it was busy busy busy. Lots of families and friends out enjoying the good weather. IAmsterdam letters in situ infront of the rijksmuseum, couldnt get near it for a decent picture, so go as early as possible. Streetfood vendors selling really good food, FoodCrib burgers were delicious and worth the 6euro.

Museums area. Big area where there are main museums such as Van Gogh, Rijksmuseum, Stedeljk.Come early at the morning for the I AMSTERDAM letters so there is less people and you could make a great photo :)

Must go for the photo. In front of Museums and there are a sign " IAMSTERDAM". Lot of people go to there to take a picture. Some of the kids climb up to the letters and play in the park. Some people sitting beside the pond for relax.
Lovely wide open area. Lovely park area in the middle of the major museums. There's a little market and a few cafes. Amazed at the supermarket under the park!

Museum's quarter, great fun. children's playground nearby. Children's rating 3.5/5. In this huge square you can find the Van gogh Museum, the Stedelijk Museum and the Rijksmuseum within 3 minutes from one another. Also in between them, a nice park with a fountain, the famous big "I amsterdam" letters, a cafe and a small children's playground. One of the few ones we found in parks in Amsterdam. Easily accesible by bus or tram or even walking from Vondelpark or Leidseplein Square. It is a nice walk with children and the playground is worth a stop for them to play in it (aimed for bigger children though)

Got to be done!. Must have of Amsterdam - get your picture in front of the iAmsterdam letters. We went in the day time and was heaving...would definitely recommend going back at night - we had it to ourselves!

Nice big field for picknick and 3 museums plus concert hall aside.. The museumplein lies next to the center of Amsterdam but is not crowdy and gives pleasure at any type of weather, when the sun shines have a nice picknick before going to one of the 3 famous museums alongside, The Rijksmuseum for Rembrandt and other Dutcg masters, or the van Gogh Museum entirely dedicated to the painter or the Stedelijk Museum for modern art in all its appearances. When the weather is not good, just go to the museums and look for a nice restaurant afterwards.

Center of museums and I'm AMS sign. This area is basically between Rijk & VanGaugh museums. Nice little play area for children to enjoy and I am amsterdam sign is just opposite to Rijk, Easily accessible by trams 1/2/5
Nice park. Got to get your pic in front of the big letters. :) The rest of the grounds are nice enough. Tulips were just starting to bloom.

Brilliant ice skating rink in the Winter!. I went in mid Feb with my group of friends and this was one of the highlights! I loved going ice skating here and then settling down after with a nice hot Chocomel! Definitely will visit again!

Green and crowdy. The greens beside the museumplein is very nice and we had clear weather which helped a great deal.
On the other hand, it was crowdy, which made is very hard to take nice photos.

Nice place to have a picnic on a sunny (and dry) day. Right between the Rijksmuseum and Van Goch there is a piece of quiet in the middle of the city. There is a supermarkett (Albert Heijn) just by the Stedelijk museum where you can grab snacks and beers and enjoy the view to the IAmsterdam sign.

Go for the IAmsterdam sign. This isn't really a "thing to do" but is an obligatory photo opportunity for us tourists :) Museumplein is literally museum grounds, meaning it's the area where there are several museums around it, so it's more just a space. You'll already be passing through here if you have any of the major museums on your itinerary (Van Gogh, Rijksmuseum, Stedeljk...). A tip for the IAmsterdam sign... if you arrive early before starting your museum visits (we arrived between 9-9:30am to visit the Rijksmuseum), there is far, far less people crowding the sign. If you try to get a picture when you're finished with your museum visit, it'll be crowded by 11am for sure.

The place of 'I Am Sterdam'. I was looking for the place where it is written 'I Am Sterdam'. I asked it to a shopkeeper near the the Central Railway station of Amsterdam. She said it is too far! Actually it is 30 minutes walk from the station, otherwise it is wise to take a tram from the Central station or from Dam Square. Rijksmuseum is also situated in this area. This is a huge museum too. very crowded area. It is better to visit it on weekdays rather than weekends.

A Must, a Crowded Must. Everyone who goes to the city simply has to get a picture in the museum square. I took the opportunity early in the morning when there were fewer people around and explored the area with a friend of mine. Would really recommend for nayone just as long as you make sure there aren't too many people about.

Busy, pretty area. The sign is incredibly busy, might get in quite a few photos if you stand near it, right by the Rikjmuseum, which was great fun, lovely flowerbeds/fountain area to the side serving tea, coffee and cakes. Food stands around, market like stalls, lots of grass, people playing football. A nice area, would definitely recommend a visit for a wander and maybe a bite to eat.
ok. Lots of people, lots of grass .... nice, I like that part of the artificial lake .. letters are cool :) All museums near ... nice

Stopped for icecream and tea. We had a lovely cup of tea and ice-cream from one of the mini cafes. Sat and watched the goings on. Didnt get close to the i Amsterdam sign because the sun was finally out and everyone was taking advantage. Will try again tomorrow!
A must for first timers in Amsterdam. This place is a must for first timers in Amsterdam. Lots and lots of tourist here. At least get a photo in front of the famous Amsterdam sign.

Super busy! . It's here you can have your picture with the famous 'I Amsterdam' sign.
Because of this and all the local attractions it was packed.
In the nice weather it's great to sit on the grass and chill out for a bit.
Loads of nice cafes nearby.

Good for the craft stalls on Sundays. This is where you find all the main museums but it is a delight on Sundays too, when they have craft stalls selling some unique items. Look out for Du Bonheur, they sell great lamps made of old fine china and pottery teapots, cups plates and saucers.
Great Central Location. Great central location to several museums. We walked from here all the way to Amsterdam Centraal and saw lots of wonderful sights.

Convenient. There are 3 major museum in the Museumplein : Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and the Stedelijk Musuem. Each museum has their own shop. Also, there are lots of restaurants around. You can spend a whole day in this area. Albert Cuupstraat is just 10 mins away by foot.

Very crowded. It is a fun place to hang out. It is always super crowded except 9.00 AM in the morning and you'd be lucky to get some nice pictures clicked. It is a relaxing place to spend the evening and observe all the surrounding activities.
Nice Area. By the museums, has some food and shopping places near by. Nice place to stroll or sit and enjoy a cup of tea
Close to most museums. Museumplein is a well maintained square by the rijksmuseum and the museum of modern art,loads of trams stop there,nice to walk about and have a coffee if weather permits.

Hard to miss...... All the most popular Musea (Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum) plus Concertgebouw and Stedelijk Museum are to be found here. Furthermore there are the iconic huge "IAmsterdam" letters in front of the Rijksmuseum. Everybody seems to need a selfie on those letters. Like the T-shirt: been there, done that!The square is a strange mixture between park, festival square and empty space. It was the black hawks landing place when Obama visited and the helicopters almost blew out the antique windows from the Rijksmuseum at that occasion. There is a large Albert Heyn supermarkt and a huge garage under the square.
