So many museums all in one area.. Museumplein is easily accessed by a number of trams.When in Amsterdam, of course, you will have purchased your 'Museum Kaart' which allows you not only quick entry access but also saves you plenty if you plan to spend more than two days in Amsterdam.I would start off at Van Gogh, the earlier the better, as they have a ridiculous queuing system, even if you have a museum card. Then move onto the RijksMuseum. Time for lunch. Don't eat at Van Goghs - the cafe at the RijksMuseum is much better.If you have time visit the Stedelijke and if you are not totally 'museumed out' then visit the Diamond Museum on your way back to the tram.

Museum lovers' paradise. The Museumplein represents an area or square in Amsterdam where one can find the most important museums in Amsterdam all within walking distance. The most important of all is the Rijksmuseum, the National Museum of Netherlands which covers history, arts and crafts and is a good clearing house of Dutch history. The museum also has a sizeable collection of Rembrandt's work. Note that this museum has the same architect as the Central Train Station of Amsterdam. Next in line is the ever popular Van Gogh Museum where one can always expect a long queue for entry just because it has the biggest collection of the finest works of the painter including the Sunflower, The Yellow House , Irises, his self portraits etc etc. Then there is the Stedelijk Museum that specializes in modern arts collections. The Diamond Museum on the other hand is a Lady's delight. Prepare to spend the whole day here if you can manage to cover them all without sore feet.
Chilled. Atmosphere to the area loads of amazing galleries that will appeal to all tastes. High quality shopping close by and a generally relaxing feel to the area.

Lively. Prior to the renovations the space felt underutilised. It's still being revamped but there's a whole new feel to the area and the grass is full of young people playing running about and enjoying the area
Nice place for pictures. Emblematic place in Amsterdam, good for pictures and museums. Nice place, you can access by either walking or tram. A must go in Amsterdam

Great spot!. Beautiful spot to soak up the lively multicultural atmosphere that prevails in Amsterdam. Visited yesterday morning with my daughter and the place was buzzing. All the main museums are located in this area apart from Anne Frank house. It is dominated by the stunning building which houses the Reiksmuseum. The iconic Amsterdam sign is located in front of this museum. The gardens are just beautiful. Lovely location for a picnic lunch on one of the seats that are dotted around the area.
Very nice, especially in the summer. This is a very nice and relaxing area of Amsterdam. If you are there in the summer, make sure to relax on the park lawn. De-stressing.

Beautiful. What a beautiful location and the market was on when we visited (Sunday) so that was even better to have a look around and buy a few bits and bobs (mainly tasty foods). The Rijksmuseum is just a beautiful building and the gardens around here is just fabulous. Well worth the visit!
Worth the visit. Accessibility is a breeze. You can take tram to go here. Two museum located next to each other. Great open space for outing, taking photos, as well as enjoying the weather.

A perfect place to experience the lively-hood of Amsterdam.. Here is the place where young and old come together and relax and enjoy real Amsterdam. With the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and many more.
so fun!. very fun seeing all the locals and tourists gathering around on a beautiful sunny day! while it was crowded, everyone was friendly and cheerful - just a fun atmosphere
Busy but a must . This is one of the most visited parts of Amsterdam and well worth a visit. A great park to sit in, lots to see and do and of course the iAmsterdam sign

Worth a Visit. A large square with great museums and other attractions around it. Some Embassies are also nearby so it's an elegant area to visit. The I am Amsterdam sign is in front of the Rijksmuseum and is always full of people. I would recommend getting there really early or late at night to avoid any crowds.

Everybody Wants Their Photo Taken Here. This outdoor space between museums is a popular fresh air area. The Iamsterdam sign the backdrop to constant photos. There is seating, and a play area for children. Also a skateboard park.
The real centre of Amsterdam. Surrounded by magnificent buildings, this green esplanade is perfect to chill out or to take this pictures you will send to your friends by WhatsApp.

Great meeting point. The museum triangle green space surrounded by three major museums and a few minor ones. Location of the iamsterdam sign. Many places to grab a snack and many places to sit and watch the flows of people.

Make sure to get that picture.. . I'm not sure why the Museumplein is an "attraction".. Does anyone go there without visiting the museums?
Of course, while you're there, you need to take a picture at the I Amsterdam sign. Apparently, if you don't have a picture next to the sign, you weren't really there.
Awesome. Couldn't decide what to do first, but you can't go wrong whatever you decide. Just make sure you have time to do it all. When in Amsterdam, don't miss this.

The Letters are fantastic... Great photo opportunities!!!. For someone who loves taking photos this is a great location for that and also homes to the most famous art museums. The 'IAMSTERDAM' letters are great for fun photos and with the sun out the backdrop of the Rijksmuseum looks amazing. A great location to chill and relax as well as grab a snack/drink and people watch. A must do in my opinion!
Great place for walk if you are lucky to get sun. Nice place for a walk among museums and Concert hause. Best enjoyed during rare sunny days. Quite many people around.
Live your life. It was an amazing time there. The lively park and the playground, and also the food there!!! OMG a must seen place!

Famous and busy place. This is a very famous place because of the i amsterdam letters, and the museums, so you will definitely see a lots of tourists there. But if the weather is nice, it's a good place to walk around.
Museumplein. A beautiful place with a lot of tourists and if you choose to came here in winter you can find an ice rink right in front of " I Amsterdam".
Worth it. A brief trip here to capture your photo with the iamsterdam giant letters. There's also ice skating (at least in February!)

On a Sunny Day -- just perfect!. On our last day in Amsterdam, it was warm and sunny and we had time to spend wandering about in this beautiful setting....sitting in chairs and enjoying the scenery and the company of people from the city. Surrounded by flowers and fountains and the laughter of children...just a perfect way to spend a few sunny hours.

Spacious *but very crowded* park area near museums. If you love museums (or you just want to get a sense of some of the big galleries of Amsterdam) you'll certainly end up here. It is crowded with school and tour groups but also quite fun and friendly. You'll see lots of people trying to get their 'unique' photo opportunity with the IAMSTERDAM sign and you'll see mamas and papas with little children chasing pigeons, oldsters taking in the sunshine and musicians sharing their talents. It's a nice walk through for getting a sense of one side of AMS.
One of our favorite areas. Great to walk around. Watching people from every country. Dogs running, kids playing soccer. The I Am letters. Very peaceful at night with great picture opportunities.

I am Amsterdam. Nice spot and square surrounded by Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum. You can enjoy your coffee outdoor and also complete one of the main touristic attractions in Amsterdam while having photo with/on/in/out Amsterdam sign.

Lovely attraction. Even if you go only for the big attractions -the Rijks and Van Gogh museums you are in for a special day in your life !You won`t see this art in other places and by all existing measures these are high in the Pantheon of world of art !So go ahead , enjoy some of the most beautiful sights and things Amsterdam \ Holland has to offer and you`ll understand why the world loves this city
The place tio be. This is the museum's fans heaven.I visited here Rijkmuseum and Diamond museum but there are at least another two museums to visit:Van Gogh museum and Stedelijk museum.
Near to Rijks Meuseum. A nice place to visit Once... Near to Rijks Meusem...Amsterdam - the work is key attraction for that special "pose" and post on social media...

Make sure you go early!. My girlfriend and I went here around 5PM and it was PACKED with tourists trying to get a selfie with the I Amsterdam sign (us guilty of being one of them). We returned a few days later around 9AM and it was empty, with no one around we took in the scenery and enjoyed the view of the Rijksmuseum in the background. Do not be worried if you don't have time to go, there is ALSO an I Amsterdam sign outside the Schiphol Airport!

This would be fun in nicer weather. I'm not sure what the attraction is for having your photo taken by the IAmsterdam letters is, but there were a lot of people doing that. We were in the plaza because we were visiting 3 of the museums around the perimeter. I'm sure this would be a lovely place to hang out in nice weather / winter in A is cold & rainy.

Big Concrete square in middle of museums. This is the square around which are situated several of the major Amsterdam museums - the Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh, the Stedelijk and another I cannot remember!

So busy!. We did not go to any of the museums around here, and to be honest we only came here for a photo in front of the I Amsterdam sign! It was as expected, although there were so many people it was hard to take a decent photo!

The Centre. The attraction point is "I amsterdam" writing and you should fight to stand a letter alone to get a photo :) the park is quite well, people meet and have fun at the outdoor. Also you can see long lines (but well organised) on the doors of museums.

A modern plaza surrounded by museums. A lovely modern plaza on the outskirts of central Amsterdam, Museumplein is certainly a place many tourists visit, though there's not really much point in visiting unless you're passing through on the way to one of the 3 museums on its edges. My partner and I visited in March, and each time we crossed the plaza it seemed to be rainy and very windy. If you're travelling during the the colder periods, make sure to take your umbrella with you, there's not a lot of cover!

Great place to people watch. Love it here, it's so relaxing and a great place to people watch. The weather was a bit hit and miss, so when the heavens opened we sat in the cafe and had a lovely coffee. Would definitely recommend a visit

So. many. people.. This was a fun place! This is where the IAMSTERDAM (very hard to get a picture of this without people climbing on top of them!) Lots of people. Lots of people taking selfies. I'd imagine this would be a place where locals meet up to relax.

architecture and people watching. Yes, the art inside the museums are lovely but the outside area is just as great on a sunny day. There are usually at least one or two performing artists entertaining near the museums, young couples kissing on the grassy roof top of the parking garage, dogs playing and Frisbees being tossed about in the field. With cafes and kiosks selling refreshments all around it is a lovely park to relax in and take a break from your itinerary.
Where in the world so much culture in one spot?. Three top museums on one green square. Beware of the bicyclists: they are part of the Dutch experience.

Cant miss it - if you go to look at Rembrandt. On the way to the Rijksmuseum, you cant miss it - if you go to look at Rembrandt. Too cold when I was there in February, but I have been in summer when it is pleasant

Beautiful but BUSY. Truly a beautiful little area to just wander and take it all in. Very clean and so much to look at. It gets very very busy near the famous I AMSTERDAM letters. Tried and tried and tried to to get a photo but it was impossible. Kids climbing all over the letters and people trying desperately to get their own photos. Eventually gave up. Didn't make me think any less of this place though =)

Very busy. It's a nice place to walk through but it's very busy, and if you don't want to visit one of the museums (for which there are long lines), there's not really much to do. The 'I Amsterdam' statue is here, but as it is really crowded, it's no really worth to make a detour for it
Recommand to go early morning. There's landmark 'I am sterdam'Everybody wants take photo with this, So l recommand you visit here early in the morning!!

Surprising amount of rubbish. Maybe I'm a bit cynical or it was a bad day but didn't find this park to enjoyable. Especially by the I Amsterdam sign and ice rink as there was rubbish lying everywhere. Possibly from the wind I don't know. But with so many famous tourist attractions nearby I thought more of an effort would have been made to keep the area clean.

The Park of Beautiful Art!. A beautiful picturesque place surrounded by multiple amazing art museums such as the Van Gogh, Rembrandt, and Rijkmuseum. The large Iam Amsterdam sign is a great place for a picture stop.

The park that binds Art. This park with the large artificial lake in the midle is the open park area between the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh, Concertgebouw and Stedelijk museum. Here, near the I amsterdam is also the ticket office and the souvenir shop. Enjoy!

a very picturesque place. you can probably already can tell by its name that this place is surrounded by museum. in this complex you not only can find the 3 big museum (rembrandt, van gogh, and rijkmuseum) but also small interesting museums ( i forgot the name). to fully enjoy your visit to these museums, you need full energy and full stomach. the buildings in this area are very picturesque

Great Spot for Museum Lovers. The Museumplein or museum quarter is where the Reijksmuseum meets the Van Gogh museum meets the StedelijkMuseum. It's also a great photo op as the famous "I Amsterdam" sign is there also. It's a lovely place to meet and explore some of the best museums in the world.

Museumplein. a big central and circle square with many museums like the national museum Rijksmuseum,Van Gogh ,Coster Diamonds,near is the Heineken Experience-brewery.This time they have the I AMSTERDAM sign there.You can take photos and sit and enjoy your walk.

Nice at Night. The museumplein was a nice place to walk around, I did it at night and they had a skating rink with people trying their hand at that.There is a little snack bar on site. Amsterdam is just a nice place to walk and wander at any time of day or night.
Christmas visit. I had a lovely afternoon visiting this area with my girlfriend over Christmas. The markets were really interesting and I look forward to coming back

Nice, big green space in the center of amsterdam. Lots of activities, concerts, markets and events during the summer. The heart of the museum quarter. But if you are looking for a place to have a nice picnic and you have nice weather, go to the Vondelpark instead!

Must see. Museum Square - here you'll find the sign I Amsterdam to take your pictures. Museums Van Gogh, Rijks and Stedelijk are nearby. Here you can take a good walk and enjoy the square. On winter we can watch people enjoying skiing over the frozen lake. There was a Xmas fair too: it's amazing.
Lovely area to people watch. Nice space spend time watching the world go by. Lots of museums to choose from or simply a great place to hang out
It's a nice part.. Probably better in summer. February probably not best time to explore... Nice park to walk around... Nothing special, at least not in February.

Overrated. More a space for tourists than for the inhabitants of Amsterdam. Mentioned in every guidebook I think. When ther's a festival or the ice skating rink is up in the winter, only then you have a reason to visit. Otherwise, a sort of anonymous space.
Pass through!. Nice place. Take a few pics. Nothing outstanding or amazing though. Some nice new architecture. Lots of museums around.

A square with museums and a sign. In reality, this really is just a big square in which you'll find 2 museums (the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum) and an extremely popular sign, "I Amsterdam".The backdrop of both the museums in this green, outdoors area makes for an amazing photo. The I Amsterdam sign is always going to be extremely popular so don't expect to have the whole sign to yourself! Similarly expect to have to queue for each letter!!!But, whether you're on your way to one of the aforementioned museums, the Heineken Experience or Vondelpark, it is still a nice area to wander through.

Essential Art Square, unique in the world. This square is laid out between Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum and Stedelijk Museum. With at the other corner: Concertgebouw.This makes it unique. In wintertime there is a small ice-court created where you will be seeing (Dutch?) people skating, their favorite sport. And the skating is free, you can rent skates there.

a fun place. I enjoyed my time there. I wasn't planning on going there but im glad I did. It was a fun place Reminds me of of an amusing park in the states. Thanks Museumplein. Very convenient transportation too!!

Close to the museums. An open air attraction with lots of street vendors. Plenty to look at with the miffy's and the sculpture in the pond. Yes it has the I Amsterdam sign if you can see it. There were so many people climbing on it or standing in front of it that we didn't really know what it was for a while.A nice large cafe/bar at one end. Good place to people watch. I was suffering from a respritory problem when I was there and had a coughing fit which left me struggling for breath. One of the street vendors ran over to assist and offered me a bottle of water. When I recovered I went to pay for the bottle of water but they wouldn't accept payment, Difficult to get really good photos due to the number of people who will just walk right in front of you when it's obvious you are trying to take a photo.

A sense of grandeur. The square is beset by noteworthy buildings on all sides. The Rijksmuseum on the North side, The Concert Gebouw on the South side, The Van Gogh and Stedelijk Museums on the West- and the American and other embassies to the East side. In summer it's a great place to just hang out and enjoy the grandeur of the surroundings. In winter you get the same sense of grandeur, just not the urge to sit down in the wet grass.

Big square. One of the most famous square in Amsterdam,known for "I Amsterdam" sign. Surrounded by museums:Rijksmuseum,Diamond museum,Van Gogh museum.Very crowded,scores of tourists or locals trying to take a photo with the logo.
I amsterdam. Very famous square near some famous art musuems. Square is also famous for the I Amsterdam sign with many travellers taking photos there.

Somewhere to pass through as you visit the Museums. The MuseumPlein is a pleasant open area that connects all the major museums. Most people just pass through on their way from Rijks to VG etc. There is another I Amsterdam sign, and if you are inclined you can watch people trying to take selfies...or making themselves look stupid in the process. There are a few open air cafes and snack bars. At night the area is lit, making it look more attractive than during the day. I've rated it VG simply because of access to other attractions. I'd not go unless you were planning to visit one or more of the museums.

Nice quick stop. Walk through the passageway underneath Rijk Museum and you'll reach there.Van Gogh museum will be on the right hand side after you pass the famous "I Amsterdam" sign..You will laugh out at people climbing up the letters of "I Amsterdam" sign during the day.And if you're lucky you'll find a vacant letter to take a photo in front of the sign (if you can see the rest)Instead, go there at night when there is hardly anyone in front of the letters for a nice photo with RijkMuseum at the background. It's a nice square to spend 10-15 mins with couple of photos. Tram 5 passes by there.

The spot!. One of the most famous spots in Amsterdam. Take the pic from the very beginning of the fountain so you'll get the museum and the letters all framed. The furthest the better. Tip: huge supermarket underground.
Cool place. The Museumplein is a cool place where there are three or four museums and there is also an outdoor ice rink. We visited the vangoh and rijckstmuseum. Which I did a separate review on.
Great escape. Large museum area with plenty places to relax, read a book, visit any of the museums or sit and have a coffee

Interesting Buildings and the famous 'I Amsterdam' Letters. Visited here briefly one night to get a picture or two of the letters. Walked the whole area and appreciated the beautiful and interesting architecture of the surrounding buildings, some of which house museums. Within the grounds is a skate park for any skaters out there. Also for the winter there is one of the nicest ice rinks I have seen, complete with a bridge over the centre. Would definitely like to come back to Museumplein in the summer.

A key site for tourists!. The site of the museum and the iamsterdam sign, this location is key for tourists in the centre of Amsterdam. Located in the southern Centraal area of the city, near to Leidseplein it is a good stopping point for the winter ice rink and markets, and the cafes in the summer period.

Beautiful architecture.. This is a wonderful area to visit in Amsterdam that has an amazing amount of classic Dutch building's in a fantastic location.The museum's in this area are superb and varied from the beatiful Amsterdam Stedeldijk Museum ,the famous Rijks Museum and some fabulous building's such as the Concertgebouw,it really is a fantastic place to visit.Tram's number 2 & 5 to stop Rijksmuseum ,drop's you off in the immediate area.There are some nice café's in the area so finding some retreshment's is never a problem.A great area and well worth checking out on any trip to this fantastic city.
Good place to be in during sunny days.. Museumplein is for those who love to watch people. The place is full of outdoor loving crowds especially when it is bright and sunny.
Rainy day. Unfortunately it was pouring with rain when we visited and could not really enjoy the outside area but could see the lights on the trees. It was good that the museums were nearby.

Great meeting place in Summer. If you are in Amsterdam binge-visisting all the great museums, one time or another you end up here on this "museum-square". This place is filled with food stalls, coffee-serving-bikes and benches for some serious people-watching. Wintertime doesn't offer that much fun though, as most of the businesses operate seasonal (not to mention the weather).

nice place to take a stroll...best in the summer. we visited on a rainy winter's day, but it was still beautiful. Definitely recommend taking a look at the 'I amsterdam' letters and having fun there and then walking around the grounds.

Great!. We were here in January when the Christmas lights were still up and there was an ice rink. It was lovely at night. This is where the famous I Amsterdam sign is. But its usually covered in people making it difficult to just have yourself in the photo. It is also where the rijksmuseum , the van Gogh museum and the stedelijk museum of modern art are. On Sunday morning they have a flea market here. And the locals use it for friendly football matches. It has a really good vibe.
Nice scenery. Beautiful area with the museums all in sight.There was a small ice rink in the middle by the iamsterdam sign which was reasonably priced. Quite populated area

Beautiful square. Very nice spot in town, surrounded with great museums like Rijks, Van Gogh, Diamond museum... nice setting for taking pictures, shopping museum souvenirs, ice skating or having an american hot dog. Good transport connections.

I amsterdam. It's a nice place to spend time when in Amsterdam. However be ready for way too many people around the I am sterdam sign. You'll get a nice view of the museums, as the name would suggest :D.

Heres a tip noone will give you or knows ... until NOW!. need a picture taken in front of this sign ... but too many people come in the way and way to busy during the day.... also you can fit the whole sign in one frame of your camera because there is a water body right in front of it... so you have to get at an angel. Well.... go behind the sign.... run to the middle of the cycling strip.... the locals wont mind it... cuz its a big cycling track.... and take a pic where you can fit yourself and the entire sign ... and then on your phone or computer... just FLIP THE PIC HORIZONTALLY! BOOM! ... you have a perfect picture without any crowd!

A great place to meet. The Museumplein is a great place to meet friends or just to return to after a day touring the city. There is a decent café, a restaurant, plenty of side stalls and (during our January visit) an ice rink.
great walking here. the Museumplein is a great place to walk and hang out. It's right next to Vondelpark, so grab a picnic and a piece of the grass to just hang out. Worth the time during the day.

A place to stroll and have refreshment. A lovely park if the wheather is nice, also nice to see all the different types of architecture. Good to get your bearings of where everything is, there's the hop on hop off bus opposite the rijkmuseum as well, which is a good place to see the city.

Relaxing at Museumplein.. One of the many free and pleasant things to do in the city.Even if you have already visited all the museums, and have had your picture taken at the famous "iamsterdam" sign, you can still admire the pretty landscape and architecture while sitting at Museumplein with the food and company of your choice. It is absolutely lovely.Public transport is very convenient here and nearby Leidseplen.

A beautiful place with lots of people. One of the more popular places that we went to in Amsterdam. We didn't visit the museums but walked around the area and there were plenty of tourists taking pictures at the "I Amsterdam" sign, ice-skating, and taking a stroll around the Christmas market. I would call this place "lively" and we took lots of pictures. When I'm back there next, I would try to check out the museums.
museumplein. very nice place and historical place i loved the building shape it was huge beautiful and great really i enjoyed my day

Beautiful . Apart from the IAmsterdam sign they also had an ice skating area that the kids were loving. Beautiful sight for photos.There's a super market, some shops and of course the amazing museums!

Landmark in Amsterdam. This square is strategically located between the Van Gogh and Rijks museums and near the Stedelijk museum and the Concertgebouw. It's also where you can find the monument written I AMSTERDAM in huge letters, a popular place for pictures. Around the square you find a lot of restaurants, hotels and cafes.

A museum hub. We were staying in a hotel close to Museumplein so we walked by it every day. It's a real hub, with three of Amsterdam's main museums nearby: the Rijksmuseum, van Gogh and Stedelijk. Lots of people take their photographs at the famous sign "IAmsterdam". Now in winter there is also an ice rink.

Surrounded by Art. Museumplein is the access square to the most important museums in the city: Rijks Museum, Van Gogh Museum and the Stedelijk. You can also find the famous I AMSTERDAM sign- The square is full of tourists and there are lots of street food stands where you can enjoy a warm meal.

Good for picturee. Now in january there is Not just the I AM AMSTERDAM sign, no there is even a iceskating area and a fleemarket on sunday next to a lot of food trucks. It's close to Vondelpark and Leidseplein
Wonderful place. This park near the museums is wonderful to walk through and get a different perspective on the museum buildings.
good central point. Nice place to walk around, and has three of the major museums and the IAMSTERDAM sign; a must visit!
Great outdoors square,. Lots of activities, both for locals and tourists...frequent concerts and expositions...There are world famous museums around the square
Winter ice-skating. Amazing setup during winter with an ice skating ring wonderful to watch people enjoying themselves ..

Beautiful setting buzzing with positive energy. This is the park that runs between the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum. It is very picturesque and a lovely place to stroll on a sunny day. Great photo ops.

Wonderful Park next to the Van Gogh Museum. This place is a little gem in the city filled with artwork done by the students studying at the museum; which you can buy mind you and I most certainly did as the paintings were marvelous!
Museum Square. Hub where all museums are, and there is a lake in between with I AMsterdam sign here. You need to come here to get a pic at this legendary place.

A lovely square right. A lovely square right in the heart of the museum area. Gets very full of tourists but worth visiting to get some happy snaps with the "Iamsterdam" sign. Usually there are some little pop up stalls as well selling crafts and food.

Ice skating. Iceskating on the Museumsplein is so cool! It's a nicely decorated and spacious rink, and the restaurants around it are good as well. It's not one of those cheapo-quickly-built-up ones. It's tasteful, especially with the Rijksmuseum as a background, and with the cozy lighting as soon as it gets dark.

Disco ice rink. Some well-known Amsterdam museums are located here: Diamonds museum, Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum and Stedelijk Museum. I visited Museumplein (Museum Square) in the winter. Apparently there was an ice rink temporary built just in front of Rijksmuseum. It was very festive in the evening. For food or drinks, there is an underground supermarket at the square. One of a kind in Amsterdam.

Culture in the big city. Always a good diversion from meetings with clients. And on the way to my favorite antiquarian bookstores. The American Bookstore has a print on demand machine, and hosts literary events year round. The Film museum has a great bookstore and cafe, as do most of the other museums that spread out along this lengthy open air stroll.

All the great museums in one place!. Museumplein is easy to get to be tram (2,5,16 from Central Station - you can buy a ticket from the driver, currently 2.90 euros per ticket which lasts an hour. If you are thinking of tramming round the city in a day, you can buy a 24hour pass for 7. 40, so you only need to take 3 trips to make it pay. However, figure out in advance where you want to go and when - a lot cheaper to walk!!). Try to get tickets in advance for all museums from the ticket offices that are all over the place. This doesn't mean you're going to get first in line, but it helps. The Plein itself is well organised with several good cafes nearby.
Nice place to hang out. Nice place to hang out. Kids have place to have fun, they can also take baths. you have a nice cafe and mostly, you can lay in the sub :)

Museum Paradise. Visited at Christmas Time, when the pond is frozen and becomes an ice rink. There are also wooden chalets housing the Christmas Market.Great place for museum lovers with 3 major museums located here. My children initially dragged me here to have a photo with the Amsterdam Sign. There is also a bench there that provides photo opportunities. There were a number of cafes to have a drink and watch the world go by, and small outlets selling Van Gogh memorabilia.
all walkable. city center is small so everything is pretty walkable. sometimes it is easier to walk it than to figure out what PT to take.
Great place to walk around. Nearby a big open market and some nice restaurants - great place to just sit and enjoy Amsterdam. There is a christmas market on in December

Amsterdam's Nicer Area. This is a nice part of Amsterdam especially in the open areas around the Van Gogh and Stedelijk museums. We saw many people just taking time out from the museum trail and enjoying the sunny weather. Rijk museum seems to attract an awful lot of visitors, so allow plenty of time when visiting any of the major museums in the area. There are also many fashion shops if that is your thing, but we didn’t want to waste any time shopping while in Amsterdam. We also noticed quite a few nice looking small hotels, which we may stay at on our next visit.

Interesting museums in one place. A huge green square surrounded by a number of museums, including the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and the Stedelike Museum. There was a great Christmas market, and a huge ice-skating rink with free wi-fi and a bar/restaurant. A good meeting place!
great little area to relax and unwind. with all the museums in close proximity its a great place to go...theres also a little brassiere thats handy for a few drinks
Enjoy some art. Let your hair down, have fun, look at the art exhibits, play around and pose for some pictures. cycle, explore enjoy.

Must Visit. Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh and Stedelijk Museum. The I amsterdam sign (you might be lucky enough to arrive there very early in the morning and take a good picture without the crowd. I mean, early. Like 5:00). There are food trucks serving stroopwaffles and poffertjes. And if it is a sunny day, you can just lie on grass and feel the vibe. Love this place.

Art and fun. A great place to take pictures - famous IAmsterdam letters, lots of strange sculptures and things; in hot weather chidren and adults together are splashing in the shallow pool - but I won't recommend this, the pool is quite dirty :)

Another beautiful square. Museumplein, is a square which hosts the most important museums in Amsterdam. It's like a park, it is crowded, but really clean. You can have a break there, drink a beer and then a few minutes walk to Vondelpark.

Wonderful place. This is a beautiful area with many free space, park and historical buildings around. Main museums are located here including Van Gogh. There are also nice restaurants and cafes around. The luxury shopping street is not far away from here
Beautiful area. This is a lovely area to wander around. Main museums are located here including Van Gogh. There are restaurants in the museums also.

Great sight. The museumplein is a nice place to walk around and observe. It's next to the Rijksmuseum as well as the Van Gogh Museum. Also a souvenier shop close by. In the winter, the ice skating and market is really nice.
I am sterdam. Very touristic - of course -, but with a great view. In the end of December there's a Christmas Market and an iceskating place.

Great place to relax, enjoy and people watch.. We love to visit during the winter and watch ice skating, stop in the museum shop for gifts and stop in for a bite to eat. Great place to sit, relax and people watch, especially on a sunny day.

Nice open space. It was nice just to walk around the open space. There was an ice rink and Christmas stalls when I went, and lots of people milling about (and climbing on top of the I Amsterdam sign). Very handy for the museums, with several tram lines nearby.
There is also a big supermarket at the southern end (very handy).

Worth a Visit. Fantastic location surrounded by museums and quality shops and restaurants. Great open space links the Rijksmuseum, Van Gough and Stedlijk museums and ice rink during the winter. Easily accessible by public transport.

It's a nice public place, but don't expect Berlin. It's not as much of a community gathering space as others. It's still pleasant, but it feels more like a place between museums full of tourists than a piece of the Amsterdam community.

Lovely spot. We enjoyed this place when we came to Amsterdam. Had a lovely hotdog from the van inbetween the museum visits. Great buzz of all the people milling about getting ready for some culture of the museums nearby.
Lovely. Great green space in the heart of the city and near the major museums. Turned into a winter wonderland with ice rink and real tree for xmas. Still loads of space for families to have fun.

Museum Galore.. A nice area to walk through with a lot of museums in the area. It would be a nice place to come in the summer months and its where you can find the I Amsterdam sign which is always a good photo opportunity.

Another wonder to visit!. This place is like a city center with lots of attractions around the museum.. So you are always entertained if you are bored of visiting the museum exhibits.. This place is easily accessible by all modes of public transportation. Suggest you plan a day to spend around the museum and the tour.
Great for people watching. Nice area with green open space and stunning buildings. Easy to get to by tram or on foot or bicycle.
Small picnic. One of my favorite outings in amsterdam is to buy some sandwiches and drinks and go to the green area in the museumplein. Some days its sunny and very nice.
Nice area. Nice green area connecting the museums. Park with ice-skating rink and places for hot chocolate and coffee in-between the museums.

museums. The van gogh museum is here and it is absolutely the number 1 place to visit in Amsterdam. The museumplein is great because it groups a lot of museums together in one place. it also features the 'I amsterdam' sign which is great for photos.

Interesting Museum Area. Interesting Museums: modern art, Van Gogh......
Easy to find, easy to reach, well organized, correct prices.
Everywere you can go by bike, it's the best way to visit the city
There are Museums here. Do you like museums and galleries? Good, there are museums and galleries here, they are world famous and you'll be mocked if you don't visit.

Christmas fair. As it was Christmas time, there was a big Christmas fair with all small shops, food trucks, bars and big skating rink in the middle. We had great time eating sausages and drinking boiled red wine. Definitely place to visit during Christmas season. When you get tired, there are Van Gogh and Rijks museums close by to visit.

Big, wonderful and free!. When we were there, there were the Xmas Market, ice rink and some food tents (in one of them I ate the vegan hemp Burguer, so delicious). Wonderful and big place for free to everyone!
Museums Galore. This is a beautiful area, with museums and parks all around. In the winter you can ice skate on the big pond/fountain, and of your lucky; find some pea soup!
Choose from world class museums.. from this square you can visit the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum. also a diamond museum is near. foto opportunity is available at the IAmsterdam letters.

Probably better in summer. In late November and early December, the weather wasn't really conducive to outdoor activities here. Not much going on, and I really didn't entertain trying out the skating rink that was set up. My guess is this is much more lively (and worth your time) during warmer months.

Must visit area.. Situated in a lovely area ,Museumplein is well worth a visit .If you are visiting the Rijksmuseum ,the Van Gogh Museum or the Amsterdam Concert hall take a little time to walk around this area ,.If you are waiting for your time slot to visit any of the above venues ,walk around the park ,grab a coffee or walk through the fountains .A must visit location .

Super vibrant and inspirational spot in the city. The Museumplein is where you will find the "I Amsterdam" sign as well as some of the more famous museums. There are always many people around and you can have a drink, or in winter, just like today, Ice skate.
Must see in Amsterdam!. Te area around the Museums is a lovely area and a must see while in Amsterdam. There is much to see and do there and highly recommend this area.

a great square and a small park. We walked around for 2 hours in the Christmas fare. It was lovely and fun, and we even bought a couple of things. It's were the I Amsterdam sign is, but it's so full of people on and around it that we loved it from afar. Many museums with great buildings, A Must visit.

Square of letters. This is where you can take a picture of I am Amsterdam! Now in December you can ice skate and drink gluwein! There is a Christmas market where you can buy food/drinks! Very close to downtown and a nice atmosphere for the evenings

Beautiful markets, could wander for hours!. I adored this place. Really lovely markets with everything from gorgeous food to art to jewellery. Great atmosphere especially as I visited only a few days before Christmas. Worth a wander between museums.

Beautiful area, loved the ice rink. Museumplein is an incredibly beautiful part of the city. When my friend and I were there, there was a huge ice rink and Christmas market covering the whole square. If you are at the Rijksmuseum, it is definitely worth scheduling an extra hour just to look around (and skate in the winter).
Liked the square very much. A very beautiful square full of things to do. We visited in december ans it was Christmas decorated. Museums , cafe, bars everything is near.

a sunday market to enjoy. fro a leisurlely stroll among the many on a sunday this is agreat choice. arts, crafts, food and music. what is not to like? i was there on the 15th . i dont know if they do this every sunday or not. check the paper.

Museum corner. From Sloterdijk station, we took Tram 12 from our hotel which stops directly at this area. Great architectural building all around the area. There are a lot of food corner along Rijksmuseum if you wanna grab a bite. At this area are Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum and Stedelijk museum.

Beautiful Open Space. Surrounding this lovely little park are virtually all the museums you could want to see in a visit to Amsterdam. In addition the beautiful Concert Gebouw anchors one end of the park while the famous Rijks Museum is at the other. In between lies the Van Gogh which houses many of the masters greatest works. Be sure to stop in Brasserie Keyser located next to the Concert Gebouw for Bitterballen and beer after your day of viewing the great works of art.

More winter wanderings. There are loads of places to enjoy a hot drink or a bite to eat here, and of course you're surrounded by great museums. If you want to do some serious shopping, the likes of Prada, Hermes and Gucci are right there too.

Fun Place. What a really fun place to just hang out. Outdoor vendors, kids ice skating rink oh yah and the museums. Marvel at how many people can get on the "I Amsterdam" sign. People watching at its finest!

Beautiful Christmas market with delicious food . Situated between the famous rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum this square is transformed mid December to a beautiful Christmas market with ice rink, food stalls and local gift stalls. The famous I Amsterdam sign sits at the entrance providing a great photo opportunity and the lights and timber frame huts are quite picturesque. Great location and would recommend a walk round. Lovely and Christmassy.

A must see. This is the museum quarter where a few museums sit, due to it being December there was a ice rink and a few stalls for the market which wasn't ready yet. It is a great area and very spacious for picnics and walks. Overall the area is very picturesque and enjoyable to walk around.

iAmsterdam - Museum Square Amsterdam. It was raining extremely hard, yet it was still impossible to get a photo in front of the iAmsterdam sign! Extremely touristic, I guess that it's a must see! Maybe go there early in the morning if you want a nice single shot. In the winter this place also hosts a nice ice skating rink I heard.

Munt Tower was a mint.. Another Renaissance offering to behold amongst over 7000 classified buildings. This is a significant point close to the flower market and other key tourist points. The Building was part of original city gates. It sits adjacent to the Amstel river and adjoining canal. An important part of Amsterdam's history.

Beautiful. It was the first thing we went to check and took photos on our very first day in Amsterdam. I had a couple of those pictures I love to share with friends whenever they are travelling to Amsterdam.
Favorite park. Always something fun going on here. BBQ's in the summer and ice skating in the winter. Plan some time to just hang out here!
Beautiful . This is beautiful place to relax and have a look round the museums. There is a lovely park to walk around and relax in / play in and look at the beautiful buildings

Great Family Area. This is a park situated between the Rijksmuseium and the Vincent Van Gogh museum withe concert hall down one side. It has fountains adn children toy figure made of plastic which are very entertaining in appearance. Lovely for family picnics or just to rest in between seeing the two Musea- during fine weather I would heartily recommend some time out here.
Beautuful in every season. Museum Square is a magnificent square with beautiful buildings and some of the finest museums in the world adjacent. Summer or winter, there's always something to do

Great Ice Rink!. Visited while the ice rink was there and it's beautiful. Lots of little drink places and by the ice rink is a great bar. The Gluwein is amazing but strangely it's card payment only. The rest of the square is great with a kids playground. Ideal on a sunny day.
TAKE YOUR TIME. This is a place full of activities specially of Museums and ART. Is a whole day visit. Normally a very busy area for tourist, because one of the AMSTERDAM sign for pictures.
Nice break spot. Good place to relax and take a break while touring the city. Close to most museums and the I Amsterdam sign is also there.

Even at the end of Oktober is was pleasant.. The Museumplein is a large park in the Museum complex that houses the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh, and one of the I am Amsterdam signs. There are gift shops, art store, and the Cobra Café as well as a large pond and grassy areas. Wonderful place to relax wile taking a break from one of the museums or spend the afternoon enjoying the sun and all the people.
Very nice!. This square is one of the most beautiful I've ever seen. You are surrounded by green lawns, trees and museums...what a nice place to go for a stroll!

Beautiful Area With Lawns. The Museumplein is an area consisting of lawns that stretch some distance surrounding the nearby Rijjksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum. Quite a beautiful sight during the summer.I would stay away from the Van Gogh museum - it's just a complete waste of time and money!

Good place to relax. A good public park close to all of the museums in the area and with a lot of art installations. There are places to get drinks and snacks and seating. It is really nice in sunny weather. One of the IAmsterdam signs is here so it has a lot of people but doesn't feel crowded

When the weather is fine, .... ... then there is always always something to see or to do. Watching the young people doing their tricks on the half pipe, in winter the people on the small and crowded ice floor, in summer the kids in the little pond and all year round all the pedestrians and bikers passing the square and the many tourist hanging in or standing on the man high letters of the grammatically incorrect I Amsterdam logo. Around the square you will find the country's finest arts like in the Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh Museum, the Stedelijk Museum and the Concertgebouw.

Great museums grouped round a lively open square. Museum plain is the home of the famous I AMSTERDAM sign seen in many pictures. The large open square has a range of food and other stalls selling pancakes, soup, coffee, tea and other snacks which can be a good place for an inexpensive coffee or light lunch in good weather. The Stedelijk, Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum are grouped around the plain and the Amsterdam Concert Hall is here as well amongst other attractions.There is also an underground supermarket close to the Stedelijk Museum entrance which can be useful for visitors and is not obvious unless some-one tells you it is there.The Canal boats stop in front of the Rijksmuseum very close to the square and tram stops are close by. When I visited in January15 there was an ice skating rink set up on what was a pond on my November visit. Vondel Park is close by fo some fresh air and exercise after a day browsing in MuseumsA good location to stay although it is quite quiet in the evenings a little distance to restaurants.

Exciting place to be . This whole place is magnificent! The art installations were all so interesting. I especially love the Miffy Art Parade. Lots of people all around, but that's no problem, it's a gigantic area.
Several Museums all together. If you are at the Rijksmuseum then why not walk over to the Van Gogh museum or if you want a little other type of museum why not do the Bols place?

Noisy and lively restaurant in main area of museum. Enjoyed a great Caesar Salad for lunch. Service was swift (though we did have to queue a few minutes for a table - it was busy) and everything good.
AWESOME!. Really enjoyed getting clicked at the I AMSTERDAM sign! A must-do for everyone who visits Amsterdam! Better to go early in the morning as it is less-crowded!
Nice place. Open garden that you can see many museums. On Xmas you can go to the xmas market!!! Nice place to enjoy a sunny day with your family or friends!
Must visit. Take a walk around, check out some museums, but definitely buy tickets ahead of time. You also have to take a picture in front of the I Amsterdam sign, it's imperative.

centrepoint for arts visitors. Museumplein is quite huge, in the centre of buildings hosting various museums and galleries. In between, there are some statues (with the famous Iamsterdam sign) and green areas, which might be fien for a picnic or chillout on a sunny day. We weren't so lucky, as it has been raining the whole time of our visit, which decreased the overall enjoyment of this possibly welcoming and nice square. A little hideaway from the rain to be found in the museumshop - once exhausted the option to roam through the exhibitions. Would be fine to come again to give this place a second chance

giant square with park allure. the very large Museumplein is bordered by numerous famous buildings in Amsterdam:the Concertgebouw is known to be the music hall with the best acoustics in the world, The Rijksmuseum is the home of many important paintings amongst which Rembrandt's Nightwatch, the Amsterdam Stedelijk Museum brings you the latest in contemporary Art en the van Gogh Museum does not need any further explanation. Too much to see in one day so take some more time if you want to have a taste of everything

Nice ice skating with the kids at Museumplein. what could be better skating on a spot overlooking one of the finest museums in the country. The Rijksmuseum. Very friendly atmosphere and worth to enjoy all together a number of hours.Catering is cashless payment .
beautiful square. Many museums near by and it would be an excellent choice just to relax and picnic if the weather is good. Also a good place for taking pictures.

A must see. Really lovely to see, went end of November when the ice skating is on. Not much to say about it but such a good photo opportunity, just cool to go and see whilst in Amsterdam, and at no charge!!!

Nothing interesting, very touristic. People loved to take a picture with the I amsterdam sign that was put there. An outdoor ice skating place was mounted attracting many kids. The way to the attractions was poorly labeled. There is a huge parking underneath with a toilet facility charging 1 Euro !!!.

This is a ...SQUARE!. A surprise for me that this is mentioned as a plce to have visit. It is a square, as Trafelgar Square is one in London or Paradeplatz in Zürich. The size though, is incredible, lot's of green.Is it easy to access, yes, Trams drive there from various directions, so it is really easy to go there. Anyway you have to cross the square when you walk from Stedelijk Museum or Concertgebouw to Rijksmuseum or vice versa. The real attraction are the "I Amsterdam" letters in front of the Rijksmuseum. Everybody is climbing them and taking pictures, so it seems to be a sort of an attraction.Important to see? I don't think so but it is anyway there while you are at one of the Museums.
Picturesque . Museum square is so beautiful with the museums around and greenery. The famous Iamsterdam sign is a must see and a picture there is a must.
Fantastic place for a day outing. Near central Amsterdam, good place to hangout & enjoy with friends, walking disctnace form Dam square

It was raining, so couldn't walk there a lot. It's a really nice place to stay and walk around, good meeting point, lots of museums there, but not on a rainy day. It's a shame we couldn't really enjoy it, want to go back when the weather is better.

Great to visit any time of year.. Any visit to the Rijksmuseum would naturally end with emerging on the Museumplein. This is a marvellous open space with flower beds water etc and a great view back to the museum. It would be beautiful in the Summer, but any season would offer much to enjoy, plenty of picture opportunities for photographers, and people watching.
Busy little place. Nice busy square in between the rijksmuseum and concertgebouw with the always great I Amsterdam sign and a ice-skating place with a lovely traditional Amsterdam bridge.

Great place to hang out!. Beautiful place to hang out with friends, located between the national museum and the van gogh museum. Also with the iamsterdam sign in the middle. A must in this beautiful city.

The clue is in the name!. The plain itself is nothing to write home about...but the museums around the edge are excellent and well worth a visit. I would recommend the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum.

Lovely green space. Surrounded by wonderful archetecture. The Rijksmuseum at the northern end and the Concert hall at the southern end with the Van Gogh museum in the middle.Tip;Underneath the square at the southern end is a supermarket. This is great to buy drinks and snacks for a picnic on the square or at nearby Vondel Park.

gives access to all the main museums, great for a lazy moment and watching people play games. a big square, mostly green with walking grids on them. The cultural heart of the country: The Van Gogh museum, Stedelijk museum, Rijksmuseum and Royal Concertgebouw. Underground is a supermarket where backpackers buy food to eat on top of the artificial hill.Watch people play football, frisbee or other pastime activities.
Great to end a summer's day.

Awesome green-space!. This is a beautiful area especially on a sunny day when the locals and tourists are out enjoying the fountain and park. It is a very large park south of downtown that is surrounded by many fabulous museums like the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. There is a large reflecting pond and between the water and the Rijksmuseum is the large I Amsterdam sign. This makes for an excellent photo, but be aware there will be a large mass of tourists and kids literally hanging off the letters so they’ll be in your picture unless you get there at sunrise! Great park for relaxing in-between museum trips or on your way to the Heineken Experience!

Nice to have a walk around. We went to the museums by here so thought it'd be nice to have a walk around, the Iamsterdam sign was very busy though. Lots of dogs running around on the grass which was nice to see, definitely recommend if you're in the area :)

don't go if you won't go to a museom. the square is nice, but the i amsterdam sign is really crowded, there are other i amsterdam signs in the city, this place requires a tram or bike ride, so if you're going to the museom or vondelpark you can stop by here.
Fantastic. This area is so fantastic and all family member will enjoy it, do not miss it during your visit to Amsterdam.The negative point is the Bathroom not available in all area

A photo opportunity .... .. is really all this is as it is a large turfed area with a medium sized shallow pool near to the north end. However, in winter that turns into an ice rink with the backdrop of the famous letters.

Just go. Its a park , near rijksmuseum and van-gogh museum.With the Sign of Amsterdam.Good place to take a rest after museum. And take a photo.We bought a hot dog for a small amount there, in a rainy day! Not so big, doesn't take long time, we spent just half an hour there.
A Park. A large park behind the rijksmuseum and next to the Van Gogh. Interesting people watching, but nothing extra ordinary
The place to meet. Excellent, safe place to meet up with a friend, or tour guide. Just mention which letter you will be near, and voila!
Not special, but must see. When in Amsterdam you must see the Museumplein. Not because it is special, but because it is surrounded by everything everything that you must see. Like the famous museums.

Pool of International and National ingredients !!. On the "museumplein" (museumsquare) you will find so many people from all over the world, it's amazing. One pool of international cultures, all visiting this unique area. You can relax - sit - lay in the sun on the grass - eat - drink - watch - skate -sleep - etc etc. Around this square you find the famous van Gogh museum and the Rembrandtmuseum surrounded by the beautiful Dutch "heren" houses. With nice pubs and restaurants around you will never leave here for this day. Great atmosphere !! Visit !!

Combines top museums and other sights. This 'plein' (square) is more of an open, grassy space and most visitors will visit it, if not as an attraction in its own right, then certainly because the Rijksmuseum, Municipal and Van Gogh Museums, the Concertgebouw and Costers Diamond 'Factory' and Diamond Museum are all on it.
Touristy area. Full of tourists taking selfie photos haha. It's a lovely area with a few museums. Close to trams and buses. Shops & foods are close too :)

I amsterdam sign. if you would like to get picture of or with the I amsterdam sign alone and not with loads and loads of tourists, try to get up early and go there in the morning! We tried our luck (and second chance for the sign) on Monday morning before 8 a.m. and we were the only ones there. Only another small group came - they were even taken same flight afterwards! :-)

A must have picture. Well located in Amsterdam, with many hotels, restaurants and bars next to it. If you want a nice picture from the I amsterdam sign with only you there, go there early in the morning, because people usually climb the sign for pictures.

Very nice, very touristy. If you want to take a memorable photo with the I AMsterdam sculpture go at nighttime when the tourists aren't there otherwise it is a nightmare. The open grass area is nice to relax and have a couple of beers, smoke, kick a ball and generally relax
Lots of fun!. Selfie lovers unite! Take your obligatory Amsterdam photos.Its always crowded even in the rain and at all times. Its a must see in Amsterdam and located outside of all o f the museums.

One of the must see of amsterdam. It is a classic but still worth seeing. A picture in front of this iconic writing is something that each tourist of Amsterdam should have. Go early morning or late night though if you want a 'solo' picture...it is always packed with people.
Nice area to relax and wifi. The place is known for the Iamsterdam sign. Take a picture and enjoy some wifi and the area if it is not raining.

Nice place for traveler.. You can see a beautiful architectures which was used for museum. It was very nice place for a walk and talk. And you can also "I am sterdam" which is very famous symbol in Amsterdam.

Allow a lot of time. One can spend a full day at this complex between the Rijksmusem, the Van Gogh and the "I Amsterdam" sign.
So uniquely European and so much history
Beautiful area near museums. We walked around there before visiting the van Gogh museum in the late afternoon and had a coffee. It's a nice area to take a walk .

Beautiful area of Amsterdam out of the busy streets. We didn't visit any of the museums, but we just sat in the park watching the world go by whilst sipping on a delicious hot coffee. Coming from a city with constant chaos (Melbourne), it was lovely to feel so separated from the busy streets and watching the children play on the playground and the young guys skating through the skate park - but the city is still bustling right behind the tree line. Its really a beautiful place to just relax, have a coffee and people watch. Also, you must get the classic photo with the I amsterdam sign

I Amsterdam. Go early or late to get the best photo with the fewest amount of people standing in, on, or in front of the sign. Lots of foot and bike traffic during the day. Can't miss this if you are going to any of the museums in Museumplein. Also a good hamburger place near this! If you walk from the sign to the Van Gogh the burger place will be on your right. SO GOOD!

Get there early to get your pictures. If you get here early enough, you might be able to snatch a photo of the famous "I Am sterdam" without too many photo-bombers in the shot!This park is nice chilled place for a peaceful stroll between museum visits.

Don't miss taking pictures. there were a lot of people on the I AmSterdam and i didn't waste any time 3 minutes later i was on one of them really great viewat the time that we were there there was an exhibition of artiest that were inspired by Van Goughand there was plants or trees museum a small one but nicegreat for a nice fun family day

It's... a square.. Some squares are icons, others...are just the space in between iconic buildings. Museumplein is a prime example of the latter: many great museums around it, but the square itself is meh, unless there's something going on.

Greeeeeen. I loved this immense green area when you can do everything you want and there are a lot of places to eat better and less expensive than other place. You will forget that you have to visit the museums!
Great place to visit . This is a very nice area to sit, relax, and people watch after a few hours of walking through the museums. When the weather is nice you can even picnic here.
ideal spot for a picknick. Large open space, full of photo opportunities. Lawn for games or picnicking, coffee corner. Central location between all the important museums
Best outdoor claim!. Yes, I love Amssterdam too. This museum area just got better since my last visit. Can't wait to go back...

Fun place to hang out in good weather. In the sunshine, there are lots of people picnicking and playing on the Museumplein and it's an enjoyable place to hang out. In bad weather, it's still nice to cross the greensward on the way to the museums.

not that great. Covered in tourists.
If you need to go to the toilet, you need to go in the underground car park's toilets... an experience.
Obviously the I-Amsterdam needs to be snapped, and climbed if under a certain (mental?) age.
Beautiful . We stayed really close to this area. Museumplein is always so busy but has a brilliant atmosphere. Really worth a visit.

Touristy Museum Area.. This is where one finds the huge "I Amsterdam" letters displayed just across from the Rijiksmuseum. On the other side is the Van Goch as well as the Stedelijk Museum further down. The place was buzzing with tourists when we arrived on a Saturday morning. There were also matches for the Homeless World Cup Soccer, just next to the location. It was quite a hive of activity. Taking pictures meant that you would probably have other people in your pictures due to the high levels of people also trying to take their own pictures. There is also a bench with the "I Amsterdam" letters on it.Well worth a visit.

Loud and touristy with "I Amsterdam" sign. Amsterdam's high energy level can be felt standing here with people taking customary pics with "I Amsterdam" sign, arguably the most marketable city branding sign. I mean which other city is this loud and youthful in marketing itself !! This place has few good eateries, many museums and awesome Christmas decorations in vicinity.

A must for a tourist. Not far away from the old town (15 walking), beautiful surrounding, great way to make rememberable tourist photos. Went there on a tuesday morning and it was already quite crowded.

Obligatory: taking a photo here . A must, from here you can see the Rijks Museum, Concert Building and the Van Gogh museum as well. You can also find the "I amsterdam" monument here as well, it's a must-see and almost obligatory to try and climb on the letters to take a picture.In the summer there are sometimes street music or acts, they're most of the time entertaining.If you're not sure to which museum you want to go just go here first and then you can choose, as most of the important ones are here.

Crowded with tourists. Do not expect to be able to get a good picture of yourself with the "I Amsterdam" sign. It is covered with tourists, so you photo will be of you with 50-100 strangers. The greenspace is a nice park that connects the museums in the area.
Great experience. Crowded but nice to have a photo with the whole family.One on the tourist attraction of Amsterdam and part of the city tour for the whole gang.
good place to regroup before visiting a different museum. Good location to grab a bite to eat and regroup before going on to visit another museum or to walk along the canals.

Here you can find "I amsterdam". When you want to take a phote of I amsterdam and visit the main museums of Amsterdam go to the Museumplein.
From here you can walk to van Goghmuseum, Rijksmuseum and Stedelijk Museum. Or go to the Concertbuilding....

Interesting location. A central place between several important museums in Amsterdam. Good for a brief break in between of your cultural programme, sufficient cafes and restaurants within immediate reach.

Great place if the weather is fine. Great place to visit when it's not a rainy day. You can chill, football, walk or visit one of the world-famous musea. Drawback is, is the fact there isn't really a good place to hide when it rains.

Lovely spot, surrounded by museums and a great neigborhood to walk. Museumplein is the place where everyone goes and takes a picture with the famous "I amsterdam" sign. But much more than this, Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, Stedelijk, are right there to be discovered. Also, fancy stores (Cartier, Hugo Boss, etc.) are two blocks away, and a very nice neighborhood to walk around.
Wonderful museum square. Love the idea and a beautiful park. Accessible from all sides and is a magnet to all visitors. Could not stop photographing it from far and near.

Touristy but interesting. This is one of the mots popular landmarks in Amsterdam where you can click pictures with 'I Amsterdam' structure. It gets very crowded in summers & difficult to get a solo pic. However, there is a park attached and its a very lively place to sit, eat & observe people from everywhere.

Fantastic Place for Museum Lovers. Very Big plain surrounded by Museum. Nice location with easy access of public transport. Albert Hijn Supermarket just with in the plain. People traveling to Amsterdam Should not miss this place.

Great at Night. This place is busy even at night. We happened across a couple taking wedding photos while we were there. Definitely worth walking here and enjoying the area. You also get a chance to breathe as opposed to being crushed by humanity in the central Amsterdam area.

Interesting gathering spot. There are at least two of these signs, on at the airport one in the museum square. The museum square sign is always crawling with people trying to pose on the sign. It makes for an interesting visual of people trying to climb the sign.

A wonderful urban Park. Wow, an urban park with many informative museums, the "I Amsterdam" sign and lots of green grass. Popular with locals and visitors. On this sunny day took Time to sit and people watch

Good place to see. Visited this place on Tuesday - it is a fun thing to see - the big Amsterdam Sign has tourists all over it - on top of it, by the letters and in the letters - a great photo opportunity!!
Worth seeing it whilst in Amsterdam

beautiful. absolut amsterdam
awesome views
bike rails
nice architecture
museums
coffeeshops
nice park
went to recitals there
nice sculptures
lots of people
bikes
next to van gogh's
Museum paradise. So many choices, so little time? At least have your famous picture taken here I Am Sterdam! But at least try one! THere's good food stands surrounding the museum area.
Caught it on the way to the Van Gogh Museum.. Yup, there it was. Huge letters with folks climbing over the alphabet like toddlers over a playground. Took a photo.
Must do. It is a land mark, you have to have a pic taken here, it is full of tourits and all the museums are around, little kiosks or restaurants to eat,
Awesome. A fantastic square in Museum Quarter. Always bustling with activity and the I amsterdam sign is neat.

Classic. The sign "I amsterdam" is one of the magnets of the square, where you can walk and enjoy the day (if it is not raining). You will see it if you go to the Rijksmuseum or the Van Gogh Museum. Typical place for snapshots.
Nice but very busy. We didn't stay long, just stayed to get a photo or two after the Rijksmuseum tour. Lots of crowds, looks like a good meeting point

MuseumPlein ; xxx. Come Smile & Picture this...
Or just have a look & a smile...
As everyone climbs here up....
EveryTimeIcrossher....iSmile..... ;; ))))
x ; xxx
Such fun!. What fun it was to be staying close by and having the museums close by. The atmosphere in this area was lovely and relaxed.

tourist spot. the only reason i would recommend anyone to come here is for taking a photo in front of the I amsterdam sign.
this is the place where you will probably meet the most tourists, but i did not find it special in any way

Super Square! Museum Square!. Quick access to 3 museums, Rijksmuseum (national art gallery) van Gogh and the museum of modern art. Very nice square, it is also the place where there is an I amsterdam sign!

Just a Sign. This a sign with big red letters. It's ok if you want to take a photo in front of it I guess. I think a couple of nice trees instead of a sign would look so much better. There are enough signs in Amsterdam.

Lively and dreamlike . Visited amsterdam this september with family...that included old parents and a young child and voila duscovered a place that has something for everyone...The restaurants and the variety in cuisines isnoutstanding here... the garden in the middle makes for a perfect setting....the outstanding architecture with the slow witted trams with their sweet bells makes for a fairy tale setting....A must visit!

It's getting better and better. At first I thought a big desolate and empty square was created, but after some years it's getting livelier and better. Young people chilling on the grass in summer, making pictures at the enormous 'I Amsterdam' sign, ice skating in winter, full of sunflowers to celebrate the opening of the new entrance of the Van Gogh Museum, there is always something to do. Buy your lunch at the supermarket located near the square and save more money by buying a one to three day pass allowing several free entrances to museums, canal ride and public transportation

Very Cool Peaceful Place!. Beautiful Park. Great way to spend a day hanging with people from all walks of life. The Nice thing is it doesn't cost anything to have a wonderful day . Bring a picnic basket and a blanket. weather permitting :-)

Fun to wander. Fun to wander around, take the required picture with the I amsterdam sign and visit the Van Gogh museum store. There are a lot of people, but if you get there early the crowds aren't bad (the museum lines, however are LONG).
Photo Spot. One of the must do Tourist thing in Amsterdam. Good to take a lot of pictures with a nice scenic background and I amsterdam

Good photo Op. Number one photo opportunity in Amsterdam. Get your photo taken in front of the famous red and white "I Amsterdam" letters, about 5 feet high. (There's another smaller one across town.)

Buy a pass and save money. If you are going to do things in Amsterdam anyway save some money by buying a one to three day pass allowing several free entrances to museums, canal ride and public transportation
IT IS NICE. Situated between the Van Gogh Museum and the Rejkmuseum so when you walk in the park there it is. Very nice.
try the best waffle . there is a small waffle place in Museumplein. try the waffle with nutella and icecream. it is absolutely the best one in the city!
Exactly what it is!. We stopped by here briefly after visiting the Van Gogh Museum just for the photo opportunity - it's a great spot for a photo if you're passing!
A good option for a picnic or spend time with your children. This is a great place to meet friends and family and spend some time having a picnic or playing with your children or dog.
Great for a sunny day. This area is wonderful to sit in on a sunny day, interesting installations appear from time to time and people are full of life.
Great place for photos . This is a great place to take photos. This is somewhat of a landmark and is in my opinion a great place to have photos taken for your album.

Good for pics. Its very good if you want to have a pic for the memory.
Colorful and makes a good background, you can ask ppl to help take your pics.

Good views of three major museums and the Concertgebouw. With the Rijksmuseum at one end and the Concertgebouw at the other, and with the Van Gogh Museum and Stedelijk Museum flanking it, the museumplein is central to the cultural life of Amsterdam. It offers great views of the various buildings.

I Am Amsterdam. Surely you can't leave Amsterdam without a picture in front of I Am Amsterdam; great way to document your trip. Many climb upon the structure but standing is just fine. It is adjacent to Vondel Park and right by several museums, including Van Gogh.
thought it will be bigger than that. nice place to see just to have a photo next to the sign other than that 15 mins and keep walking it is a far place a little from the center

Must Visit!!. Should visit to have the MUST Have picture with IAMSTERDAM
Best time is to go in the night.. its not crowded and is very calm.
I have visited during the day and in the night and loved it here!

Yes, I Amsterdam!!!. You won't miss it if you are in Amsterdam. always packed with tourist but if you go very early or very late at night you might be lucky to have it all to your self. the Museumplein itself is a nice place to chill out and reflect on what you've done so far in Amsterdam hahaha
Bustling. A very busy area, lovely architecture around. The hub of the tourists! It is a must visit in Amsterdam

Nothing much to see, but its a landmark anyway!. There's nothing much to see here, but there's a big "IamSterdam" statue that is a must-do activity for tourists. Its a short walk from Van Gogh museum or Rijkmuseum, so dont forget to come by to take pictures here.

I AM's. Must see, must touch,must selfie landmark!Go here while you visit the dam.You can take metro 5 or 2 and your exit will be just steps away from it.Also u can get your metro tickets inside the metro and they are good for 1 hour from when u first use it. Make sure u scan getting on and off the metro.

Museum market, Dutch design at it's best. The Museum Square is always worth a stroll, but once a month it all comes together at the Museum Market. Many stalls of Dutch designers are on display with their products for sale, combined with many different and exotic food trucks and music.An atmosphere as can happen only in Amsterdam.On our way to visit the Stedelijk Museum, we stopped at this market and never made to the museum that day anymore.It was a warm autumn day, and they placed kinda lazy things in the middle to sit down and put low water in the middle for the children to play.Simply brilliant. Check the site museummarket.nl for the dates. They seem to be little random and not a fixed Sunday of the month.

Nice open space. There's really nothing all that special about this park. It has some nice grassed areas, with an 'I Amsterdam' sign at one end. A good place to get waffles, coffee, or tickets for attractions. Offers a bit of fresh air and respite after the museums, and a good counter-balance to the small streets within the canals.
Strolling. Again another great place to wonder round. Love just bimbling around a city, Amsterdam has so much to see.

Giant sign . . . green grass . . . lots of people!. We were touring Amsterdam on the City sight-seeing, hop-on, hop-off bus and we hopped off at the stop adjacent to the museum. After spending some time having a look around the museum building and its beautiful garden with numerous sculptures, we made our way over to have an “up close and personal” viewing of the giant “I Amsterdam” sign, located nearby on the massive grassed area. However it turned neither “up close” nor “personal”! The reason for this was that there so many tourists around, in and on top of the various letters of the sign, all posing for photographs, that it was almost impossible to get anywhere near the sign. It certainly was not possible to take a photograph of your companion next to the sign, without some “random” appearing in it.Eventually we gave up and headed off for a bit of a rest, sitting on the grass well away from the sign. At least, in this part of the area, there was a little bit of peace and tranquillity.
Great for a stroll. A nice park for a stroll on a fresh Sunday morning. The artistic sculptures are fun for taking pictures

Busy. We visited this place several times. In the morning (8-9), this place is nice and empty and is worth the visit. You can take picture of the I am Amsterdam sign, and see all the museums around you.

Perfect place for a sunny day. There are food stalls, music, people-watching, and special events.
There are picnic tables so you can bring your own food. Rijksmusem and van gogh musem are adjacent.
A day at the museum. This is the square around which many museums are located including the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum.
Must take Picture. Just go and take a picture its a cool area to let you know your in Amsterdam......I will be back next year with my mum for our Birthdays

Lovely Park. You'll find the "IAmsterdam" sign here! It's also really close to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum. There's a really nice park, basketball court, and skatepark here too! It's a wonderful place to visit

It's okay. I didn't find the area between the museums to be anything special. A large green space, some tourist shops and thr Amsterdam sign that was a bit underwhelming.
The Van Gogh museum is outstanding. Absolutely go to it. We didn't visits Rijks.

Market street food and chill. Having the weather helps. Easily one of the nicest tourist traps I've been too. Was a market on with street food and people relaxing in park and at markets very good vibe.
Museumpleim. If you going to visit go early cos it gets that bizzy you can't get near it there a under ground supermarket close by which is handy to get supplies even freshly made sushi
Nice area. A lot of museums and music buildings, nice restaurants and hotels. You can enjoy a lot during the day and at night you really can rest...no noise at all. Safe at night.
A very beautiful square. It is a really nice square you could take a walk and of course take photos in the famous "i amsterdam" sign.
