a must for your stay. every one wants their photo done on the iamsterdam so get there early. its behind the vangough muesum.
Nice. Very beautiful square with a few museums around. Good for pictures, I took fantastic pictures at night.

Great place to just hang out.... We really enjoyed this section of the city.. Didn`t go into any museums though. It was too nice of a day to be inside so we just hung out in the park and had a few beers people watching.
Just go for the sign.. A great little area with all the museums within walking distance. Go just to photograph the sign of I love Amsterdam. Many do.

Great for relaxing and people watching.. Just because it's surround by museums, doesn't mean you have to visit them. It's just as nice and relaxing to enjoy the area in between all of them. Museumplien is just a simple/beautiful area all by itself. There is a large pond with a fountain. The IAMSTERDAM metal sign is there for you or the kids to climb on and pose. There is a small cafe for something to eat and a shop for souvenirs if your into that.It's great for a stroll and a favorite place to sit and watch people while you soak up the sun.
great place for a day out. a great please to spend a day. there's loads to do here, easy on tram/bus. two of the best museums I've ever been too

a must. We had a bit trouble finding it but it was so worth it. My cousin wouldn't leave until we took pics with the letters. We did, it was so much fun! a lot of museums around, parks, there was a soccer tournament.

Funky Amsterdam. If you go to the important museums in the Rijks area, then you will see this exhibition. People seem to delight in having their photo taken infront or on top of it. Well it is a bit passe really.

Great photo opps. Stumbled upon this area after leaving the Rijksmuseum. Nice park areas for eating on the grass, nearby trams connecting to the centrum.Of course the 'I am Amsterdam' sign was very popular with people posing for photos, this was all we really did here but I'm sure there was more to the area than that.
culture culture culture. Very nice place, for this who loves museums it's place to go, this is nice historical place. and also surrounded by nice park :)

Fun break between museums. After our visit the Rijkmuseum we walked through Museumplein (located at the rear of the museum) and did some serious people-watching as we walked to the Van Gogh Museum. Great vibes here and lots of action!!!
Memorable Photo Shoot. This place is very good place to take picture to bring your memory back to home country. Very popular with tourist.

Popular Area. Our hotel was located in the museum quarter so we walked through Museumplein most days, regardless of the time there was always people hanging around chatting, laughing and lazing on the grass. By far the most popular attraction was the I Amsterdam letters in front of the Rijks museum- why is this so popular? We thought the area was too open and too busy, Vondel park is much better and only 5 minutes walk away.

Nice place to take pictures. It is a nice place to take pictures ...the place was also full of a music festival ....nice fun.................. ..ppl were enjoying summer and the music... The entire week was full of the fest ....I am amsterdam....is the most hyped but still famous place.......

I AMsterdam sign. Every tourist needs a photo here. I have been here in summer and winter. During winter time there is a ice rink and summer time you can chill and relax on the grass. Nice place to have a cup of coffee in between museum visits. Van Gogh and Rijks museum is on the plein.

A great area to spend a whole afternoon. Our hotel was located about 10 minutes away by foot, so it was a nice area to wander around. Make sure to visit the Van Gogh Museum, which gave great insight to his life. In addition to all the museums, there is always something going on around here. Make sure to check out in advance what’s happening in the Museumplein area, as we stumbled across the Homeless World Cup. Sadly we had no idea what it was, but later learned it was a social movement which uses football to inspire homeless people to change their own lives. It would have been cool to catch a game or event. You can also take some nice pictures around the I amsterdam sign. Go early or late to help avoid all the strangers in your pictures.

Good place to take pictures. The "I Amsterdam" sign lies in front of the Rijksmuseum and it has become an iconic symbol of the city. It's a great place to take some pictures, but you'll have to get there early in the morning , otherwise you'll find many people sitting in or on the letters.
Walking through the Museumplein. Really enjoyed museumplein, I think I missed a lot of it . It covers a big area. But well worth a visit .
Fun area . Fun area - watch out for pickpockets. Great views of Rijksmuseum. Canal boats nearby as well as cafes and restaurants. Enjoy!
Pretty Spot. Good spot to base yourself to explore the Museum district. Equidistant from Van Gogh, Rijks, House of Bols and Diamond museum. Good coffee at the cafe's in the centre.

Perfect place to have some relax and walk around.... Museumplein looks spectacularly and it is a really good place to be especially when the weather is nice - you can either walk there, seat on the grass or make photos

Lovely area. Our hotel was located near by so walked through every day, lovely walk on a summers day and nice for an evening stroll home too as it is well lit up. I amsterdam sign was way too busy during the day so no chance of getting a photo without other people in it, however at night much quieter so can get a photo then.

Great place for a long day or two. All museums in this area worth going to.from Van GoghTo reijsSuch a nice place to visit and chill,even have a small park close in,plenty of restaurants to eat as well

Nice place to sit in sun, good luck getting a photo though.... We got the Tram down to try and get a picture with the sign, good luck with that! There were people climbing all over it! I wouldn't recommend it if you just want a photo next to the 3D sign.However, the park is nice. We sat on a bench for a while and just people watched.
Wonderful. Lots to see and do here.Great for lying in the sun in the picnic.Good for families, singles, couples.

Beautiful park and surroundings. A lovely grassy park area between all the big art museums; perfect place to pitch up on a sunny afternoon for a walk, picnic or even some outdoor games! Also take the opportunity to pose for a picture around the "I Amsterdam" sign (you can't miss it).

Always something happening here. Been to amsterdam a few times in recent years and have found that this area always seems very vibrant and theres usually an event of sorts taking place, on a recent visit we discovered several things going on, there was the Mountain Dew skateboard tour pretty cool lots of freebies, juice, tshirts and caps etc. Also there was an open air Grease musical sing along which was a nice day in the sun!

Museumplein. Fun area to stroll along with tent/booths available selling food and souvenirs. Nice photo opportunity with the iamsterdam 3D letters. Also areas available to sit and eat. We could hear music playing like a band but not sure if they are always there or if an even was taking place.
Touristy . Good meeting point but very touristy. Everyone is trying to take pictures :(. Conveniently located next to the tran... Good spot

Museums, arts and space.. A beautiful open space to walk around (or sit down!) and admire the gorgeous and very varied architectural styles of the museums. The I Amsterdam sign is super popular for photo shoots, and there is a very multi use plaza which I have seen as an official football pitch, an ice rink and just as an open space with amazing seats to relax and admire.

A Totally Touristy But Beautiful Landmark.... The museumplein is a lovely area of Amsterdam that simply must be visited during your stay! We took souvenir photographs at the famous "I Amsterdam" sign, it was quite busy for late September so it was near impossible getting a clear shot. There was a street vendor there selling drinks & snacks, a lot cheaper than the nearby cafe!! Our hire bikes remained safely parked up the whole time we were there, thankfully. Also sat by the sprouting fountains in the park next to the museum, which was beautiful on such a sunny day!

Crazy in Summer. I wanted a pic here but did not know how crazy the Iamsterdam sign would be. It is almost like a "where is wally" pic but i am glad i made the visit. I enjoyed all the Miffy statues and the Sunday market for food and drinks. It is a nice place to just take things easy. All the museums are close by.
A meeting point. meeting point of Amsterdan, but Very busy place in summer, with a lot of touists taking pictures and crossing the street

Beautiful. There isn't much to see here except the iconic "I Amsterdam" sign. But it is a lovely area of Amsterdam. There is a beautiful pool type thing surrounded by parks. By one side there is a line of statues of the infamous "Miffy" all which have been personalized by various artists. I'm not sure if that's permanent or just an exhibition but by that there were a few gift stands and a nice little pop up cafe. There are some surrounding fields were you can sit down and enjoy a nice picnic or join in the many football matches regular people are playing. It actually is the perfect summer location after a long visit to the surrounding museums (of which there are plenty of including the Rikjmuseum). All the walking and learning in the museums...reward yourself with an ice cream on the grass of the Museumplein. It's lovely and serene.

Park, meeting place and art displays. Large open space with lots of people enjoying the outdoors. Kaws sculptures were OK - looked like large black Mickey Mouse but the many Miffy statues that were there when we were (Aug 2015) were whimsical and amusing! Great art in the park! Great place to cool off and relax after a tiring day of touring busy downtown Amsterdam.
A pleasant stroll!. This is simply an area of Amsterdam where you'll find the top museums - great for sitting and people-watching!

Fun stop between museums. Spend a little time people watching here, especially as tourists climb all over the sculpture for photos. Grab a snack or beverage from the nearby vendors and spend a few minutes watching it all before heading to the next museum.

Fun!. Very touristy, but still pretty cool. Climbing on the letters is definitely much scarier than it looks. Even though there are usually lots of people around, it's not hard to get a good picture of all of the letters at once
Crowded, but great. If you are between museums, this is the place. good for a meal or relax break. The letters are the main attraction and are crowded most of the time.

Nice central park where. Nice park to relax and enjoy the sun when it is out in Amsterdam. Nice green spot in the city where the Rijks and Van Gogh museums are located. It is also a good spot for a photoshoot of the i heart amsterdam piece so there are alwasy a good number of people be it tourists or locals just having time out in the field to rest or play with their pets.

Broad Green-way. From me the standout feature is the noble ConcertGebouw at the far end. As a classical musician and as an ardent fan of the orchestra's former conductor Bernard Haitinck, this was pilgrimage for me. With more time we would have gone inside, but that will be another trip.Back to the Museumplein -- for me, it's the green-space that connects wonderful, unparalleled cultural sites. My preference goes squarely to the cultural sites ... the Museumplein is just a lawn that needs crossing.
Great photo op. This is one of the best places to take photos! The letters are large enough to stand or sit on them.

Cool place (a bit crowded). Lovely place for a hangout or picnic on a sunny day. There is always a big crowd, but the further you walk away from the two biggest museum, the more space you get. Not sure if dogs are allowed. NOTE there is a market that sets up there every 3rd SUNDAY of the month.

Obligatory tourist photo spot. Cool statue, but a very busy area. There was a fence up for construction or something that made the area seem even more crowded. There are many other lovely areas of Amsterdam to get some nice pictures.

I amsterdam Sign and Museumplein. Great place if you're visiting the museums. The Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum close to there. with The "I amsterdam" sign. If you're taking (I know you're) a photo of yourself with that sign you'd have to wait a bit for a good clear shot because it's very crowded. Come early and maybe you will get a chance for clear photo in the morning.

Iconic "I Amsterdam". Must see to take photos around the "I Amsterdam" sign. This sign is one of the major postcards of Amsterdam. Easy refreshing walk around the area, and park space surrounding. Just a pleasant place to hang around for an 1hr.

I amsterdam. Great place if you're visiting the museums around. The "I amsterdam" sign is iconic but if you're taking (I know you're) a photo of yourself with that bear in mind it's very crowded so you'd have to wait a bit for a good clear shot. An alternative is to come early in the morning.

Chill out area!. Good place for a picnic. A trip to Amsterdam is not complete without a picture of the iconic "I amsterdam" blocks. You can walk to the National Museum, Van Gogh Museum or Vondelpark from here.

A must but crowded. Great place to go but crowded. Next to Van Gogh Museum. Not good on a rainy day. If you want a good picture go very,very early before the rest of the tourists come. Some kind of construction is taking place so look for the gift shop for the museum and you'll be next to the Amsterdam sign

Average. Huge open space with great opportunity to get the textbook I Love Amsterdam photos.
Pros: lots of space
Cons: the smell was terrible, loads of cyclist everywhere and a lot of drug use in front of small kids.

Worth a Photo. This is a lovely photo opportunity for all, but I think it would be especially grand for young kids. Only problem, there will likely be a lot of other people here getting their photo ops as well. It is a pretty busy area.
Nice place. The best way to start your day is to arrive at the square early, you can enjoy some peaceful before start your journey through the museums.

Beautiful Welcome. Very bold welcome to the country, however it was the first thing you photograph and the first bit of fun! Spent over an hour climbing and photographing my friends and I in, around, on and under the statue. Surrounded by some lovely sunflowers aswell!

I AMSTERDAM!!. The biggest draw being the iamsterdam sign! You simply cant miss it!!
Close to Van Gogh and the rijksmuseum

Great Photo Op. Just a great stop for a photo opportunity. You can climb all over the letters - take your picture how you want. Just keep in mind its super touristy so you will have other people in the photo with you. For us that was not a problem the more the merrier.

Relaxed and atmosphereic. Feels more like a town centre than most pleins in Amsterdam - wide open spaces surrounded by shops museums the museum gardens and when we visited there was a 'Homeless World Cup' tournament going on - yet still plenty of space to walk and relax.
Busy.... Busy... very busy.. the rijksmuseum gardens are free and a very tranquil extra that wasn't expected.

Seems everyone comes here. We tried to get a photo of us in the square but far to many people which is a good thing. Spent a hour or more in the area and saw they were putting up tents for some up coming event. loved the 2 statues in the fountain area though.

Cool location. Not a bad location, kid of like a city square. Has shops, museums, places,to eat etc. I mostly went here to get a picture with the famous I am Amsterdam sign. Not much else to do besides shop, eat, and walk around a bit. The queues for the museum are insanely long. Worth the stop by if your in the area for sure though.

A landmark that all tourists must come. It can be crowded... Do not expect you can get the whole "I amsterdam" to yourself because it will never happen, unless you take it from the back :)
Around museumplein, there are many stalls selling stroopwaffles, waffles and gifts...

Slightly Over rated. We visited Amsterdam in August this year and Museumplien was definitely on the cards. After hearing so much about the museums and the square I was a bit disappointed with the million tourists all over the place. There's just too much happening in one place with the museums and the exhibitions and Miffy and I amsterdam & what all and what not. Most restaurants were packed with ppl & there was hardly place to walk.

A fun place to eat and rest. This is a great area to just sit and people watch. There are food stands available. It is located between the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum. There is always a lot of action going on in the area, a soccer game or free music can be found here.

Great location. Stay around here if you can. The two main museums are here and there are parks, cafes, and lots of things to see and do. It's a quiet area once you get off the main streets. Tram access is excellent too and easy to get to from Amsterdam Central station.
Museum lovers. Main place in Amsterdam for museum lovers. The biggest museums are all close and a photo by the "I amsterdam" is obligatory.

City views for city spotters. The best place for chilling :) when you want to have a special place to drop loose on the grass and look at city life, this is the place to go. Many activities are a aikaboe in the sureoundings and many conerts are held there. We like to buy beer at the local supermarket (at the museum plein) and sit while sipping beer and preparing an Amsterdam speciality for smoking.Highly recommend to go there by bike :)

A pleasant park atmosphere.. A great open area between fantastic museums. Gift shops and merchants are available for prints and other souvenirs. A great place to visit and relax after visiting the Rijks Museum or the Van Gogh Museum. The large, free-standing "I amsterdam" letters are exhibited here.
It's an area... Used for picture taking, a park between the two great museums. With small refreshment areas and souvenir stands.

Typically Amsterdam experience especially on a sunny day. Typically Amsterdam experience with students tourists can be found here but also some major outdoor events take place in this square next to the Rijksmuseum van Goghmuseum and Stedelijk Museum. Please check the Amsterdam calendar when these events take place.
I have a trick. Although the idea is to get the picture at "the" real sign, the one outside the airport is as pretty and way less crowded. You should definitely check both out.

Iconic Dutch spot!. Probably the most popular place in all the city; great for chilling and enjoy the public open areas, located to just walking distance from main museums, restaurants and canals; must be part of the stop if you walk thru the downtown or renting a bike is always a great idea, not recommended during a rainy or cold day; get ready for an amazing city tour and enjoy AMS!

Landmark. Its a place with museums all around. A good landmark to meet up, a memory we ll always remember about Amsterdam. Do go there and make a memory of your own. We had an awesome time clicking wacky pics and having awesome crepes and don't forget to get a bottle of Cognac!
Great place to people watch. Fun place to walk around and have a drink or a quick lunch. Great place to people watch and the art in the Museumplein provided a great enhancement.

Nice memorabilia. Home of the famous I am'sterdam sign it is guaranteed that you will never be alone here. Very crowded at all times you can get a nice picture with half the tourists in Amsterdam in it.

iconic place. perfectly situated between the Van Gogh museum and the RijksMuseum it is the perfect photo-op. also you can have a bite to eat at the many food stands right nearby. people watch and have-as i did-an ice cream!
Come early morning or late evening for best view. Many tourist during the day, I came back early in the morning to get a good unobstructed view for pictures.

A must see. The must see attraction in Amsterdam. I suggest this place for everyone who is going for Amsterdam. Its near Von Gough museum. Its very close to leidseplain and hard rock cafe. After this you can go for dinning or for some coffee .
Ordinary. Not much to do when we were there but lots of people relaxing. Food stalls with very ordinary food and some souvenir shops. Everyone climbs on the Amsterdam sign for a photo
I AMSTERDAM STATUE. must visited tourist attraction for you who idolise social media. i enjoyed pretty much the park though. placed between rijksmuseum and van gogh museum

GO EARLY. If you want a picture of yourself and the sign you must go early otherwise you will have plenty of strangers in your pictures. This is a great place to just walk by and spend sometime and even enter the museum

Museums Galore. The home of the original I amsterdam sign, a vibrant area, with cafe, stalls, souvineer shops and just off the square - museums!
Always busy, but a fun place to be.
Fun sight. A good fun thing to have in lovely surroundings to get a great photo! Was there early evening so had a lot of people in my photo but it was a lovely time to visit the surrounding square.
Great open space after going to the museum. We were lucky to have a sunny day which allowed us to stroll around and enjoy the fun rabbit exhibit
Rijk Museum expect big crowds. We stayed at the JL 76 Hotel which is about an 8 minute work and a fabulous location. This is the entrance to the Rikj Museum.
must see. For those who wants great pictures to remember Amsterdam, this is the place. Best time to go there is early in the morning, when there are few people and it is easier to take good pictures.
So Amsterdam-ish. A nice public space allowing tourists and locals to interact while having fun. Climbing these letters also adds to the charm.
Don't miss this place. This iconic plaza is a great place to stop for photos and a coffee. We took bikes around the city, which is highly recommended.

Must do in Amsterdam. This is the location of the famous I Amsterdam sign and the Rijksmuseum. There are always lots of people and activity going on here. When I visited there was a festival with lots of live music and activities. Must do in Amsterdam.

A must if you're in Amsterdam. M6 husband and I were travelling to London and we had an 8 hour layover at Amsterdam airport. We decided to jump on a train and spend a few hours in Amsterdam and Museumplein is the first place we went! It's a beautiful space with plenty of photo opportunities. It does get quite busy though so you can be waiting to get a good photo with the IAMSTERDAM sign.

Good atmosphere. We spent time here as we visited 2 museums. After the Van Gogh one we had a coffee break in the outside area. There's lots of people around, all taking photos next to the I Am Sterdam modern art sculpture. Ironically outside the Rijkmuseum, which is the most traditional, landscaped area in comparison. Across the road is a diamond museum but we didn't go there. Lots to do in the area.

A spacious beautiful experience of Amsterdam. Only a short distance out of Centrea Amsterdam it could be a world away! The area is bounded and defined especially bu the world class Concert Hall, the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum and is a beautiful, manicured, area of park and gardens. The classical and the Modernist architecture of the buildings sit well together. There is an external life and energy that hints at the music, art and human experience within. Very highly recommended.

Good picture opertunity . A must for all travelers is taking a picture at this iconic spot. No health and safety so you are free to climb on the letters which makes for a fun time although I did get stuck on top of an 'a' and as a results suffered some bruises on the way down. Would definitely recommend
Garden . A big park and a pond is there. You can sit and relax. I Amsterdam sign is visible and a lot of food stalls are there. Calm and quiet area to sit back and enjoy.
Stedjelijk. You have to go there if you're in Amsterdam. A space for air and contemplation in an otherwise crowded and somewhat claustrophobic city.

I Heart Amsterdam. The Museumplein has it all and is a must for anyone visiting Amsterdam. The sign is of course a fun place for picture taking. The water feature is very nice to cool yourself. This is a lovely area to walk around especially if the weather is nice. The perfect place to relax, people watch, and enjoy public art while visiting the museums. Well maintained grounds, with many museum shops and food vendors nearby.
Great Photo Place! Tourist Central!. So much fun walking around this area and seeing the art. Lots of tourists!! Great photo spots to remember your trip. Great view of the Rijksmuseum .
Great & fun. Nice area, definitely worth a visit if not for the attractions at least for a walk and a couple of pictures at the I amsterdam sign.
Very pretty. Really neat area. The museums are beautiful, the shops and restaurants nearby are good, and the views are awesome. Tram and bus service takes you right to the Rijksmuseum. Recommended!

A must see. We pasted this on a bike tour and it was so amazing to see. We had to wait a long time to make sure the sign was free, as so many people want a photo in front of it. We had 30 in out group so we really wanted a group photo. Its really huge though, so you will need to pano to get it all in!

Museums in EVERY direction. Plenty to see in terms of architecture and of course the magnificent museums. (the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, and Stedelijk Museum - and the concert hall Concertgebouw). Lots of green around. Kids running around on the green grass and having fun in this fabulous atmosphere. When we visited they were getting ready for a music festival. So lots of construction was going on but still the atmosphere was great.The highlight for me was having fun with the I amsterdam letters. Mind you it gets really crowded out there so just come prepared to mingle with the crowd.

Rock the sign! Period. . Fun sign! Go take a few photos...
Great plaza for people watching or enjoying the grand old architecture.
Cultural Festival. A bright sunny afternoon, a choice of music, a variety of entertainment, a chance to peruse all the sites to visit throughout the Netherlands - all free !! what could be better ?

Chilling here sometimes. One of the best places at Amsterdam. You will find a green area with benches, small park with fountain and a bunch of flowers. People are coming to play with a ball or pets or each other. Good place to get some beer and to chill out.

Place to be on a sunny day. Close with all the art you can get from wideworld known masters, as well lesser known. Opposite the music tempe from Europe as far as I am concerned. As abonus you can eat fairly well around there in several places for a reasonable amount. In short: have a pcknick on the museumplein :)
For Museum lovers, outstanding.. The Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum are less that 100 yards apart, around a very nice park area. Trams are available to all parts of town from here.
Cute. Cute, stand in front of I AM AMSTERDAM and have your picture taken. Nice area near the Van Gogh museum.
weekend in between museums. I Was very impressed last weekend when I visited Van Gogh museum , All around was full of sunflowers, it makes really sunshine with such a bad and cold weather!

Great cover for your photo memory book! :). We found 2 places where you could climb on the Amsterdam letters. (Outside the airport and here on the street.) It was a bit scary to see so many climbing on letters and standing on top of the 'I' but a fun photo opportunity that they sure wouldn't allow in the USA, if only for insurance purposes! ha! Go, Climb, Smile, Snap photos! You'll love it!

Climb and catch a letter. Another must in Amsterdam is the Museumplein.If you are capable climb up and pose to pictures on your name letter or your desired letter. That is what my daughter did.It is fun especially in good weather.
spend a day here.. This is probably the only place on earth where one can stand in the middle of a beautiful square and find world-class museums in EVERY direction...No matter where you turn.

Sunflowers and Architecture glory. Much fun to be had on the I Amsterdam sign! Plenty to see in terms of architecture, green, the magnificent museums and at the moment a glorious display of sunflowers around the Van Gogh museum! There was a music festival when we attended and it was a fabulous atmosphere.
Can't Miss Photo Op. Lean on the "a" or tuck yourself in the shadows of the "m" of the "I amsterdam" signage for a photo before visiting the surrounding museums. Fun, festive and friendly area!
A must see. The had a miffy sculptures path when I visited, that was really cool. There is food outside if you want a snack. This is a must see place to take a picture in Amsterdam.

Splendid spaces.. The Stedeljik modern art collection is inside a building that looks like a bath tub on top of a greenhouse. Outside the Van Gogh museum this week there were thousands of sunflowers, marking the 125th anniversary of his death. There were almost as many people queuing to get inside. Beyond is the Rijksmuseum, which is quieter and gives you more room and time to see the paintings. Careful in the wide arched entrance, which is also a through road for cyclists. The gardens surrounding it were full of sculptures by Juan Miro. The 'Escaping Girl', made of red mannikin legs, a blue metal block, a yellow plate for a face, with a red tap on top, was posed in a lily pond - so it seemed to be part mermaid and part junk pulled out of the water.

A place to people watch. This is a great place to hang out. The I Amsterdam sign was quite a draw, especially for those agile enough to climb up onto the letters. (not me, sorry to say) The park is spacious, with many places to sit and look at the people and the scenery. There is a great exit at this moment, of bunnies of various types-also a draw for picture taking.

Good, but disrespected in some regards.. I enjoyed it here. There's a huge amount of things to do to keep yourselves occupied, however the 'IAMSTERDAM' sign shouldn't have been used as a climbing frame in my opinion. If you want to visit a museum, this is your place.
amsterdam i am. A unique photo opportunity to showcase amsterdam.Many tourists spending time capturing a loved one enjoying the moment
Brilliant!. Amazing!!! real tourist area which can get busy but brilliant photo opportunities! Close to lots of shops and the famous ' Amsterdam delights'

Nice area. This is a really nice area which obviously has the famous I amsterdam sign! It was very busy though and I could barely even take any pictures. The little pond in the middle is really cute too but i was disappointed because when we got there, there was a massive samsung dome in the middle blocking the view. But would recommend visiting here.

Selfie sticks at the ready !!!. This installation framed by the museum and square is a perfect joyous reflection of the fun and happiness of Amsterdam. Take lots of photos and expect that you will not be alone in any of them.

Cant miss if you are in Amsterdam. So basically this is where all the major museums in Amsterdam are located including the Van Gogh museum. A must visit for history and art lovers. Well connected by tram lines, its easy to reach. Advisable to buy tickets in advance as the rush especially on weekends is a bit too much.

Could be better. There are too much people there.
Should have someoone to control the people who are taking photos. There are people climbing the letters, breaking parts of it, and breaking the flowers.
If you wanna take a picture there, would be you and 35 more people

Place to People Watch. There is no way to get a good picture of I Amsterdam unless you go very early. It is crowded and fun to people watch. It makes you laugh to see where people hide and pop out for pictures.

Not much to see or do. Not much to do or see when went in late August, there were a couple of food stalls and that was about it. I assume it's better when there is a market on. We stumbled across it when visiting the Van G museum
Photo op. Just for the photo really and because it's near the museums. Expect a lot of people doing the same and some (a lot) of garbage on the ground.

Go during the cultural festival. I went during the UIT MARKT (Out Market) festival at the end of August when the whole square was abuzz with life, that is the best time to go for wandering around yummy food stalls and watching free live music.
Make This A Bucket List Item. One of the best areas in the world. Just to walk through the area, and visit the museums with famous works of art...you have not lived until you've visited here.

I Am sterdaaaaam. Took the family on a visit to the area and found it very nice..... lots of activities to do in the park. lots of things to see... just good fun... But make sure you go on a nice day.Oh and a nice tip for you all... if you see there are too many people jumping on the "i amsterdam" then try and take pictures from the other side of the sign. You might ask why? well if you take the photo from the other side it will be written backwards but with a quick photo edit you can flip it and hey presto... plus the added bonus of the background instead of the normal museum background... ;)

Fun in the Sun. Great to visit and walk around on a nice warm day. Large open-air space with a man-made lake, sculptures and several vending stands, serving waffles, pancakes, sandwiches, drinks, and ice creams. Also lots of gift stands. A first class Museum Shop is also on the grounds, as well as one indoor restaurant with bathroom facilities. Easy to get to from many tram lines and can be incorporated with any of the great museums there (Rijksmusem, Van Gogh, Stedelijk, Concertebouw)

Beautiful place to sit and relax, or to walk through.... If for no other reason, you'll see the iAmsterdam sign which everyone wants a picture of!There is so many lovely places to just sit and chill out in this area, and just people watch and time slowly passes by. We walked through the Museumplein most days of our visit - either heading onto vondelpark (equally worth a visit!) or to the museums themselves and I must admit to it being one of my favourite areas as it's just so full of culture and I found myself just enjoying the ambience of Amsterdam. If in Amsterdam, take some time out and take a walk through this area, I'm sure you'll enjoy it!

You must get your picture taken here!. A fun area for relaxing or eating.
You can get here by bike, taxi or tram.
This would be a great place to get your museum tickets instead of waiting in line

Beautiful complex. Loved this!!! Weather was perfect which added to the experience. Plenty of places to sit and relax. Food options were nice--really enjoyed the waffles here! This is definitely a place to return to on our next Amsterdam visit. There are plenty of museum options and shopping kiosks to take advantage of. One could spend the whole day here.

Best people watching in AMS . Great place to sit out on large beautiful lawns and watch the world go by. Bathrooms in the building adjacent to I AMSTERDAM sign for half Euro. Accessible for the large museums and concert hall.

Take a picture. Its a bit of hype. The day we were there, it was very crowded and you could not even see the place for a second in its entirety.
Still this is where everyone takes their famous Amsterdam picture so I am sure you wouldn't wanna miss this.
Good place. Nice place to eat something and relax a little bit. View of 3 museums around and the I am Amsterdam plate.
Go early in the morning!. Obviously a must-see if you're a first-timer in Amsterdam- which I was. Typically jammed with tourists in the afternoon when I got there but worth a look anyway.

Just meant for 1 time visit. This place is a one time visit in Amsterdam. It is a super crowded place. So if you are looking forward to some interesting photography that is very difficult to happen.It is very crowded and right next to van gough museum.

Nice photo op. Lovely open plan area. Good for photo opportunity with IAMSTERDAM sign, however it was very busy when we went so was difficult to get a picture. Found the sign closer to the centre one night. Still unsure why!

I Amsterdam!. The open space/park land in front of the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum is a popular place to relax and enjoy the ambiance of this beautiful city. The I amsterdam sign is a can't-miss photo op. Can't wait to go back again!

Great place to relax and enjoy the view.. Situated right across the entrance to the Rijksmuseum, this place is a huge esplanade to climb the "Iamsterdam" sign and get the popular picture, to stroll around or sit down, relax and have a picnic. Easily arrived at by tram and with plenty of little shops to browse around.

Rijksmuseum. A wonderful experience, so much to see there. However, book online to avoid queueing and arrive early in the morning to avoid the worst of the crowds. Go to 'The Night Watch ' first thing as that room gets particularly crowded.

Where to start in Amsterdam . Our hotel was very near this and it was an excellent point to start our Amsterdam trip. It's beautiful with lots to see and do. Gets pretty busy in the afternoon but if you start early you can avoid the crowds if you're that way inclined. The gardens are beautiful and there are lots of stalls and views to see. Great family area.

Nice open space with I Amsterdam letters. A great open space with three of Amsterdam's biggest and most famous museums in close proximity.The "I Amsterdam" letters are now here, too, in front of the Rijksmuseum and present a good free photo opportunity - but you'll have to wait patiently to get a good shot thanks to the huge crowd of people, and you'll never get the whole sign to yourself.Plenty of cafes and small eating places nearby, too.

Fun park to visit and free!. If you get a bit fatigued from museums and galleries or just want somewhere free and fun to wander around this is a great place in Amsterdam. It has a good vibe and lots to see. While we were there, there was also an outdoors Joan Miro sculpture exhibition in the adjoining gardens to the museum and museumplein. It also had a cute 'bunny' sculpture exhibition. Nice place to sit in the sun and just enjoy. Every shop is of course expensive around it, but if you bring your own snacks and drinks it is just as nice.
Very good place to see the histrionic part of Amsterdam. Spent half a day here and loved it. So many things to see, so will suggest to hv time in your hands to enjoy it to the fullest.

Make sure to spend 30 minutes to take photos with the IAMsterdam letters. The plein is a place to take time for itself! Children and adults will enjoy taking photos with the IAmsterdam letters so we planned for 30-45 minutes just for that and it was great.Don't rush them. take the time to relax and have fun.

I Amsterdam Picture. It's a nice park to visit since many museum and attractions are available in the same place. I do advice you to go however keep in your mind that many constructions, renovations and kiosk building are happening right now which disturb the view
must see. Great place to walk around but there is always a lot of people hanging on the sign its also next to the lots of food trucks and shopping places.

Big, paved, crowded on a Sunday at mid-day.. This big public space out the door of the huge art museum was too crowded and noisy for our taste. Mass oriented food shops and Giant colored letters with very few benches to sit on, after 2+ museum hours. Try the small formal garden around canal side for a rest.

Nice area to relax in the center of Amsterdam.. Nice relaxed park-like area in the area behind The Rijksmuseum. It's central to many of the main museum attractions in Amsterdam, Van Gogh, Diamant, Rijksmuseum and a few others. It's also a nice area to relax and drink a cup of coffee or eat a sandwich. There's a 'tours and tickets' kiosk at Museumplein where you can purchase a fast-pass / bypass ticket to enter the museums - skipping the often very long lines.... and recommend for the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseums.

Good central meeting point. This is a central area of Amsterdam with a range of museums and concert halls. It has an underground car park and tram stop. There is also a good underground store to by food by the car park for a picnic if the weathers good.

Bustling and Vibrant area. Really liked it here, the tram from our hotel stopped here so we visited every day of our trip. Lots to see and do. We bought hot dogs and drinks from street vendors and they weren't overpriced which was nice to see.

A great city playground. Ours hotel was right next to the museumplein and we enjoyed the area each night we were there. There was a huge festival going on this weekend with three or four stage shows with live entertainment, skateboarding park, loads of food kiosks, book sales, and a genuine festival feeling. The crowd was enormous.

Nice. Good place to go to the museums. It is very crowded tho!
The famous I AMsterdam sign is here, so you should come to take your picture!

Wonderful plaza with museums museums museums. It's called Museumplein for a reason: lot's of great museums! This plein is large and popular with tons of great things to see. On nice days you can chill here, relax on a bench, and get snack-type food from the many vendors. Plus it's super convenient to get here via tram. A must-visit in Amsterdam.
Museum pocket. This is the area you want to go to if you want to check out the museums, most importantly the Van Gogh museum. Very crowded during the afternoon hours.
Good outside space. Good outside space but very crowded. Good spot to people watch and rest between museums. Tram 12 drops you right in front.

Fun city park. Fun place located between the Van Gogh and Rijks Museum. Display area for UNICEF miffies--bunny sculptures decorated by various artists as a fund raiser. Lots of little vendors selling prints, hats and other souvenirs as well as sandwiches and cold drinks. Large pool with a sculpture of two children playing in center--I saw several people wading in the pool.
Lovely square in front of the Rijksmuseum. Lovely square in front of the Rijksmuseum, with a fountain and lots of contemporary art in all its forms
Must. Famous sign I AMsterdam is located in this square. Whole is located in the middle of several museums like Rijksmuseum or Van Gogh museum. Great place for taling a photo and absolute must to see

People watch. Loved this square...so much to take in, great atmosphere, great area to people watch. Fantastic to have all these museums so close by. Plenty of cafes to have a drink or sandwich and soak up the atmosphere

Very Relaxing. A great place to let all of the art sink in. Lots of great sculptures for photo ops. There is a grocery store close to the car park which is underneath Museumplein that has lots of delicious things to go - a great place for delicious picnic supplies.

It is a fun area. This is a very fun area. There are lots of fountains, you can take pictures with the I Amsterdam sign, watch the street performers, eat at the food trucks and go and see all of the museums.
Hangout Place.. Great place to hangout in Amsterdam and maybe enjoy a game of football on the lawns nearby. Located near the museum district.

OK!. on our 10 hour layover at Amsterdam, we went here for a quick visit. It was super crowded! I couldn't get a nice photo of the I AM AMSTERDAM. Lol! But a nice place to relax because of the greeneries.

Disappointed . So crowded, people everywhere. Museums are expensive, the Iamsterdam sign has people constantly crawling all over it and not moving for a good 20 minutes. Not really the best place to go when you visit Amsterdam, wouldn't bother

A good break near the museums. This is a fun area with art, a couple of small shops, and a a few food stands. The highlight is taking your picture with the I Amsterdam sign though! I'd definitely recommend if you're visiting either or both the Rijksmuseum or Van Gogh Musuem.

Interesting. A nice, if crowded at times, spot to chill for a while. Lots of museums are close and there are plenty of photo opportunities with the sign and art installations. There are also a number of cafes for food and a drink
Fun time. Picture time , fun all around, surrounded by the museums, stop for a bit and take a pic by the I amsterdam sign. A must.
A selfie must on your social media. If you search for photos of amsterdam on social media you will see lots of photos taken here! Young and fun crowd ;))
Nice hangout. The hangout place between museum and opera. Very relaxed atmosphere, although very busy with tourists. If you visit a museum there, take some time to walk around.

Lunch at Museumplein. Very nice place, I think I ordered mint tea and fries. What amused me the most it is the toilet (it is not free cause as i understood it is for everybody use not only cafe visitors, but you get some check that allows you to go for free). So toilet has crystal doors, it becomes muddy when you lock the door)))

Fantastic place for chilling and people watching. Arriving too early for dinner at our chosen restaurant we had a walk around the area and came across the Museumplein, and I'm pretty glad we did.It's a large public area that boasts the Van Gogh Museum, the Rijksmuseum, the Stedelijk Museum, and a concert hall as it's neighbours. There's also a huge water feature which had people wading in as it was such a hot day. So there's plenty to see and take pictures of.Although busy, it was fantastic just sitting there sipping on ice cold drinks watching humanity drift by.When we went the place was full of Miffy statues, Miffy being a Dutch cartoony rabbit creation, which just added to the pleasure of being in the area.If you're after somewhere just to relax and soak up the atmosphere of being in Amsterdam then you could do far worth than visit this place,

Perfect place to tale a brake. With a nice bar, Museumplein is a perfect place to seat down and relax a bit, from a walk or after one of the museums around. A bit tumultuous, and surrounded by 4 museums (Rijks, Van Gogh, Diamant and Stedelijk) Museumplein is a happy pretty place. You may get there by 2 &5 tram lines.
Kids love climbing the sign!. Kids absolutely loved climbing on the sign! Nice patio nearby to have a drink right near the sign and a cute playground.

Great spot to do some people watching and just hang out. We loved spending time at Museumplein. First, you have great, first class museums to visit. There is the "I am Amsterdam" attraction which has become a must-visit and a must-take a-picture sight. You can eat a delicious and decadent waffle in one of the street stands. You can just sit back and relax and do some people-watching in the Rijksmuseum gardens, where the very entertaining water fountain seduces everyone to play. For all the touristy-ness of the area, it feels very relaxed and it truly is very enjoyable. It is a place where I can swing by every day for a simple, pleasant stroll.
nice good photo ops. the Musemumplein is a nice plaza between the rikesmuseum and the Van Goh museum with some public art and a nice fountain I think I prefered it to the vondelpark
Full of Miffy's when I was there. Good place to head for the Rijks or Van Goth, Plenty of touristy places to eat, good tourist information.

Musemplein. This is a great area of Amsterdam where you can have your picture taken next to the infamous I amsterdam sign, chill in the parks and visit the different museums. Definitely worth a visit but get there early if you want a decent picture with the sign as this is obviously a very popular area for tourists.

Take a break between museums!. A fun and lovely park in the midst of the city. I was impressed with its cleanliness considering the number of visitors it gets. A great place to have a rest and walk around between museum visits.

A Must See!. This is where all the people go! Walking the streets of Amsterdam, it doesn't feel very crowded, until you make it to Musemplein. Great people watching, street food, shops, and of course the Van Gogh Museum. There is a nice garden area with statues and sculptures, including a mini-bar/cafe.

A great park in the middle of all the major museums. There is currently an exhibition of Miffy statues decorated by various artists. I brought my two children up with the Miffy books by Dick Bruna, so was delighted to see so many spread throughout the park. You can even buy kits which includes a white Miffy and paint, so you can paint your very own. My daughters are too old for this now, but I was tempted.
Very good place. Very happening and colorful area, lot of museums around, some of the good food joints in near by area

a sign that you have been there :). an amsterdam sign. a sign that you have been there. but the great this is what around. park, and sometimes theres a local young people do some atraction and its fun :)

Busy place with many museums. It is an attractive area to visit with many sculptures and beautiful buildings. However, it's popular and you won't get a pic of the letters unless u visit very early or very late

Landmark. I Amsterdam sign. It is really impossible to take a photo with this landmark because there are so many people climbing on it at any given time. I was able to snap a picture of my daughter in the a but I had to wait for about ten minutes to get everyone else to move out of the way. I would say you would have to visit very early in the morning to get the sign to yourself for a good photo.

Loved just laying on the grass!!. What a place! What a magical, beautiful, relaxing place. We had done a few museums and found the back of the Van Goh and Rijks Museums and it was gorgeous. It has a large grassy area with a view of the beautiful Rijks Museum and sculptures all around. It's a perfect place to just take a break from the museums, grab some space and relax. There were people all around us with picnic baskets and right behind the Rijks Museum on Museumplein is the big IAmsterdam sign with people climbing all over it - great for pictures. If you're walking from the grass toward the Rijks, head down into the garden on your right and stand in the middle of the water fountain where you can remain completely dry while the water goes up and down all around you.Our 16-year-old daughter just loved laying down on the grass and relaxing with all the others.What a beautiful place.
Day out!. Nice area for a fun day out with the kids, especially if the weather permits. Lovely park, a playground for the kids and numerous places to have coffee or eat lightly.

Free entertainment in Amsterdam. A good place to visit with children as there are lots of things to entertain them. Loved the child like statues which would encourage an interest in more sophisticated sculptures as children got older.

Don't expect to buy tickets for attractions and they be close by.... This area has an a giant fountain with Micky and Mini mouse in it. Amazing waffles from the stalls.. ALWAYS get your tickets from tours and more before visiting the attractions for discount.

Miffys galore. Miffys everywhere! And the sign was a big novelty. Lovely place to just sit and relax for a while, take in the sights then go looking in the museums. Definitely recommend people to come here
Chill!. An open space area with a pool! Nowadays Miffy is exhibited on the left of the pool by the iamsterdam sign! Lay on the huge lawn after a visit to the museums and enjoy the crowd passing by!

We love Amsterdam!. Recommendations: Get a pastry from bakkerij Kwakman at Leidsestraat 81, a great way to start the day.
Lucius Seafood Restaurant, Spuistraat 247.
Spend a little time watching the world go by. Another great place to watch the world go by. Nice to be able to dip your feet in the ice cool water - the kids loved playing in the shallow water.
Easy to get to. The famous I amsterdam gathers a lot of people around it. Very busy neighborhood, I loved it! Easy to get to.

Nice place to chill.... A nice place to be in. Sit on the grass, enjoy the sunshine.
The only negative side is there are lots of tourists on high traffic days.

Open space.. A pleasant place to spend some time. On a sunny day it was nice to see just the people passing by. Do not make this your first place to see but if you are going to the Art Galleries, have a look. The I amsterdam letters are worth a photo.
short photo trip. i was there to take my picture at the i amsterdam sign.. too crowded, but people do give turn here.. buy your miffy !!

3 of the best. What an excellent art city! Amsterdam has 3 super museums in one area: the classic Rijksmuseum with its Rembrandts and much more; the specialist Van Gogh Museum with its modern style and approach; plus the true modern art museum Stedelijk which featured and astonishing special exhibit on Matisse, his influences and those he influences even today.
Too crowded for a good picture. It is an iconic area with nice view, but awfully crowded. If you want to take a nice picture you need to be there either really early or way too late.

Very interesting. This is a very pretty and interesting section of the city. There are a number of museums that get quite busy early in the day and even busier later on...There are vendors and places for children to play with a large number of locals enjoying the public spaces.
Classic. Water for kids to play in. Grass to run around on. Great scenery. A great place for picnics and people watching. Also a classic location nearby some classic arts and museums.
Busy!. Iconic area which means loads of people!! Get there early to get a chance of a photo in front of that sign.
Too crowded for a good photoshoot. While iconic, the place was too crowded to get a good shot, especially the I amsterdam sign. Try to go early in the morning.
Love it.. Great to have a memory like this one. If you're coming to Amsterdam you have to be here! Is at must if not is like you did not come to Amsterdam.
Great place just to have a sit down.. Stubbled across this place after visiting the Bols experience - nice place to sit and chill out. We saw 3 lads busking and they were fantastic!
Great place for photos and watch the world go by!. The "I am Amsterdam" sign is here along with a fountain that everyone is playing near. Nice scenery and great people watching.

My Best Tramstop!. Major museums of Amsterdam which are Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and Stedelijk Museum are all located in Museumplein, which is also the name of the stop if you are travelling by Tram. You can spend hours even days here! There are several cafes and a big open area in front of Rijkmuseum where you can lie on grass, relax, make a picnic and enjoy the great appearance of Rijk structure. You can spend hours even days here (based on the number of museums you will visit and how detailed your visit will be).

Beautiful place to visit. I just don't think you can say you have been to Amsterdam until you take your picture with the I Amsterdam letters in the beautiful Museumplein, is so amazing to ride your bike pass the museum and then just relax in the beautiful park, or go for a skate in the mini-ramp if you're into that ha ha :)
Not too great. Nothing special, kind of boring. I'm not an art kind of person, but I just found it not as good as it could of been.

You must visit the RIjksmuseum and also the Van Gogh Museum. This is one reason for coming to Amsterdam---not the plein itself but the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. The former has recently been overhauled and it is one of the most beautiful and accessible museums anywhere, with excellent labels in both Dutch and English that tell visitors why they are bothering to look at this picture or this statue or this object----not just its name and date and who donated it.

Nice area but very busy. The best thing to do to get the best photo next to this sign is to go really early in the morning as it can get very busy during the day. Other area is such a nice place to hang out though , defiantly worth a visit

Open space, souvenir shops, great food. Museumplein is a nice spot to meet friends and just relax on the grass before or after going to the Stedelijk, Van Gogh, or Rijksmuseum. There are a few toney art galleries and other shops around. We enjoyed climbing on the "IAmsterdam" giant letters and the Miffy UNESCO installation and shop - great places for photos and selfies! Bike racks are often crowded, but you'll find something if you persist.

Fun Area!. This was such a fun area to explore while waiting for our assigned time at the Van Gogh Museum! We took photos in the I am sterdam sculpture, explored all the Miffy the Bunny sculptures, visited the museum gift shops, checked out the food stands, and enjoyed the sculpture garden at the Rijksmuseum.

Place to chill in the city centre. Really liked it here :) Enjoyed paddling in the water, looking at the art installations, finding a shady spot for a drink or ice cream and lazing on the grass. Found ourselves back here many times as there are at least 4 of the big museums situated very nearby, as well as the Heineken brewery and it was a lovely relaxing space to find in the middle of a city.
Good holiday. Nice experience. Lots of people. Amsterdam is amazIng and would go back again for sure. Friendly people and good atmosphere where ever you go.
Get Your Picture Taken Here. This is a very cool area with the famous I Love Amsterdam sculpture that everyone gets their picture taken posing somewhere among the letters.

My favourite spot in the city. I visit Museumplein every week at least once. It's crazy busy around the museums and around the iAmsterdam sign, but there's always a seat free around the square, or space to sit on the grass when it's dry and enjoy a quiet lunch alone with my thoughts.Plenty of pop up displays and events occur here, I've been to a one week pop up art gallery showcasing local talent, the current Nijntje/Miffy statue exhibit and ArtZuid, a Free Palestine event, and seen many displays that show up for a week or two and move on. Of all the public spaces in Amsterdam I find Museumplein to be the most peaceful (when you avoid the busy spots). I enjoy watching the skateboarders on the half pipe. It also has the best Albert Heijn supermarket with a sushi bar and of course three of the biggest and best museums. Pre-book for those before you go to avoid the stupidly long queues.

A great place to hang out. It's a great place to hang out. During the summer, come early to beat the crowds. Past 9 AM, you won't be able to get a decent picture with the I Amsterdam sign. You can have a picnic breakfast or just sit in one of the cafes while waiting for the museum to open. There is kind of a trick fountain behind the sign where kids can have a bit of fun. Bring towels and a change of clothes for your kids. There's also a small playground, a basketball court and a small skate park.

Get there early to avoid all tourists.. If you want to take a picture with the iconic Iamsterdam sign then you'll have to get up early or go later in the evening (but the light might not be good). In the day it's crazy with tourists either taking photos (so be prepared to have others in your selfies infront of the sign) or queuing for the museums around. Worth a visit but if you're easily annoyed at crowds I'd try and get there before they arrive early in the morning
Just WAY too busy. Very busy, people everywhere. Nice touch with the lounge chairs on the grass, but it was hopelessly overcrowded everywhere.

Great Place For People Watching. Museumplein is set among several museums. It is a well designed public space and attracts a lot of people on a nice day. This is a good place to hang out and watch the throngs. A variety of inexpensive foods are available for purchase.

Beautiful park well worth seeing. This park is located in front of Rijksmuseum and bordered by the Van Gogh and Stedlijk museums so if you visit one of these, you can't avoid the park. It had a visiting exhibit, Miffy the rabbit - numerous sculptures of the famous rabbit interpreted by different artists. A pleasant place to spend time between museum visits with nearby cafes.

Always something to see. Between the three big art museums (the Van Gogh, the Rijksmuseum and the Stedelijk) and the Concertgebouw concert hall, the Museumplein is a large grassy open space - perfect for chilling out amid all the culture. There's a fountain at the Rijksmuseum end and a big 'I Am sterdam' sculpture to climb on (always nice for a photo). In the winter there is a skating rink, in the summer there are occasional free concerts and the excellent UitMarkt (28-30 August in 2015). There always seems to be something fun to look at - currently a parade of Nijntje/Miffy bunny statues - and the inclined slope is great for people-watching.
Love. Loved this park spent a lot of time there. Surrounded by several museums and a real chilled out environment

Such a wonderful place!. The Museumplein has it all and is a must for any tourist! The large IAMSTERDAM sign just has to be posed beside/upon and the shallow central pond is great for paddling in (for adults and kids alike). The park is edged by the Rijkmuseum as well as the Van Gogh Museum and the House of Bols is across the road. There are bars, food and ticket stalls and plenty of places to sit and people watch while enjoying the street entertainers who wow the crowds with their various antics.Definitely a must see!
Watching and water. Definitely go here in a hot day to dip your feet in the fountain water and watch people walk by. Always allot to see here.

Museums surrounded by parks with beautiful green grass and flower creations. The place is very special, many museums, parks to walk through. The weather was beautiful, because it was a middle of July, and you could see all the flower and grass creations outdoors, but the museums are extremely crowded and if you want to get into any of them, and wait less than three hours, you need to come very early.

Nice Green Space Among the Museums. The sign is of course a fun place for photos. Just expect crowds. The water feature is very nice too and during our visit people were walking through it to cool their feet.We found a shady bench along the long green park area and enjoyed a picnic lunch of food picked up at a local supermarket, which is at the far end of the lawn area furthest point away from the sign.

Great for photos. This is a lovely area to walk around if the weather is nice. You can get lots of nice photos and relax at the bar where they make great hotdogs. It's especially nice if you have children, as they can play freely. Even if it gets crowded, it is nice for a more rustic break compared to the city centre.
Photo opputunity. Good for a photo opportunity and to see street entertainers but very busy with crowds. We didn't stay long

Great place to relax before or after museum visit. Great to hang out on the grass before or after visiting Van Gogh, Stedijk or Rijks museum. In winter they have a skating rink. And always nice to see the I amsterdam sign and all the tourist climbing all over taking pictures
Go early or very late. If you want a nice picture, you should go early (8-9AM) or late around 7PM. Otherwise, it is so crowed that you can manage to get a nice picture.

A complete different view. Miffy sculptures everywhere. Water to dip your feet into when its hot and all the museums in one place..
This quarter was so different to every where else.
GO SEE!

A really nice place for children. A place where your children can run around without fear, and be happy. The climbing on the letters, or standing within the water feature allows the children to run about and have fun, while an adult can sit down and rest, possibly to get over some jet lag.

Go here not for the sign but for relaxing and people watching. The I amsterdam sign is the main attraction here but unless you go there at 6am you will have many other people photobombing your shot. So go here to relax and appreciate the museums and structures anyhow they come together. If you want a photo of the sign, the one at the airport is less crowded. There are a few free wifi options as well
A Green Oasis. The perfect place to relax, people watch, and enjoy public art while visiting the museums. Well maintained grounds, with museum shop and food shops nearby.
A place to chill out and relax. We sat in a bar here enjoying people watching. Also gad a paddle in the small water area to cool off.

Good combined ticket.. If we had had the stamina and the time we could have doubled the number of museums we visited. Was not necesssarily cost effective but convenient in that we were able to get bus/ tram/rail within Amsterdam and not worry about getting tickets.
Nice place. This is a good place to buy museum souvenirs and tickets, grab a quick lunch, or just people watch. It is a nice place to hang out when the weather is beautiful.
A very nice park surrounded by museums.. The park is located next to Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and the Diamond Museum. It has a nice park with amazing statues from many artists.

A fun park for kids and art lovers alike. A bit dusty in the heat but Museumplein is such good fun for people watching, playing with children in the splash park, and we loved the artists renditions of Nijntje (Miffy) on show for her 60th anniversary. A tip if you['re thirsty: try getting a freshly made juice at the coffee bar next to the Iamsterdam scultpure - we had their juice of the day which was cucumber and cinnamon (sounds strange, tasted delicious!).

One massive building with so much to see. Without knowing too much about Duth past, this museum certainly filled in the gaps. As you progress up the different levels and rooms you are brought back in time to see some fantastic pieces.A TIP: If you want to see Van Gogh, get the combo ticket as it will save money and queue times too.

Great place to be!. I'm not a museum lover and usually I don't go to museums in my vacations, but Museumplein is a very beautiful place to be. There is the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh! The sign I Amsterdam is in there and there will be lots of people taking pictures. You will have to compete with them for space, but at the end it is very funny to see them trying to be inside or on the letters.
Lovely spot. Great spot to get a obligatory photo! you can't go without it. Busy but buzzing, good atmosphere and plenty to keep you entertained!

Perfect relax-spot with a view. Perfect for a summer day! Large field of grass with museums all around. With a local grocery store around the corner, all you need for a relaxing day in the sun is within reach. In the meantime, don't forget to enjoy the view of the Rijksmuseum & Concertgebouw (Concert Hall).

The museum area. The place to be to see Amsterdam museums such as the Riijks (beautiful building), Van Gogh etc. They are steps away from each other. The iconic I AM AMSTERDAM sign is her and at the airport. It is a pretty park like area.

Museum Area of Amsterdam. Crowded. Open area which houses several of the museums which you will be visiting while in Amsterdam. Because of this it is very busy during peak tourist time. Go early ( like before 9.00am) if you want a good photo opportunity with the famous I Amsterdam sign. Like alot of the main tourist areas of Amsterdam I was disappointed with the rubbish everywere. The cigarette butts are a real problem in the city. Disgusting watching the young people smoking and just butting them out of the ground. Very crowded area that I was glad to get away from one I had finished my museum experience. This review is for the area itself not the museums themselves.

Have to. This was one of those things that everyone has to do when you visit Amsterdam. Also great photo spot. The area is clean and beautiful. Great to just sit and enjoy with friends or buy tickets for the museum.

Lovely place, with lots of street and improv shows.. Lovely place, right near the bus station. There's always a street event - dancers, comedians.... Lovely place for a drink, a dessert or a hot-dog and a rest in between attractions.

Buzzing Place!. Busy place becuase of all the museums. Good place to be though sort of buzzing. There is a body of water which is good for relaxing with your feet in on a hot day after loads of walking. There are a few places to get food. Van Gough, Rijks, Coster Diamonds are all here to see!
WONDERFUL AREA. Wonderful area full of life, green, arts and stands where you can eat good food and snacks. There also is a booth where you can buy tickets for museums.

Engaging on many levels. The immediate area has much to offer - just sunbathing to three major museums to people-watching. In the gardens to one side of the Rijksmuseum are chairs and benches allowing one to just relax and soak up the ambience of the area.
Great museum. Very good museum and not far from dam square, really great walk down to the museum and get to see alot of amesterdam and get to take pictures outside on the iconic I AMSTERDAM sign
Bustling Square. Museumplein is a bustling place. Not at all sombre and stately as you might expect (or at least I had). There's the fun IAMsterdam sign there to pose by, and nice water features.

Photo-taking spot. I think this is a place where tourists cannot miss. People just climbed on different letters to take picture with this sign. Surrounding is a big green park where you can chill as well.

A Sign. This is a busy park. It is mostly flat and situated in between multiple museums. It is a good place to eat a picnic but when me and my girlfriend tried, some guy came up to us and started saying anti-USA things. Being Canadian we listened and laughed and then walked away because he was scary. Get a tourist picture with the sign (but expect 60+ tourists to be in it as well) and move on to better things.
Greenery. A lovely expanse of water and greenery in the centre of the Museum Quarter that is a great place to sit down, have a rest and watch the crowd go by. Lots of people here on sunny days.

Pleasant pastime especially watching people misjudge the Water Fountain frequency and being soaked.. After nearly all day visiting Rijksmuseum, we wandered into Miro in the gardens at the back and found this pleasant place to relax. We were surprised to see yet another exhibition by Spanish Artist Joan Miro which added to our previous experience. Coffee and cake available from a small outlet to satisfy and caffeine addict!
Don't expect a picture alone . People's were like monkey on the Iamsterdam thing. Otherwise the place is great. I loved my picnic on the grass looking at the museums.
popular spot. nice place with good surrounding. Photo spot at the popular sign I am Amsterdam. Though its a huge place, it can easily get very crowded.

Nice place to relax from the busy day.. We stopped first to have some Ice cream from the vendors, then took pictures with the painted "bunnies" called Miffy. Took a stroll through the green grassy area barefoot. Hard to get a picture with the I Amsterdam logo. Lots of people every where.
Love Amsterdam. One of those things you have to do. Great views all around. Close to the wonderful Vondelpark too. Thumbs up!

Fun attraction between museums. This is an invitation to get creative; pose in some unusual and death defying way atop the letters (while trying hard not to fall off). No 9-1-1 responses while we were there but some people were pushing the envelope.
great!. brilliant. if youre travelling to amsterdam, you need to visit places like this otherwise it would be a waste of time going!

The grounds around the Rijksmuseum are amazing!. All that lovely great artwork is racing around inside our heads and now we need a breather from museums. Outdoors and all around the overwhelming Rijksmuseum are gardens of such imagination, creativity, and beauty. A trip here is incomplete if this stop is not included. Miro art sculptures grace the grounds, manicured gardens show off colorful plantings, benches are interspersed for some quiet reflection, and the interactive water feature in the center of the park dares all to try to stay dry within its curtain of water. All this inside the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam!No cost. Such a treasure.

Tourist season. People EVERYWHERE. Naturally. That's what we got for being there in July, but we didn't complain. We had a few drinks at a nearby bar, got our pictures, and moved on. :) Worth a visit mainly to "have it crossed off the list."
Great photo op . This square is a brilliant place to get a photo on your visit to Amsterdam. Though make sure you get down early if you want to get it to yourself as it gets very very busy later on
Good on a summer day. This is a quite big square, which could be very crowded on a warm summer day. The only really cool piece of art is the Kaws sculpture in the pond.

Culture everywhere you look. The widely famous "I amsterdam" sign is here and it's fun for a quick picture, but with so many wonderful museums all around it, it'll be the thing you'll be paying least attention to. The place also had some interesting fairs with beautiful handicraft and an ice-skating rink in the winter. You just cannot miss it!

lovely park. A fun place to visit and relax. Stroll through the park and see the local activities such as games and stalls and shops. Interesting scultures abound. And of course visit the museums all around.
Eh.... I rated it as average, just because there are SO MANY people...it's hard to get a picture in the I amsterdam sign.
Nice place. Especially nice in early summer when everyone is enjoying the sun + it is surrounded with great museums and has big "I Amsterdam" letters for great pictures :)

such a grand place. its so hard to put into words the amazing building in this area are just that amazing this whole area has wonderful museums very easy to get to via the tram network it is sooo easy to get around here however on the way back to the hotel the whole tram network stopped due to the large amount of rain and water even so it was fun
Excellent. Excellent places to visit, great photo opportunities. We had all the Miffy statues lined up when we visited and these were great to see.
Sun-soaking chillpoint. One of my favourite spots in Amsterdam. It is so huge that all the tourist can't bother you while you chill in the grass. Perfect for springish sunsoaking and taking a break.
Giant IAMSTERDAM!. After or on your way to visit the Rijksmuseum, stop by here for the daytimes market and take picture with the gigantic IAMSTERDAM letters!

MIffy Madness. Love the MIffies all lined up - food on the Museumplein good. Not far from our hotel and a supermarket to boot. We spent a relaxiong afternoon just soaking up the sun and watching lads playing football and Frisbee.

The focal point for any visitor to Amsterdam. It may be far away from Centraal Station, but you could easily spend your entire visit in Amsterdam here without even going to the city center. There's a ton of different restaurants and shops (and museums, obviously) and there's also a supermarket. It's also within walking distance to Vondelpark and a ton of different attractions. Make sure you get your picture taken by the I Amsterdam sign!
Good for photos and food. Great for photos and street food. Expect to pay around 4 euros per person for a hotdog or equivalent. There are seating areas and street performers.
IAmsterdam to Instagram. Large patch of greenery with wonderfull Mikky fountain and various cultural bits and pieces all around...pop round to take pictures next to oversized I Amsterdam letters..)
Crowded and popular. The Museumplein is a square next to the most popular museums in the city. Here is also the very popular I Amsterdam text.
I amsterdam. Good Place to be. This "I amsterdam" logo is there and you can have a good time trying to reach to its top or get a lot of nice photos around it. Nice to be there.

Space to chill between museums. Fantastic public space, the I Amsterdam is looking a little weather worn but given the number of folk climbing on it quite understandable. Shady seating at the food kiosks and a lovely connect between the museums.

Best picture opportunities . This is by far the most fun the I am amsterdam sign is climbed on and its just a lot of fun I took over 20 different pictures of it. This is a must in Amsterdam, I was told they move the sign too so catch it and photo it.

Nice spot. Nothing special, but the fact is that everyone that comes to Amsterdam, visits this place!
Take your usual picture near Amsterdam sign, chill out and tan in the grass and have a great picnic there!
The main museums in Amsterdam are located there ;)
Great Photo Opp. Between Reijks museum and Van Gogh Museum is this Museumplein. Excellent area for photos. Saw sculptures that were fun for all. An image of Van Gogh made by mums was also there.

Must Go!. Many museums are here and there are statues and a pond. It is very peaceful to walk around here. In addition to the museums, you can shop in the many stalls and just look at the sculptures, or have a coffee or ice cream and look at the people walking around.

Iconic monument of Amsterdam. Iconic monument in the back of Rijksmuseum where people get on top of the letters and take pictures. It is always crowded with lots of people moving in between letters but it's all fun and you've got to go see it - cause it's Amsterdam!
A place to relax and enjoy. Nice open place in contrast to the solemnity of the Rijs museum. Good for lunch after your visit to the museum
even for the museum-haters. amazing selection of art and good architecture. cannot imagine amsterdam visit vithout getting into one of these

You can't visit Amsterdam and not come here.. 'plein' means 'square' and that is exactly what this area is; a centre for Amsterdam's main museums, particularly the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. But it is also a very attractive part of the city, with a delightful canal area on one side. Several trams run to this location.There are several very nice shops on one side of the square.If you get bored of the museum queues, it is a great place to just wander around and enjoy the architecture and also 'watching the world go by'. Also note that the gardens of the Rijksmuseum are free to enter.Definitely a place to visit.
I AMsterdam. You must go to the Museumplein when yu visit Amsterdam and take the famous picture at the "I AMsterdam". I enjoyed a lot the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum.

Touristy but Still Great. This is tourist central. Good luck getting a picture with the 'I am' sign without strangers in it with you. But the suburb surrounding houses some of the most gorgeous properties you will see in Amsterdam. It's a great place to walk around (especially after a big delicious meal) and with all the museums nearby (including Van Gogh) you will find multiple places to stop and explore.

Iconic Amsterdam. My daughters were looking forward to photo ops at this Dutch landmark and were not disappointed!The giant bunnies and Amsterdam logo provided many pictures and smiles. Very touristy but all were eager to photo each other.

Worth visiting, less crowds than other European museums. 1600-1700 period was very good and had the most attendees. The busiest period is about 10-2PM but this place does not feel too crowded because the space is large, with high ceilings.
