When we went back at 4PM, after a mental break, museum seemed empty but it was also closing at 5PM. We also checked out 1700-1800 period which had some interesting maps and a few good replicas of ships.
Nice public art area. Nice public space with scuptures and reflecting pools. Buy tickets in advance as the line was rather long.

Beautiful, wide open field in the heart of Amsterdam's museums. This huge, open field is great for playing soccer or hanging out with your friends, or even bringing your dog along for some fetch. Located between the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum, and right next to the "I Amsterdam" sign, it's a nice spot to lie down in the very well-kept grass and peoplewatch, or visit in between the attractions surrounding it.
High fashion. Tram stop for all of the major museums. Also , in the streets parallel to the museums are the high fashion stores of Amsterdam. It's the 'Champs Élysées ' of Amsterdam.

Great place to hang out. Great place to hang out. Brilliant photo opportunities beside the I amsterdam blocks. Can buy tickets at booths for canal trips and museums to avoid the queues. There is a Miffy display on at the moment and that was good photo fun. A visit to the public toilets at 50 cents is worth it just for the 'door' factor!
Great Place for Pictures. This is a wonderful place for pictures with the I AMSTERDAM sign with the Rijksmuseum in the back ground. It was pretty busy but still great.

Nothing that exciting. This is just a grassy area between the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. They have several food stands and some tables and chairs, so you can grab a hot dog or a waffle between museum visits. The "I amsterdam" sign is there too, if you want a photo with it.
Art park. A nice artsy going district where you could get your museum going on. The park was children friendly and it was easy to get directions.
good place to relax!. Can sit there and relax after a visit to the rijks museum. Also the famous IAMSTERDAM icon is there.

Best of Amsterdam. On a gorgeous sunny summer day, this place is ideal, clean, laid out beautifully. Be ready to walk. Wear good shoes and bring your camera. What fun to have culture, bookstores, and food available in one spot. Enjoy!!!

Nice place for pictures. Amazing place for nice pictures with I amsterdam sign and you get to see street performers on a nice summer day. Very close to Van gogh museum so can be clubbed with the museum visit.

The main area to visit. a wonderful place surrounded by many museums so u can take a lot of photos with a large area of garden surrounding it allowing kids to play around u and also there is a kids area with a slide and swing for kids to enjoy their time

Great place to have lunch. Although there are a few " I AMSTERDAM' signs in the City, this one just behind the Rijksmuseum makes for the prettiest photos. There are some food stalls, one of which makes the best hotdog I have ever tasted complete with Picadilly and Sauerkraut for 6Euro, and worth every cent!!
A nice roaming place. a Nice area to roam in , just enjoy life , sit Down for a Cold beer or just simpley look a life passing by. Here you meet all nations passing by

Very touristic, but a must go. Museumplein is a classic tourist spot. With its giant "I amsterdam" and surrounded by Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum, it is always filled with tourists. But it is touristic for a reason: it IS worth going to! You can grab a quick bite between visiting museums, and sit down on the inclined grass (I don't know how else to describe it) to enjoy the view.

Very fun square. I AMSterdam Sign is great.. This square is between the Ricksmuseum and VanGogh museum and it's really fun. They have a really nice museum shop - fun things in there - and they have the IAMSTerdam sign which is great to take photo at.

Place with the "I amsterdam" sign, place just to relax and let time fly by, but too crowded on sunny weekends. A place full of tourists always as here we have the famous "I amsterdam" sign. Here you can click the famous Amsterdam pics with the "I amsterdam" sign. But it is too crowded.Eateries are all around but might be costlier than rest of the city. Toilets are available here at a price.This is a huge area with green grounds, small water body with structures in it, etc. You can visit just to click pictures with the Amsterdam logo or to relax and watch others. It is not a place with too many activities but definitely a must for clicking pictures.
Arts on right now. Lovely place . They have some fabulous sculptures and exhibits here at the moment. Well worth a visit and it's just near my favourite exhibit the reichsmuseum
Touristy. If you are in Amsterdam it's inevitable not to go here. It's a great area to take pictures and walk but tourists are everywhere. However it's a really great place and very alive.

Genuine tourist trap. I really don't understand why people want to go and take a photo with some letters which form the word Amsterdam. Anyway, museumplein is a very nice area near the rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum. There is a large fountain and in the middle there are two cute statues . Of course I won't omit mentioning the iamsterdam giant letters .
Relaxing . A lovely peaceful place to sit and relax and people watch. You can get a photo here with the iamsterdam sign too so defiantly a must see

Very touristy but still an exceptional site. Although the location was filled with people, and many being tourists, it was still an amazing site to see and be apart of. The views around the letters are beautiful. Highly recommended getting the basic tourist photo with the letters- it's worth saying you've done it!

So touristy. I thought Museumplein would be kind of serious and pompous, but it's full of tourists and has that carnival feel. I'm not the biggest museum goer in the world (to put it mildly!), and kind of wanted the whole visit to be special, but I felt I was in a tourist trap, and we ended up not going to any of the museums.
lovely place to rest your head. Gorgeous outdoor space near the Rijk museum and Van Gogh museums. Bring a picnic and enjoy the atmosphere of livable artwork, trails and open space.

Great mix of things to do. A wonderful meeting place with a mix of street performers, kiosks and art installations just behind the Rijksmuseum. Busy, but not bustling. Easy to get to on various tram routes. Definitely worth a look and a great place for photo ops with the I amsterdam sign.

Throbbing heart of the museum area.. Museumplein is a public space at the rear of the Rijksmuseum which is teaming with tourists and local people. There are small food outlets, and a tourist shop, and a ticket shop. It's possible to get museum tickets there. Given the long lines for tickets at the Van Gogh Museum it may be a better option for those who have not pre-booked to get a ticket here. Note--you still have to go in another line at the museum for ticket holders, however this moves quickly. The park has various sculptures, water features, and the famous "I love Amsterdam" sign . The whole area is alive with people going for a walk, taking dogs for a walk; eating snacks, roller blading, and relaxing after a long walk.

Great place to gather sunny rays. Nice green place surrounded by old fashioned buildings. It's a pleasure to lay on the grass and enjoy the sun. And if you are a tourist like me, one of the best places for making photos- I Amsterdam letters
A good place to relax. After visiting the museums, lie on the grass in Museumplein and feel Amsterdam. You will feel relaxed.
Wonderful green oasis. This is a great green park in the middle of Amsterdam top 3 museums; during summer they have kiosks near the Riksmuseum where they offer all kind of local food.

Go early or go late. Place is overrun with clueless photo seeking tourists. We went in July when it stays light until 9 or 10 and we were able to get some great photo ops with less tourists. Buy a portable dinner to go from nearby Leidsplein Square and then take the short walk over. This is a fun place to watch people try and climb the letters. Most overestimate their climbing skills and get stuck half way, thus requiring a push to get up.
Nice Photo Op. Fun place to walk through. Not a destination in itself but you'll end up there if you visit the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum
Beautiful place. Amazing square with a lot of people, great view over Rijksmuseum, famous "I amsterdam" landmark, Van Gogh museum and this kind of Amsterdam feel that you jusy must fall in love with.

Nice place to visit. This is the area around the big museums in Amsterdam. there is a fountain and pond, a Big I AMsterdam sculpture that everyone in the world takes there picture on. It is a big square with lots of space to walk around, relax, and watch the world go by.

Busy, fun and full of vendors. It's busy and it's full of vendors but you have access to all of the museums. Nice place to relax, cool off and get an ice cream. Be careful not to get in the bike lane!!

Great place!. I loved visiting Museumplein as I have always wanted to go and it didn't disappoint! Lovely area with plenty of space to sit down and enjoy the surroundings. It was great to see the iconic 'I Amsterdam' sign, we managed to get some good photos. A must do if you are in Amsterdam!
Nice place. One of the famous place of Amsterdam , nice place to clock some photos with friends. full of tourist most of the time . Recommended
Green green green. A large green space. After an exploration of the art collections in the museums, you can have a good rest on the green area.
Nice place to walk around and relax. Great place to hang around and relax. It really is a central place now that is surrounded by the most important museums of Amsterdam.
Nice park adjacent to the museums. Popular for pictures, skateboarding, and relaxation. There is word art that people like to sit and stand on for pictures.

Cool place. This seems to be quite a hip place to be especially for young people. it is conveniently surrounded by some of the best museums in the city, and if that wasn't enough, there is a nice display of modern sculptures in the park, on the water and in the garden of Rijksmuseum.Add to all these the museum shop and some nice cafes and it's the perfect spot to start a trip in Amsterdam

Fabulous museums. Amsterdam has some very very fine museums. If you go to enough of them then I would advise a museum pass. The top three attractions are the Riksmuseum, Van Gogh and the Anne Frank House.

I amsterdam sign. The infamous I Amsterdam sign is located here. A nice park in the middle, with some statues on display, especially cute is Miffy with the different variations (did not know it originated from Holland, hence the popularity here).

The heart of Amsterdam - July 1st and 2nd 2015. I love this area of Amsterdam it is a great place to do as much or as little as you like. Take in the nearby Museums or when we were there it was Keti Koti festival time and there were concerts and a party feel about. We had great weather to chill in the park if you like and take a picnic and people watch. Lots happening people exercising, taking a stroll, having a coffee just a place for everyone.

Interesting with lots of kids. Cute sign and I a lot of fun for Amsterdam, but is crawling with screaming children. Did not even try to get a photo due to the craziness. A few meters or so down from this is a very large bronze of Mickey and Mini mouse and are definitely worth seeing.

Crowded , main attraction of amsterdam. The Rijksmueum and the Van Gogh museum are situated here , so every tourist will visit this place. large park for relaxing/lounging whatever. lovely area just to relax in between the museums , have a coffee , visit the museums, restaurants etc, etc

So much wonder in one place!. Great to have most of the major museums in one area. You can go from the Rijksmuseum to the Van Gogh and Stedelijk (sp) within a couple of minutes. Other museums dot the area too, not to be missed. Very well organized and clean, no one hawking their wares at you. Added benefit is that you can arrive via canal boat - how civilized!

Cool but not that interesting. It's a big nice green spot in the middle of the city, surrounded by museums so nice for a picknick in between visits. The square is the nicest when there are events going on, other than that it is just a big field to chill at, there are temporary art pieces based here sometimes.

Photo Opps Galore!. If you're into fun pictures (esp. to post on social media or recreate Real Housewives of BH poses), go! We stopped on the way to the Van Gogh museum. The Rijksmuseum in the background is gorgeous, the letters were fun, and those cute little creature statues were precious. If you're looking for depth, you may be disappointed. However, a fun place!! There are a number of food/drink vendors if you need a little rest before heading to the museums, or after.

Very Nice. Well worth a visit, even if it's just to get a photo with the I Amsterdam sign.There is a big plaza around the space and when we went there lots of tables where setup and there where a number of tents serving food which looked to be very poplar and worth a look.

a must. If you go to Amsterdam and don't pass by Museumplein then your lost. Take a picture with the I Amsterdam letters, enjoy a little rest by the water, let your kids have some fun in the playground.

Good Photo Op. You kind of have to come here to get the requisite photo with the "I amsterdam" sign but it's also a good spot for people watching. We came in the late evening and strolled through on our way to get dinner. There were still a lot of people milling around but it wasn't overly crowded and the light was really great for picture taking.
the best photo from city. It is a symbol for city, you can walk around and visit some museums or why not some diamonds shops. it depends on your budget

good Spots. Amstyerdam culture. good spot in the center, meeting point and museums are easy to get access to. You can enter in the Modern art or Van Gogh and then lie down to the grass in the square to enjoy the good vibes of Amsterdam
Take your photo here!. Fun place in Amsterdam to take a photo for the memory book. Lots of folks, good people watching. It's easy to find and in the middle of a nice park area.

Great people watching. We spent an hour in this park people watching. There is a bike rental nearby, and watching tourists try to bike was fun. The park has small stalls for eats, drinks, and ice cream. There is a place that sells oil paintings, a museum shop, and some other souvenir spots. There is a fountain in the center and during hot weather, children climb in to cool themselves off. This is a lovely park in front of the Rijksmuseum and a gathering place for museum goers.

More museums per square mile. This is a large square that looks good in the sun. It is lined by trees and surrounded by 3 wonderful museums, namely the Van Gogh, Stedelijk (municipal) and Rijks (national). It looses flare at night especially during the colder and wetter months. The large grass field becomes sparse and muddy.

Sit down and enjoy the sun. You have all seen photos from Iamsterdam, Well here it is! One of them anyway. I mainly visit museumplein when it's sunny outside. You can visit a nearby coffee shop/supermarket and buy a drink and something to eat while relaxing on the endless grass of the square.

culture hub. Great to have three big museums in one very pleasant square. Easy to get to from the centre of Amsterdam. Make use of the I Amsterdam card to get free entry into two and a discount at the Rijksmuseum
Nice event area. A nice area for event hosting with clear walking directions around the area. Could be a cleaner place.

Kitsch at its greates. A barren park with a few sculptures that some call "art". A lot of dust, "sheds" with ripoff prices and a strange sign saying "I am" and a word without meaning. People washing dogs in the water fountains. Quite a "nice experience" I can say. Please go to the museums in the area but don't expect too much from this place.

people watching. I enjoy walking around here and sitting next to the pond watching all of the different people enjoying themselves and exploring the world. It's easy to get to by public transport and is also a nice walk from central Amsterdam. With many great museums to see. A must go when in Amsterdam.

One of the most compact areas that one must visit. This area is the reason we wanted to go to Amsterdam. Within a few blocks you could see amazing Rembrandt paintings, three Vermeer paintings, a whole museum of Van Gough paintings, and a compact modern art museum with a very good Matisse special exhibit on two floors. Public transportation takes you to two different ends of the area. Make sure you buy a transportation pass so you can freely travel in the central zone, but going to the airport or the flower market requires a ticket to a farther zone that cost us an extra 5 Euros each way. Arranging entry times to museums on the internet will often save you a lot of time in lines--especially for the Van Gough Museum. Buying the museum card will likely save you money. Even the Ann Frank House is on the museum pass (it is not in the Museumplein area), but reserve a timed-entry way in advance because the line for general admission on the museum pass can be long.
Easy and fun stay. Great vibe. Good photo op place near the park with the Iamsterdam sigh. Close to museums ans restaurants. Stayed at the Marriott

Van Gogh and Rijks Museum should be the priority!. Better bring a good pair of walking shoes when you visit this part of Amsterdam. Lots of walking as you go from one museum to the other.This is also where you get to see (aside from Schipol Airport) the huge "i amsterdam" sign.

Nice place to see and to be seen. People can pacnic or chat with friends here. Or they can just do nothing and enjoy seeing people or to be seen in the museumplein. You will be surround by beautiful buildings, including Rijksmuseum, van Gogh museum, etc. I would recommend people to spend some time here on sunny days.
Interesting. This location is very easy to get to, as it is to get anywhere in Amsterdam. I loved it here and is a must see for anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Essential part of any visit to Amsterdam. This large open space is surrounded by world class museums such as the Reiksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum. Book tmuseum tickets online to avoid long snaking queues at popular times; remember to print them off and take with you for scanning unless you have an iPhone. There are a few cafe kiosks for a quick outdoor snacking the Plein, but head for the excellent museum cafes for good eating in very pleasant surroundings. Museumsplein has plenty to entertain the culture vultures, and wide open space for kids and picnics.

Good Photostop. Crowded but everyone wants a picture with the IAMSTERDAM thing in the background!If u want a crowd free shot, cone early in the morning or go elsewhere. I found a uncrowded Iamsterdam signage near the Ajax stadium.

A lovely area of the city. Museumplein has a refined, relaxing quality, and is an excellent area in which to stay - away from the throngs of tourists near Central Station. The museums in the precinct are world class and the canal houses are gracious and charming.

Crowds but cool. If you want to try to take a picture "alone" with the lettering, you need to wake up very early. This place is in the middle of the three biggest museums in Amsterdam and everybody wants to take a picture there. Is very cool but very crowd too.

Good in Sun. enjoying Amsterdam (when sun is there) is mainly over gardens, or canals, Museumplien is one of the best places to enjoy after vondelpark in Ams city, most of musuems are around, & famous Iam Asterdam is there
Fun place!. Great place to relax, see the I Amsterdam sign, lots of good statues and very pretty. Crowded, but worth it. Especially if you are already touring the museums!!

People watching and playgrounds. We've been here a couple of times. Considering it's simply a bit square between the main museums it's pretty damn cool.Lots of great photo opps what with the big ' i❤️Amsterdam' sign and the backdrop of museums.Nice green space for running off a bit of steam and a kids playground.Two mini ramps for the boarders and some great street performers.

Worth a visit and a photo. It is majestic and looks grand. With the background of the Rijks museum, it is really nice to be there. But then its difficult to fit the whole thing in a single frame and needs refurbishment

Lovely park. The Museumplein makes a nice destination for a walk if you are strolling through Amsterdam. There's obviously the museums around the park that you can enjoy, but the park itself with the I AMsterdam sign (and ice skating rink in the winter) is scenic. A great destination for some pictures and people watching.
Museum's place. It was nice to be there and visit place, take photos in front of I AMSTERDAM, I suggest to go there, wish to have time to visit Van Gogh Museum as well
Great place to hang out inbetween museums. Wonderful park to hang out and people watch. Just a stone's throw away to three of the best muesums; Rijks, Van Gogh and Stedelijk.
Great area to shop around. Great area for walking around, there are many shopping streets in the neighborhood and it is close to the Dam square.

Evereything Beuatiful. Museumplein is another obligatory place for the tourist. In Amesterdam, you must expend at list 6 days.. You will no regret. With many beautiful streets, in museumstraat you can find a little about the history of this old tolerant country.

Great photo opportunity. A must see place to take the best "I Amsterdam" photo, the backdrop of the museum is a stunning view. In the summer, there is lovely grass areas to hang out or in winter they have a n ice skating rink.
chill out place. a nice quiet place in the middle of amsterdam. perfect to unwind, rest, picnic, and just chill out. close to other interesting sites.

Over crowded. Way too many people, too much litter and dirt. I thought Amsterdam was this amazing city full of life and colour, instead it was grey, dirty and dull! And there was so many people it felt sufficating.

Very interesting. We had such high hopes. There were so many tourists. Fortunately the dutch are bilingual and very helpful. The lines are very long and the standing around takes up a lot of your time per day.
My two pence on Museumplein. Van Gogh fans would love to visit this place. There are also other museums here, and the "I amsterdam" thing is a rage among visitors to get photographed with!

I AMsterdam fun for all. Whether you can climb around the letters or not, its fun to take plenty of pictures and have some fun at I AMsterdam. everyone who visits, must find a letter or multiple ones to pose with.

Every visitor needs a photo with the letters for their album. Great place to people watch and soak in the atmosphere. Now that the Rijksmuseum is open, it is a good place to meet and get your culture fix.
A must see place!. Wonderful and iconic space in Amsterdam. Gotta take a picture with the famous " I Amsterdam" letters too...

Essence of Amsterdam. I knew I had arrived in Amsterdam when I got to museumplein. The famous I am Amsterdam sign was there, the different famous museums were on the sides of the plein - this is Amsterdam!
A must-see for any visitor to Amsterdam!

Always an Amsterdam Favorite. I have been traveling to Amsterdam regularly for more than 2 decades. I have always loved the Museumplein, for more than just the museums. It has always felt like an extension of Vondelpark, but more open. On my last trip in April, we went there specifically to see the iamsterdam sign -- I missed it last time. It is so cool! I love this logo, and while it isn't as iconic as I<3NYC, I think it is every bit as cool. I proudly wear my shirt so it is scrawled across my chest.
Lovely green space. The big lawn before the Rijksmuseum and the big AMSTERDAM installation are iconic. Spend time sunbathing on the grass like the local do and surely you will enjoy it.
Fun. Loved this area. Something for people of all ages. Vibrant but still quiet spaces. Range of places to eat and drink. So many museums close by.

A good place to relax after the Museums. At least three museums are in the area and a snack break can be had with matching people-watching. There is also an Albert Heijin supermarket so snacks can be bought from there and you can do a picnic in the area.
Good spot. A good spot to congregate, take a break from the heat and watch the tourist traffic pass by. There are a few reasonably priced eateries around the perimeter with shaded seating areas.
Hot Spot. Best break dancers I've ever seen performing in front of the I Amsterdam sign. We ran into a fabulous market one night set up along the area. Found some unique gifts for family and friends.
Excellent area. Lots to do in this area, especially during the winter months when the outdoor ice skating is available. Try the Cobra cafe.

Interesting atmosphere. Hangout places for Dutch! Small kids ( boys and girls) playing football as if they are playing FIFA (pun intended) and lots of interesting architecture. Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum, Diamond Museum, I Amstedam,etc all around this plein. Needs 1 day to explore.

Just a swuare. Nice square if you are walking from museums to downtown, but I would not spend time to walk there to see it.
It's just a square...
Lovely square to chill out. Nice open space with beautiful green area. There are loads of benches to sit, take selfies with the huge amsterdam sign, and I also loved the fountains too!

Just go here.... Museums to go to, restaurants and bars to eat and drink at, a nice convenient sign to have your picture with...
The first place we went to, and we weren't disappointed.

Beautiful open area!. I just fell in love with this whole entire city, the museums, the restaurants, the canals, the people! Perhaps was one of my best Christmas and New Year, the environment is happy, festive and relaxing. This open area has an ice skating ring in the winter and is the walking/connecting path to their main museums, including their Main MuseumThe Rijksmuseum (National Museum) ..., their version of the MOMA and the Van Gogh!! Would love to visit in the summer!

Great chilling spot. Nice and relaxing area to visit. I was lucky to go during a very hot day. The fountain, the I Amsterdam sign, the park and the area as a whole is lovely and easy. Nice to stroll through and enjoy. Only thing is that it's a very popular tourist area so it was quite crowded and it took a while to get good pictures with the large letters. Try climbing on one of the letters if you can :).
A nice place to be. The place to be in Amsterdam when you're seeking a bit of culture. Everything is here from Modern Art to Rembrandt.
The iconic I Amsterdam. Taking photo with the iconic I amsterdam sign is a must. Be there early the morning to avoid the crowd!

Inviting and interactive!. This was a very nice area around the museums! There were statues to view and take pictures, and big open area with displays with head cutouts for you to take pictures, and places to eat. We ate at Food Crib and they had homemade soup, many hamburger choices, and sandwiches, hot dogs and chili dogs, and vegetarian selections. It was convenient, priced very reasonably considering you are in a tourist area. I think the whole area was inviting and very accommodating for tourists going to the museums. The great thing was there were no hawkers selling their tourist crap. No one selling selfie extension devices. No one selling sunglasses or trinkets. No beggars. And the area is really clean. And unlike Italy, Spain, and France, there was not an abundance of smokers.
Nice place to stroll, nice and people watch. Pleasant park area with kiosks for snacking. Good for families. Right near some of the more important musuems (Van Gogh, Rijksmusuem, Stedelijk).

Great place for photos and chilling. I actually really liked this areas for the photo opportunities and not necessarily the actual museums. Would recommend visiting this area when the weather is nice so you can chill outside on the benches, see the sculptures (exhibits), and enjoy the area next to the famous I amsterdam sign.
Cool Place. Cool place to spend some time, day or night. Besides the world class museums nearby, it's a nice place to rest and people watch.

Tourist trap. This was a total tourist trap, unabashedly so, so you love it for being that way. With the I Amsterdam sign, and the fountains and the people cut outs that you stereotypically found on vintage beaches, this is just screaming to be a photo opportunity.
Use it for what it is!
Great spot. On a sunny day, great place to take in the museums and museum goers. Only visited the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum, but there is much more to see and do.

OK it's a courtyard, and a busy one.. Very much the nerve center in the museum district. Room to relax if you want, but for the most part it's a bunch or shops, food, and of course the museums themselves. Convenient for sure, but kind of a hornet's nest. Get in, do your thing, and get out.

Beautiful Outdoor Museum "Mall". Like the Mall in Washington DC, there is a photo op statue ( I amsterdam) followed by a reflecting pool. The outdoor sculptures, lawn and pool were augmented by a "Miffy" exhibit. The cute little bunny, created by a Dutch children's author, had her day. (although I think the statures will be around for longer than just a day.)Like exhibits before hers (the "Hearts of San Franscisco" come to mind) different artists take an iconic image (Miffy) and decorate her with their personal artistic style. This Museumplein is between the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum and our second favorite part of our trip to Amsterdam.

Good souvenirs, good food.. Great place to sit down in the sun and eat some great food (I got a greek wrap that I would totally recommend!) as well as great vendors around to buy souveniers from. Great atmosphere :)

Very busy. We recently walked through this area on our way to the Rijksmuseum on a grey, weekend day. It is a nice central area but if you have plans to see the well-known "I Amsterdam" sign, don't expect it to look quite like it does in all the advertising. There will be hundreds of people climbing or sitting in front of it, blocking the view. The square is close to transit, hotels and a myriad of eateries as well as a number of well-known museums and concert halls.
Great place to have a picnic right in the middle of the city. Perfect proximity to public transport, eateries, restaurants, shopping and other tourist attractions.

Happening spot. Lots going on here and lots of people. A must stop to see the iconic "I Amsterdam" sign. Some water here and a display of rabbits all uniquely painted. Nice for a visit when out and about, even if you don't step foot inside the museums,
lovely for a stroll. Lovely to stroll around in the sunshine, just a pity all of the museams are so expensive. We couldn't justify going inside any :(

Another lovely park to sit and watch the world go by. Really enjoyed our time here especially the row of Miffy Rabbits! A place to sit and watch the world go by! It helped to locate ourselves each time we went through as it is so central. Good place to meet up.
Very cultural area. The diverse range of shops, bars, museums, theatres and entertainment areas. The easy access by tram, bus and cycle plus the relaxed atmosphere and general vibe of happiness.

Really?. Its an open area that has a market once a week and some shops/cafes. Oh, and a big sign spelling IAMSTERDAM. Always jammed with tourists and crazy bikers, about as far from what you would want to go to Amsterdam to see as it gets. Only went here for the market, which mostly was items I would never buy, and due to its proximity to the Riks.

Great atmosphere and giant letters!. While there are a few spread throughout the city, Museumplein offers your best photo op of the iconic "IAMSTERDAM" letters. A wonderful place to sit and people watch or just enjoy good conversation about your trip. Similar to the giant plazas and squares found around Europe, it's nice for a picnic, bike ride or just to walk around!

Great place to pass the time people watching. Lovely open space between the museums. Well kept clean tidey and very civilised. There are a few things of interest like the war memorial to commemorate the women of wartime concentration camps.

What a wonderful area.. This really is a wonderful area. At the moment there are lots of 'Miffy' statues (a cartoon rabbit) which are really colourful and I thought they were great. Plus other statues to look at and a fountain area. The gardens around the main museum are lovely too and well worth a visit plus the museum building is an architectural sight too. Would recommend a visit to here even if you don't go in any of the museums.
just go. Museumplein.. spend some time there.. walk.. ride a bike... have some food.. relax... very nice place ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ...

A Must To Visit. What a wonderful place to spend some time - especially on a sunny day. Great place for anyone; singles, couples, groups and families. Sit and people watch or join in the activities that are going on around you.

Iamsterdam. Had to visit the sign and get a few pictures. We stopped at vendor selling student paintings of Van Gough. As close as we could get to the real thing. Beautiful print and very reasonable price.

Take a picture!. If you'll visit one of the important Amsterdam museums, you will be there anyway. Don't forget to take a picture on (or near) the LETTERS! Without this photo your trip will not be counted!
Tip: come early for it. I really mean EARLY - to prevent being one of the hundreds there.
I amsterdam. This a great place to enjoy a lunch and art vendors on the square while waiting to go to some of the greatest museums in Europe. close to Liedensplein, the busiest sqaures in the city
people, picnics and pleasure. A great place to relax, a wide open space for just relaxing and people watching, or taking a picnicbefore or after visiting a museum

Wonderful!. If the city is getting a bit much just wander into this area and enjoy a different part of Amsterdam. We enjoyed eating lunch here while people watching, seeing the outdoor art, the the famous museums and at the far end, the great concert hall. It is a good place to take a breather!

A Must Visit.. Amsterdams version of the Museum Mile in New York City. Its surrounded by the Heineken Experience, Van Gogh Museum as well as numerous sculptures and a few other museums. You can also buy discounted tickets to a lot of the museums here.

Signage Needed. Wonderful that the museums are near to each other, but difficult for tourists to navigate. Constantly being on guard for aggressive bikers is hard to get used to and they really are everywhere.

Great for if you have some extra time. With the famous 'I Amsterdam' letters and quite a few big museums being there, it is a great place to see and allows for some great and memorable pictures. That being said, I didn't feel like it was a must-see location of the city. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who isn't in a rush to see the most important sights.

nice place. It s a very nice place, where you can sit and enjoy Amsterdam, in the day. You can buy a gift from the gift shop, visit a musem or just lose some time next to the fountain, sit on the grass, nice view too\Enjoy

Lovely buildings - don't expect the sign to yourself though!. Such a lovely area to have a walk/bike ride around. The buildings are very impressive! This is where the 'Iamsterdam' sign is but don't expect a tourist picture to yourself on it. You will be lucky if you can get a letter to yourself! It was quite fun sitting near the pond and watching people pose for photos on it or stare each other down for one of the good letters you can climb on. And this was on a Thursday afternoon - no idea what it's like on a Saturday! Good place to go and see though. We didn't even go and see any museums but still worth a visit.

A must visit for tourists!. What a clever idea, a block that has several muesums, meaning you dont have to go far to see a lot (Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, and Stedelijk Museum and the concert hall Concertgebouw)! The absolute must see on Museumplein is the Rijks! The building itself looks impressive and what it holds within is fantastic! Museumplein itself is a fantastic place to sit and people watch, either in front of the water feature, at I amsterdam or at the many cafes. Generally speaking there are always different art installations in and around Museumplein that change seasonly. This is an absolute MUST for any tourist visiting Amsterdam.

this area is good. Lots to see and do in this area of Amsterdam. There was never a moment to be bored, with the museums, shops and restaurants/bars. Pompa was a great place to eat, the food was good and the staff were friendly.

A good place to chill out for the day. Three major art museums, a small lake, a huge "I Amsterdam" sign, with small eateries and shops everywhere. There's even a small garden where people chill out with their beer/coffee and soak up the spring sun. A nice place to relax for the day when not touring the major sights.

Your photo of place. Wish I knew the story of this sculpture but like the Eiffel Tower or The Great Wall, it is the place to have your photo taken to locate you as an Amsterdam traveler. It is also the place to see and meet other tourists from all over the world. You have to ask someone to take your picture as you climb onto or into the words!

Alive!. I enjoyed the square cause there are a lot of people walking around, the famous sign "I AMSTERDAM" is over there... And also I ate in a tend the best stroopwafel ever! Hot and with a plenty of caramel!

See this if you have time. This is interesting and definitely worth seeing if you have time. With the other world class museums in Amsterdam this may be something to consider if you are staying for a longer visit.

Lovely area. We visited the area to have a look at the I Amsterdam sign as well as the museums. We didn't go into any of them (not our kind of thing) but spent about an hour there looking at the buildings, sculptures and generally just taking in the area. Currently there are quite a few 'Miffy' statues there as well to look at. A good children's play area with a mass of grass to sit and relax on too. You will never get a perfect picture of the I Amsterdam sign as there are just too many people!! I'd highly recommend visiting the area even if you don't plan on going in any of the museums.

A nice plaza. Stopped briefly in Museumplein while looking around the city: Extremely busy as it was a Saturday but you could see it was a nice spot. There was an advertising board up for an openair sculpture exhibition that is currently on in the streets - Unfortunately, information on the back of the board was obscured by the posts holding the board up and another board attached to the same posts. This hid just the bit of information we wanted to see...

Great place to relax and have ice cream. Lovely atmosphere, ideal break in journey after a tiring walk in the museums, if sunny just lie down in the grass and let the clouds fly by while reminisce about the art you have just witnessed. Place is littered with snack bars and loved the ice creams.

Young hang out here-. Netherlands at its best on a sunny day ! Young of the world hangout here, meet up; all very civilised though. Sitting atop the structure, live music playing, a few hangovers… all in the stunning wide open space with the Riks museum in the background. Stunning ! Excellent foodie places outdoors and in- everything kept as clean as a new pin. Very impressive.
A gigantic place full of art.... A huge square with many attractions; pool with statues, the motto of "Iamsterdam", parks and museums such as Stadsplein Museum, Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum...

Must see!. This place is a GEM!!! So much to see, I would suggest you go more than once if you have the time. Even if art is not your thing, you will find pieces here that speak to you. They even have great Escher pieces here, take the time and go.
green space among the museums. On a nice sunny day this is a great area to hang out an watch people. Cherry trees were in bloom while we were there - beautiful.
Take the Photo. One cannot visit Amsterdam and not take a photo at this famous sign. It is a famous land mark so don't be surprised by big crowds.

Pleasing walk. The museumplein is full of people and is a generally beautiful place to walk around and, maybe, rest in the grass to get some sun. If you are looking for a shadow to sleep under you will not find it here. There is where you will find the famous I Amsterdam sign, so take your chance to take a picture with it.Overall, a pleasing walking space, but not really outsdanding.

Great park surrounded by museums. As long as you're seeing the Van Gogh and Rilksmuseum, go through this park. Lots of open space, home of the I Amsterdam sculpture, and a variety of booths selling a variety of foods -- with lots of places to sit and eat or enjoy the ambiance. In May, 2015 they had an odd exhibit of bunnies named Miffy, dressed in costume of various countries. A UNICEF exhibit??? I didn't understand, but it was interesting.

Crowded but relaxing!. Nice place to kick your shoes off and relax, after a long walk around in Amsterdam. The kids could run around and get some steam out, and even climb on the letters! Easy access by foot, tram or buss.

Nicer at night when the crowds have left. As the name implies there are museums on the doorstep here. We stayed at a hotel nearby so walked through Museumplein every day. During the day it is really busy, you have no hope of a photo of the IAmsterdam letters without a posse of tourists traipsing through it but later on when the tourists have gone this is a great place. We were there when the Miffy Parade statues were there.....lots of great photos of Miffy in the moonlight, fabulous!
Had to do it. We went for a photo op at the I AMSTERDAM sign. the park area was very nice but felt like this was a huge tourist trap and walked further into the city to avoid that feeling.

Three Museums and a park. A destination for a day or part of a day. Rijksmuseum a MUST see; Van Gogh Museum a close second; Stedelijk Museum for modern art (Excellent Matisse exhibit during our stay). Iconic IAMSTERDAM sign -- photo op!. People watch. A nice place to decompress a bit from a busy day. A variety of vendors -- food (nice to grab as snack or quick meal and eat in the park -or- visit the cafe near the Rijksmuseum), art reproductions, "things," ; Concertgebouw at the end opposite the Rijksmuseum.

Even if you're not into museums. This is a region surrounded by the most important museums in Amsterdam (Stedelijk Museum, Van Gogh Museum, Diamond Museum, Rijksmuseum, etc). However, even if you are not so interested in this kind of tourism, this is a great area for relaxing on the big grass space, there is a nice lake and the most beautiful "Iamsterdam" sign is located there, as well.

A Public Square. Museumplein is a public square which is surrounded by three major museums and the concert hall in Amsterdam, if arriving on tram # 12 as we did we had the enjoyment of walking along the path towards the Rijksmuseum and the iconic iAmsterdam monument for the necessary touristic photo.

Worth a visit. There is so much to do in museumplein, a lot of the best museums are here and the big IAMSTERDAM sign that everybody wants their picture with. Be careful who you ask to take a photo as they could be thieves but it's generally quite safe. Nice big park area to relax if the sun is shining.
I Amsterdam. The iconic "I Amsterdam" sign awaits you here. Rijks and Van Gogh are located close by. There are other museums as well and a beautiful fountain deserves some good clicks!

The must for museum lovers. This is a place where you can spend a few days......
There are various museums.... The most famous Riks museum,the modern art museum, diamond museum, etc.
Very nice place. You have access to lots of the museums and you can take pictures with the "I AMsterdam". The park also offers a place where you can relax after a full day or shopping or visiting

don't forget the park. Everyone is in a rush to get to the Van Gogh and the Rijksmuseum that this park is often overlooked. Its well maintained, has a pocket playground on the right side of the ticket counter and has several food stalls on the alley between the Van Gogh and the Rijksmuseum where it would be nice just to sit and have coffee or some desert. Here's to Amsterdam's oft overlooked plaza. Kids can play about, adults can lie down on the grass or have a picnic.

Space which could reflect more. The museum plaza is a large space between the three museums, this space could be so much more, unfortunately it offers little reflection of the museums around, with only pop kind of public art and display.
Q-Parking Garage. The proximity to the museums is underground and within a very short walking distance, it is easy in and out.
Great park. you can sit in the grass , watching people going by, play with your children, or even have a small picnic
A lot of activity. So much going on here. I enjoyed the exhibit of Miffys between Rijks and Van Gogh museums. Fountains, families, food vendors and souvenir stalls abound.

Wonderful Museums and Square. This is such a beautiful location in the middle of Amsterdam. The culture and nature of this square combine to create an oasis. The I.amsterdam sign is fantastic for a photo opportunity. Get there nice and early to avoid the crowds. At the end of the square opposite the Rijksmuseum there is a fantastic piano music store well worth visiting!

Part of a city tour with a local. Photo opportunity in a beautiful city, the big i amsterdam letters are never clear of people so don't expect to get a "clean" photo. So don't go there wanting one. The surrounding area is open and scenic, great art sellers, wander through the arches of the Rijksmuseum and I'd suggest going around twilight when we were there. As the lights come up and the shadows grow, it's gorgeous, the atmosphere, conviviality and festive helps to make you feel like loving life just that little bit more.
Gorgeous area. Loved the park. This is a very busy touristy area. The bunnies were adorable. I am Amsterdam sign very cool.

Amsterdams largest and greenest square. Amsterdams largest square is in fact more of a tree lined triangle of green containing some of the most important museums in Amsterdam,namely the Rijksmuseum,the Van Gogh Museum,and the Cocertgebouw,one of the worlds great concert halls.Museumplein also contains a children's play area,a pond that is frozen over to form an ice-rink in winter,and various other monuments.
I amsterdam. It's a nice place to see famous" I amsterdam" scupture and there is a big park where you can sit down and just enjoy the sun

Quit good to be honest.... It was oright but a bit too much rubbish on the floor as I got there, someone had spilt there curry all over my bag (It may have been mine) but still a great place to go. Every winter they open an ice rink for skaters. I really reccomend you this place as a nice day out! Happy exploring!

Must-go for any visit to Amsterdam. For the requisite photo with iamsterdam, a walk around the pond in the centre that often has temporary sculptures, and for a waffle you can enjoy while sitting on one of the park benches. There was a really cool Miffy exhibition when I went too!
Crowded.. I wished to take a more decent picture with the sign - but it was soo crowded that i couldnt at all... would like to come here another time when the crowds are missing.

Nice but crowded. Try late afternoon, when the crowds are leaving already. Been there in three occasions. One just before noon, and it was too crowded. Then mid-afternoon, just the same.Now, around 6, 7pm, in summer, you'll get some great shots without having to fight for a spot. If you're REALLY lucky, you might get the IAMSTERDAM sign just for yourself!

Love the Art work !. The Art work in these gardens is fantastic you have the great Iamsterdam sign which attracts a lot of people who climb all over it to get a good picture. There are the artwork designed bunnies which reminds me of a similar thing that was done in Liverpool. My favourite bunny was the duck. there are all sorts of artwork around the garden including a giant one in the middle of the fountain.
Check out the museums. Check out this area for some of the worlds best museums. A nice area south of the main city. You'll experience this area if going to Van Gogh or Riksmuseum.
Great area of town. We stayed 2 nights in this area after 3 nights in the center of town. It is more quiet and residential here and of course most of the museums and the concert hall are close by.

Visit early in the morning!. I kicked off my Amsterdam explorations here, and it was such a great decision! I took the first tram in the morning, so it was around 8am on a Sunday - got there before the hoards of tourists. You can actually get some clean pictures of this iconic area. Lovely morning walk.

Hey Hey, The signature sign of Amsterdam.. Just located in front of Rijksmuseum. Grab your camera and post with it.
if you have time, this is the ideal place to have some rest and enjoy the environment

Amsterdam is art. Most flights from the US arrive Amsterdam in the early morning as ours did from Washington DC (715AM). Most B&Bs including ours won't check you in until 4PM. But our lovely B&B in the Jordaan district let us drop off our bags and then suggested Museumplein to fill the day. We walked there (same district)...a long walk but so scenic along the canals lined with 16th century row houses. The Riiksmuseum, the biiggest of all in the area, is a gorgeous, gigantic. building, a work of art itself. We killed a couple hours in the pleasant coffee shop overlooking the ticket counter, watching the ticket line grow from nothing to quite long, so buy your tickets first if you arrive early. Our mistake! Rembrant"s Nightwatch is the signature piece and so impressive, but there is so much more to see. The Delftware exhibits are amazing. There are several museums in Museumplein including the popular Van Gogh Museum plus a huge lovely park. ( It helped that we had lovely weather for the long walk back as well.)
Love it!!. This is the perfect place to meet and greet people. Huge area with water features and beautiful flowers. Nice place to grab a cup of tea and just "be". Love Amsterdam!!

Good place to enjoy the sun and get rest for a while. Museumplein is a right place to sit after a tired day of sightseeing and exploring (for tourists) or just to enjoy the environment and good weather (for everyone else), especially in springs and summers. Its strategic position (just in front of Rijksmuseum, before Concertgebouw, and nearby tram/bus stop Museumplein) adds the plus point for Museumplein. Don't miss this point when visiting Amsterdam.

Great Park for sitting and enjoying the sun and the people. Pretty park, lots of open space. Great for people watching and snacks and drinksDon't miss it. I walked thru it everyday on my way from bus stop at Concertgebouw. Always fun. Kids and Dad's flying kites, Mums with prams.

I amsterdam. I love this place because it is very versatile. There are many people near the I Amsterdam sign, but then there's a lot of space just near. You can sit around the big pool of water or go relax on the lawn. And there are three museums around it! What else does a tourist need?

Great place to hang out. This square is busy but also has a relaxed feel to it. It is central to a number of museums and the concert hall and a good place to sit and eat some food or play some gentle sports. It is well located for places to buy food, there are lots of hotels nearby and it is an easy place to pick up a tram or a bus link back to the airport.
A Must!. This area is really nice. Van Gogh Museum, Rijks, The Conservatorium Hotel, a nice park. Nice to walk around.

Nice open space. A nice,green open space in Amsterdam. You can have picnic here, relax and just watch people. Very nice kiosks around to buy some snacks and drinks. We were here on Kings day. Was entertaining to watch all the people in their different outfits.All the museums are close by. The Van Gogh museum shop is also on the plein. Can buy entrance tickets for the Van Gogh museum at the shop.

A nice space, but the real interests are the museums.. It is a pretty park, but there isn't much more to it. If you go to any of the nearby museums you will probably end up walking through here, but it is not a destination by itself. It's a nice place to sit and enjoy lunch between museums. There is a supermarket at the far end from the city center side (a walk of a few minutes) if you want some takeaway to enjoy in the sun.

Nice place to take a break. This is a nice spot to sit down after you've been to one of the museums and need to rest your feet. There are lots of stalls where you can buy something to eat as well as make bookings for tours.

Good Day out. One needs to set aside a good few hours even a day if you a real art lover , plenty of Museums all very close to each other , a lovely setting , tulips in full bloom when we visited in April 2015. If you want to chill or enjoy a good walk then Vondelpark is not to far away and certainly worth a visit while in the area.

Great place to hang. As squares go, Museumplein has got it all. Of course, there are the 3 major museums, all lined up. The views are great, you can see all three buildings in all their splendour. But there is more. A French style promenade, little restaurants, picknick spaces. Plus of course, the famous I Amsterdam letters. And in the winter, there just might be a skaring rink...

Excellent Location. Art Lovers, this is where you must go when in Amsterdam. The public transportation is perfection in this magical city and this plce is at your fingertip with only a tram ride away. Fantastic place, lots of people walking around.laying on the grass taking some sun and relaxing or kids playing,running around. Conveniently located near restaurant, parks,shops and a grocery store.
Museumplein. Wonderful park in front, then the Rijksmuseum, beside the Van Gogh Museum & Stedelijk Museum. What more could you want?
Hambuger and hot dog!. After the museum we ate the lunch there and it was great! Weather was good enough! And picture I took everywhere in plein was awesome.

pleasant area of the city. If you want to distance yourself from the hubbub of the city then this is an area to visit - not far from Vondelpark and close to shops and bars. Also easy access to local museums, but check for queues - might be easier to but fast track tickets - 17 euros for van gogh museum
Fun and colorful. During our mammoth day at the Rijksmuseum, we enjoyed a picnic lunch in this vast greenery - lots of space for the kids to run around and fun to take pics by the I Amsterdam sign.

Beautiful spot in the middle of the museum district. This is a great area that is very pretty and always has something going on in it. The reflection pool with tulips in it is beautiful. We were there on a day when they had a market and enjoyed great food and people watching. There is a also the most interesting public WC I have ever seen there near the I Amsterdam sign. Well worth the 50 cent admission lol. Clear glass doors that fog over when you lock it.

Beautiful outside area in front of the Rijs museum. Picturesque location in front of the Rijs museum.The pond looks great with the tulip bowls in the middle of the water.Take a selfie in front of the big red Amsterdam sign to send to your friends to make them jealous.

Busy and interesting. It is located between the Riijksmuseum and the Van Gogh , on Sunday's they have a market, food/ drink and booths selling many different things. Nice easy viewing no pressure from vendors. In spring great setting as they have tulips set out in pots and on the water. If you go to either museum might as well spend a little time here.
Great Sunday Market. On a fine Spring Sunday this is a great place to visit. Lots of interesting craft stalls, and places to eat and drink and just laze the morning away.
Free to hang out here!. There are many grocery stores and cafes to get takeaway at this park. You can enjoy your food and people watch at the same time!

Beautiful Grassy Square, Great for Picnics and People Watching. Convenient to the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, and Stedelijk Museum, this square faces the Rijksmuseum and has expansive lawn space for sports, picnics, and strolling. Lovely place to rest your feet after hours of viewing great art!

Several museums in this area.. Near the pond there is a ticket booth. Get in this line to buy tickets to both museums (Reijks (sp?) and Van Gogh). This line will look long, but most likely it will be shorter than purchasing tickets at the museum.
Nice park for resting in the sunshine. A nice place surrounded by museums. a water "mirror" with flowers, beautiful to rest your eyes upon. Big letters to "climb on" if you want.

Lovely park surrounded by wonderful museums. I took the bus to the Museumplein, or Museum Square. It is a lovely park surrounded by Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, an the Stedelijk Museum of Modern Art. I went to the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum, then just sat in the green space to relax and people watch--there were a lot of them visiting the museums and just walking around the park area. There are flowers all around, lots of benches to sit on, and food vendors for a drink or sandwich. And you can take your photo on or beside the large I AMsterdam letters in front of the Rijksmuseum.

Center of attractions. We used tram to get around in Amsterdam and museumplein was usually the place were we changed trams - either to get into city center or to go westwards.Here you find the most famous museums, a few good restaurants and a grocery shop that is open until 22:00 seven days a week - which doesn't seem to be very common in Amsterdam.
Big open space near museums. Large green space near the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and Museum of Contemporary Art. Great for families so kids can run around--near multiple tram lines.
Relax and take in the views. great place to sit and people watch. Open expanse of wonderful space with tulips in the water feature during spring.
Cultural stroll. Great for a stroll after visiting museums. IAmsterdam sign is a must for a photo opportunity but be prepared to queue - it's the picture everyone wants!!

Surrounded by Museums and Art Galleries. Buy tickets in advance for Van Gogh and the Rijks Museums otherwise you will spend a long time in queues. There is a lot to see so give yourself plenty of time
Hard to Get a Picture. Nice park with food and seating, located near museums. We tried to get a picture of the Iamsterdam but it was just too large to capture.

Great open park . Surrounded by great museums. Bikolopolis Amsterdam, is bike friendly everywhere and m-plain is no exception. Soccer teams kick a ball around couples walking , friends climbing the summit of my. Amsterdam!(building next to stedlijks museum has grass roof to ground and folks ascend and sit and watch the m plein

lovely place for a picnic. lovely green area for a picnic or to buy lunch from the cafe,so nice just to sit and relax after walking around the city also great photo opportunity on the i amsterdam letters

People watching. Great place for people watching, and the Van Gogh Museum provides a wifi connection close to the museum shop (where you can also buy tickets for Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum. I recommend you do that or you'll stand in line for quite a while.)

Plenty to do and an amazing location!. This is the main hub for getting to all of the main museums in the area. It is beautifully laid out, the public transportation to this area is abundant, and there are so many little shops and places to see around this area. If you are looking for it all, Museumplein is where it's at.
Museumplein. Huge park surrounding all the museums. We took a little break and went to a little cafe/restaurant facing "I amsterdam" for coffee and snacks.

A Wonderful City Space. This well kept open civic space in the centre of the museum district is colourful and vibrant. On a sunny Spring day it is a great place to relax between museums. Get a coffee, or a beer, relax and prepare your brain for its next dose of culture.

A great breathing space. The museumplein is a large spacious area around which are the main museums- Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and the Modern Art Museum.A mixture of grass, hard standing and a tulip bowled lake in front of the iconic Iamsterdam sign, it has plenty of seating for gathering your breath between museums or people watching. There is a modest museum shop-an out let fir both the Rijksmuseum but mostly the Van Gogh. A range of food concessions provide a good range from up market burgers to the recommended Belgian Waffles plus seating at the Rembrandt Van Gogh kioskOn a bright day it is great place to be although the wind can bite through
meeting place for all. the large green space next to several museums probably thats why it is named museumplein i suppose. Great as a meeting point! Visit the albert hejin supermarket at the corner!

Amsterdam in the sun. Some of Museumplein (near the Rijksmuseum) is beautiful, but much of its is just flat grass, with bicycles mowing down pedestrians on every pavement. Still, it's lovely to see Amsterdam residents enjoying the infrequent sun.

Very nice Park. Yes it is the famous park where the iamsterdam large letters are placed. There you may take a foto uploaded to a social media network and add one of the most famous hash tags, #iamsterdam.
3 worldfamous museums. You find here 3 worldfamous museums: Rijks Museum, Van Gogh Museum, Stedelijk Museum.Furthermore, the Museumplein is a large open area where you can lie in the grass and relax.
Very very busy. Really busy place so not expect to get photos next to the giant letters. The area is lovely though, with water features and tulips!
Worth the view. A lovely area, packed with tourists taking photos of the I Amsterdam-letters, great place to relax and near pop up cafes, loads of benches to sit down - nice area in general

beautiful public space. great place to relax and sit outside there is a small park and the famous Iamsterdam to take photos around and beautiful buildings surrounding it, most famous is the facade Rijksmuseum

Good square, pretty flowers. Nice resting spot between museums. Nice area between the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh. Good spot to have a break and the tulips were beautiful. The displays were lovely if a little over crowded due to Easter holidays.

A place to get some air between museums. A pleasant area, packed with tourists taking photos of the I Amsterdam-letters, the water feature dotted with tulips in different colors and the exterior of the Rijksmuseum. Quite a few benches if you want yo rest your feet for a minute. Also a museum gift shop that does not require you to pay to enter the actual museums.
nice. museums are really good. We enjoyed a lot. Prefer to buy skip the line tickets otherwise takes quite a long time.

Nice square surrounded by museums and tourists. Visually, the square is beautiful. The landscape is perfect for photos and there are tons of museums to choose from when you're done taking pictures. We even caught the iamsterdam letters while we were there. BUT, since there are so many tourist attractions nearby there is hardly any space to sit or take pictures because everyone else is there trying get to do the same thing.

Great outdoors, great art inside museums. I have just returned from a visit to Amsterdam where I stayed in a hotel in the close vicinity of Museumplein. It's a very tranquil area - am assuming residential? - judging by the very few cars (and even fewer bikes) passing by. A few benches scattered here and there, a few food kiosks but the real attractions re the museums: unlike other museums I have visited, Stedelijk, Van Gogh's, and Rijksmuseum (the last being my personal favourite) are very well organized and make for an organized and well informed visit: the exhibitions are organized chronologically, and besides work from the main artist (no matter who that might be) , you get the chance to watch his contemporaries, rival, friends', mentors' work as well. These museums provide a lot of context and backdrop for you, the visitor, to better understand art. Besides, you can walk through Museumplein with a zoot in your mouth and nobody will bother you.
Lots of choices here. Pick one of 3 world class museums, a concert at the Concertgebouw,or a walk thru the park.Many many places to eat and or drink all around

Taking it all in. A lovely central meeting spot where you can enjoy taking everything in and perhaps a bit of people watching.Very close to all the museums with a variety of refreshment kiosks.Lovely.

Good for photos if quiet. Most of the museums can be accessed from here. The Iamsterdam lettering you can try and take a photo at as long as you dont mind other people being in your photo. People were sat on the letters and well there was no chance of you getting even a photo with a letter.
Another must visit in Amsterdam. Several museums are accessible from here so it is a meeting place, a lovely park, and of course the Iamsterdam lettering is good place for a photo

Good picture spot. Good spot for taking fun photos, if you don't mind other people in them of course.The letters are quite high especially if you are short, so be careful when climbing on them. All the Dutch Nationals seem to be tall so they manage it far easier !The area around would be especially nice on a summers day with a picnic.

A great place to take pictures, walk around and sit on the grass.. If in Amsterdam visit Museumplein, have something good to eat with you and sit on the grass if the sun is shining. There is also a supermarket (Albert) in it so you can buy cheap quality groceries there.

The lively Museum district. This area is the main attraction of Amsterdam with so many museums in this area, all within walking distances. But the most pictured area is with big letters " I am Amsterdam", where all visitors flock to get themselves photographed. This is right in front of the Rijks or the National museum, one of the best in Europe. Also nearby are the Van Gogh museum, the Steldelijk museum of modern art... And many more. The city trams 2 and 5 from Centraal station will take you to this stop passing through the picturesque city.A must visit place when in Amsterdam

Giant Size Fun. You don't expect a place called 'Museumplein' to be so full of energy and fun and charm unless you are in Amsterdam. I guess this is the place that features in EVERYONE's profile picture once they are back from Amsterdam :P Crowded and always bustling you would need to be very patient to get that perfect picture.There is a nice cafe here where you can sit and enjoy while having a steaming cup of coffee. As I visited in winter the rink was another beautiful sight to see. I came back later in the night as well and it was even more picture perfect with lights all around.TIP: There is a bridge over the ice skating rink and makes for the best place to take a photo of the square.
nice place to take a break. make sure you come very early if you want to take a picture without everyone else in the background.

Nice and Joyfull square. Many people trying to get the typical picture. Had a couple of b-boys putting on a show in front, was a very fun moment! You can definetly take some nice shots and hangout for a bit around this place, while deciding one of the many around museums to visit!

Impressive. It really ties the museum quarter together nicely. Have been in a number of European cities, and feel that this one is really an effective space. And this was in winter, in summer it must be delightful.

The home of the famous sign. There is no question that the 'I amsterdam' sign is the epicentre of this attraction. When we went, there were thongs of people on the sign and all around it too which made it difficult to take pictures. We even returned the following morning at 9.30 to see if it was any better and though it was, it still was not clear enough to take a decent shot of the sign. The surroundings are beautiful though.

Great square, beautiful museum and IAMSTERDAM sign. Fantastic cultural area which is home to the Rijksmuseum and the IAMSTERDAM sign. We decided to jump off here to get the mandatory photo but we could barely see the sign with so many people crawling all over.The area also has an Ice bar as well as an ice rink so you could easily spend a good few hours here if you wanted.

Culture on every corner. To have some of the worlds greatest museums situated in one manageable are is town planning at it's best. It is just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the Central area, but still within a short tram ride of such as Dam square
Get your camera ready!. Fantastic square in which you will find the much photographed 'I amsterdam' sign. Also home to three of amsterdam a top museums! Recommend spending a day here.

Nice place to hang out. A nice place with a few bars/restaurants to hang out. Wasn't too sure what the artificially frozen pond was all about but it, I am sure makes topic of conversation. It does get busy here so if your trying to get a picture with the "IAmsterdam" sign, go in the evening when it quietens down. Note, drinks/food are more expensive in this area

Just the ideal photo op. You get the famous letters plus the fantastic architecture of the Rijksmuseum and if you turn around and walk to the Modern Art museum, you get to see why its called the bathtub !

Awesome photo op. I can't believe I almost forgot to visit these famous letters! We went around early afternoon (this was at the end of February) and there were tons of people there taking photos too. So yes, we got our photo, but with a bunch of other people in it too. Try going maybe early in the morning or late at night after the bars if you want a shot with just your friends on the letters. Also it's right next to the Van Gogh museum.. they had an ice skating rink up right behind it, and some pretty expensive food stands, not worth it in my opinion.

wonderful place to stay. The location of the Museumplein is wonderful. A little out of town, away from the city centre, but that makes it even better. It's very clean, handy for the art galleries and a very safe part of Amsterdam.I've stayed twice now, in pretty much the same place and would not only consider staying in this area. It comes highly recommended!

A great place to hang out in the sunshine. Although it was chilly when we visited (in fact, they were busy drilling away at the ice on the temporary ice rink), it would be a lovely area to sit and rest after a few hours visiting the many museums in the area.
so much. Great place all the museums are near each other the only thing to remember is get there early as the lines can be really long
Awesome for pictures. beautiful location to take the famous " I Amsterdam" pictures,and to try some delicious waffles at the waffle stands nearby
Historical place. Feels you are middle of the worlds famous artist. Better to go in week days. Too long ques in some of the museum.

I-Am-sterdam. Is a must visit place in Amsterdam, but try to get early, a lot of people come to this place to take a picture with the "I Amsterdam" sign. Be very careful with climbing the letters. Cause it was winter, you can ice skating in the park, also you can visit the top museums of this city, The Van Gogh, the Rijksmuseum and the Stedelijk museum. Definitely a beautiful city landscape, you can enjoy the music, a good coffee and see all the crazy stuff all the people do in the letters!
Nice place. Just the correspondence of all the ways. You can stay all day and enjoy with the activities outside and also visit the museums around.

New Life in Old City. Fortunately for us, those locals who thought the I Am Amsterdam sign would be out of place here, were overruled by those living in this century. The sign sparks new life and a gathering point for today's young people amongst some of the world's great museums. A must stop in Amsterdam.

Amsterdam sign!. Another must visit place in Amsterdam! You have to see the amsterdam sign and climb on it and take loads of lovely photos! Last year there was only the sign there and we still had a great time visiting it! However this year there were coffee stands, an ice rink and a bar and it was magical, soft music playing as people skate around on the ice, it made my trip!

Top museums everywhere. Amsterdam is full of museums and here you can find the 3 better of them. Visit all (in different days, please) and take a picture with the famous I AMSTERDAM! You can also combine with a walk or a picnic at Vondelpark, if the weather is good.
Lovely area. Lovely café not too expensive apart from 50 cents for the toilets which you get back if you drink/dine there.
Must take a picture. You cant leave Amsterdam without taking a picture in front of the letters this is a must. I know its very hipster but it is really a must!!!

Lovely atmosphere. A great place to visit and photograph - I amsterdam. There is an ice-rink at the moment and an ace bridge to stand and watch. Such a variety of buildings to admire. Work out which museum you want to go back to and find out where the entrance is. A huge grass area which must be full of pic-nic-goers in the summer. Great play-park for children. I especially liked the atmosphere - all the tourists go there and are all really excited.

Big air in small city. Stand on the lawn in the centre of the Museumplein (museum square) and revel in the space. This is an area of green surrounded by many of the best cultural attractions in the world: the recently and magnificently renovated Rijksmuseum, the Muziekgebouw (music building) the temple of classical and modern serious music and the van Gogh museum, celebrating one of Holland's most famous sons. With embassies and diamond merchants completing the view, this really is a magical place.

Good people watching. Crowded and touristy but a great place to watch people. The sit-down restaurants are expensive and average. The junk food is more expensive and pervasive. I recommend lunch elsewhere. Good place for people watching!
Cultural heart of the city. Nice, great open air area to visit museums, concerts and great restaurants. Wonderful historical buildings and architecture around.

Allow a day for it. This is the Ams central cultural area. Two must sees are located here. The biggest Rijskmuseum, and for me the best Van Gogh museum. Apart from that there's also a diamond museum. In between nice green areas, cafes, eatires,...
Excellent fashion. Shopping is very good excellent choice of designer shops catering for all fashion trends and tastes .

A warning about parking. I really enjoyed the museumplein, but the parking was ridiculous. DO NOT go to the QPark Museumplein to park. It was ridiculously expensive and qite a surprise. 35EUR for only half a day -- a total rip off. Stay away. Park in Heinekenpark instead -- itonl;y cost 10EUR for the same amount of time.

Our Viking Cruise. A must see when you visit Amsterdam. The Rykes Museum is awesome. The Dutch Masters were truly magnificent in portraying the lives of the area and the Dutch people. We took the tram from our B & B Although it is cold this time of year it was well worth the discomfort of the weather Unfortunately we did not have as much time as we would have liked but very happy to have the experience of being there

Those queues!. I love Dam, but the fact that you have to queue and pay so much for the museums actually makes me think that London has got the better of Amsterdam here. The lines are hours long, unless you go late in the afternoon when there is less time to see the museums. Its a real shame. Its very busy on the square too; if you'd like a photo with the famous sign then you are better of doing it at the airport, they look the same. Its a must visit place though, it is a very important part of the city after all.

Too many people. Mainly built for the tourists who want to take pictures to declare that they are in Amsterdam. Not really pretty but worth a visit. Don't be disappointed if you can't get a good shot because of people trying to climb on it.

Too Touristy and crowded!. The place is very touristy and I am sure this is what it was meant to be, with all the main Museums right here. The sign is a great place to feel connected to the city, though it is, at most of the times too crowded to get the entire sign without too many people in the frame. I recommend you come here early in the morning to make the most of it and get some really nice pics clicked.
Great fun. It's unmissable attraction!!! Great point to finish your day after Rijks museum. Dare to climb on top of one of the massive letters - worth the effort!

great layout. this plain holds three great museums of the city of Amsterdam - the van gogh museum, the Rijks museum and the govt. stedelijk museum.the layout is very good. the walking tracks on the vast lawn expanses is very appropriate. the periphery view is also good. overall, the ambiance is wonderful. probably the best place to spend a few hours in Amsterdam.

IAmAmsterdam. Great place to take pic but it was very crowded during day time but calm during evening. Nice ice skating near by. A Very lively place. During day time, a street play was going on. Once must be experienced.

Well-Used Square Surrounded by Museums - Shabby. This well used square park area is a bit shop-worn. Several construction projects and big crowds don't help. It's not that well designed, but is surrounded by beautiful and engaging museums. Nothing special to see, but functions well for what it is. The "I amsterdam" sign is popular and worth a picture, but it's swarmed with people at all hours.

A great place, happy atmosphere!. Visited here to see the I AMSTADAM letters, amongst other attractions. There was a real party atmosphere which you couldn't help but be drawn into. Had to smile at everyone having fun. Took lots of photos. This is a lovely area to visit, as well as the letters there is also a mosaic I AMSTADAM bench and lampshades depicting works of art that surrounded an ice rink. All the museums surround this area so be prepared to spend hours here!
Very picturesque place.. Gorgeous place, great for a picnic or walk and you can have your picture saying with the iAmsterdam sign!

A great open space in Amsterdam Centre. You dont see so much great open squares in Amsterdam due to size constraint. Museum square in the other hand is very open and large for a square. Bordered by 3 great museums, Van Gogh, the Rijks and Modern Art.... you can stroll from one museum to the other. If not mistaken, the Diamond and the Jenever Bols Museum is also located on this wide square, same as the Amsterdam foremost classical concert hall, the Concertgebouw. I love the roof of the huge underground supermarket which is incorporated to the square itself, by letting the grass grow on it. Nice view of the surrounding. Definitely a place to let the time passby. Nice area for people watching as well indeed. Go there when in amsterdam.
