good spot for pictures. It was our 5 time we travel to Amsterdam, but first time to see this actraction..it busy with topurist all the time, but if you have a bit passion you can make a great pictures...nice place, museum around, walking area, perfect for relaxing beer.

Museumplein. If you plan a trip to Amsterdam Museumplein must be on the top of your "things to do/see" list. It is a very nice area with plenty things to do and see. Beside of the famous museums you can have fun at the ice skating area during winter time. We loved it! There are some restaurants and coffee shops.

Must see!. If you plan a trip to Amsterdam Museumplein must be on the top of your "things to do/see" list. It is a very nice area with plenty things to do and see. Beside of the famous museums you can have fun at the ice skating area during winter time. We loved it!
Great area. There is a bunch of great museums here and it is near some authentic neighbourhoods. The architecture of the museums and the concert hall made for some great views.

The Main Museum Area. This is really the heart of the museum district in Amsterdam. Here you will find the Van Gogh Museum, the wonderful Rijksmuseum and the Stedelijk Museum. You will often find long queues for the Rijksmuseum andVan Gogh - so take sometime to pop into the cafe at the Stedelijk Museum to have a drink and food and watch the world go by.

Heart of the Museum District. Such a beautiful location for walking around with the opportunity to pop in to one of the many museums in the location including the Van Gogh Museum! The "I AMSTERDAM" sign is a photo must as you can't say you've visited Amsterdam without a photo here; its a tourist must!Even in the rain its a really nice area to visit with the option of tea/coffee or shopping available too.I can't really say much more than that, its just a beautiful location to be in!
Nice walking area. This area was nice to walk around in addition to all the museums that are located here. There are some places to have coffee, sit and it's nice that everything is close together.

Must see!. This is one of the places you need to see on your trip to Amsterdam. It's a lovely location with lots of museums and cafés around. If can get quite crowded with people taking photos etc but still worth a visit!

So much to see so little time!. The short walk between these two great Museums makes it easy to visit both in a day but you will be all museum'ed out at the end. In between take your photo at the I Amsterdam installation and enjoy a coffee if the weathers good.
A Must see. Nice big field surrounded by nice architecture with a view on Amsteram's most famous museum. Nice place to sit down on a sunny day!

One of the most important public spaces in Amsterdam. Museumplein (Museum Square) is a large mainly grassy public space in Amsterdam that's visited by both locals and tourists. Surrounded by three of the most important Dutch museums (Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and the Stedelijk Museum) and the Amsterdam Concert Hall there's always activity here. In winter the ice skating rink is incredibly popular and a kitsch photo location with it's fake "Amsterdam" canal bridge. In the summer festivals are held here and it's a great place to have pick-nick and chill. AVOID buying food from the expensive kiosks near the Rijksmuseum but walk past the Van Gogh Museum towards the raised bit of grass - underneath there's a supermarket where you can get coffee as well! When it's been raining for a while (as it does in The Netherlands) it's a rather large mud pool.

Area full of things to do and see. Iceskating at Christmas, picnics in the summer, museums in rainy days, concerts in the evenings ........ There is so much to do and see in this area. A short walk from centre, Vondel Park and other tourist areas.

Not as expected . Unfortunately when we visited, they still had what's left of what 8 think was a Christmas market, so the front of the sign didn't have the usual lake with tulips like in postcards (of course I didn't expect flowers in winter, but still...). It was covered by an ice rink which ruined the special look of the square for thos3 who don't have the opportunity to visit in the summer. There was plenty of space in the square where they could've placed the ice rink without ruining the view. Disappointing

Great Area and Sights. Went mainly to see the I Amsterdam sign. The area during our trip also had an ice skating ring outside. Being the holiday, the lines for the actual museums were extremely long, so we didn't go inside. However, we did take several pictures outside and in the surrounding area. Whether you make it inside the museums or not, there is surely plenty to do outside. Worth the visit either way.

Focal area in Amsterdam. This area contains key museums in Amsterdam such as the Riksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and Modern Museum. Museumplein is actually a square ringed by museums and offering a bookstore and giftstore as well as food kiosks. It is also a green space and it is surrounded by Dutch Victorian Buildings. Museumplein is in the old part of the city and is in a central location not far from the Vondelpark and the American Hotel. It is a must to visit the Riksmuseum when in Amsterdam and if you can go only one place Museumplein should be it.

Museumplein. This is at the centre of most of the museums in Amsterdam. It is often very busy but a great place to start if you plan on going around the different museums. It also has the iconic I Amsterdam letters. Trying to get a decent picture of this however is very difficult as it is always very busy.

Lack of free public toilets is annoying. Square with lots of attractions. The lack of free public toilets is annoying, we parked underground, payed enough for the parking, so would have expected some more service there. This is general in Holland though and something they would do well to improve on to attract tourists.

starting point for museum hopping. Nice place as a starting point if you intend on visiting different museums.
On summer it's very pretty to sit outside.
General advice for (a lot of) museums in the Netherlands: If you intend on visiting five or more listed museums and/or don't feel like waiting in a cue, buy the MuseumKaart.
Fun iconic. I went during December, very cold and it was difficult to climb without freezing your hands. Always packed. If you're not confident just sit in the 'a'.

Over-crowded. We went to visit the big "I Amsterdam" sign but it was very busy. There was an ice skating rink which possibly contributed to a busier crowd than usual but difficult to get a photo of the sign without children (and oblivious adults) walking straight in front of you.

One of the greatest areas for Museums in the World. The Diamond Museum, The Van Gogh Museum, The State Museum and the Rijksmuseum are all in one area in Amsterdam: Museumplein. I didn't make it to the Van Gogh or State Museum this time due to a back injury, but The Rijksmuseum has become a favorite place to visit, with its marvelous collections of Delft, Dutch Masters and more! Put this on your list of places to visit while in the Venice of the North.

Impossible to get a photo. We happened upon this square as we were wandering around Amsterdam. I had see the IAmsterdam sign in photos before and was looking forward to getting some photos but this sign was beyond overcrowded. There were multiple people hanging on every letter. There was never a good opportunity to take a photo.

Ice skating fun. Enjoyed ice skating on the rink at Museum Plein. Our kids (6,10 and 12) did a three morning course of lessons which worked well and they even earned a certificate at the end. Skating sessions are not timed and you can keep your boots all day if you like. Nice coffee bar alongside and fun atmosphere. Very dutch experience in a touristy part of town.

I love this square. The Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh and Stedelijkmuseum, as well as the Concertbuilding all on one square, and especially now with Christmas including the ice skating ramp and the Oliebollenkraam... Where else can you see this. And as it is so big, it allows you to breath, away from the busy center...

Very festive. When we visited it was Christmas it was so pretty and festive we went ice skating it was lots of fun not too busy either the close quiet early at 10pm you can also spend as long as you like on the ice turn up in the morning and not leave till the night which is good. There is a bar which does food and drinks it was a very festive and Christmassy evening. They also gave us Knitted hat and gloves that you can use on your touch screen phone I was delighted with my visit to the skate rink it was like none I've ever seen before.
worth a visit. nice area, with good museums of international quality. You'll also find the "I amsterdam" sign, that people like to post on Facebook, there

Fun thing.. We were not visiting the Rijiksmuseum this time, but the Museumplein we wanted to see. Well, it was impossible to get a good picture. It is really overcrowded, and so special it is not. I think it is more for families with children. We were waiting at least 20 minutes for a really good picture, and even then it was not like we imagined. Wether it is worth a visit or not, it is hard to say. Probably you should visit it early in the morning, or late in the evening, otherwise it is overcrowded. However the idea behind the Museumplein is funny. It is good made.

Brilliant buzzing area!. The I Amsterdam sign was mobbed with people as you'd expect but it was still pretty cool especially with the awesome Rijksmuseum in the background. While we visited there was a Christmas market and ice rink which were great fun, a must visit spot!
Fun and whimsical. Great place for shops and photo opportunity. Classy and fun to hang around. They have an ice rink in the winter probably worth the time as it was busy during a sunday afternoon.

Great place in the mid of the city. Large opening, surrounded with the museums, with huge green spot in the middle and skating rink next to it. Pretty crowded on the weekends, with lines of small shops/sellers carts offering you small stuff
You can have a nice walk there, depending on the weather, of course
Cobra Cafe is not bad over there

Nice area. A must visit in Amsterdam beside the museum. It has a good vibe and there are lots of people around here. The Amsterdam sign is a hive of activity with everyone taking photos!! The Rijks muesum is impressive and there are plenty of places for sitting around in the park.
Great place for photos. Bustling, crowded and many photo taking opportunities here. This place is a must visit. Nearby arecafes, easteies and several museums too.

Great Pics. Nice place to be after visiting the Rijks museum. There is also the IAMSTERDAM sign where you can climb on and take some veyr good pics (if you don't you weren't in Amsterdam). Also perfect to take a walk and relax.

Design and Culture. The name speaks itself. A lot of fashion shops a long Van Baerlestraat and PC Hof straat and 4 museums, Van Gogh museum, Rijk Museum, Stedelijk museum and Diamond museum. You can also visit the house of bol. It's great to stroll around in this area for one who likes museum or fashion.The Art Nouveau at Jan Luykenstraat is worth to find. 'Small Talk' cafe is very nice for lunch, it has yummy salad.
Must do. A place u mist see in amsterdam! U pass there 4 sure coz all the bigger museums r there. Take the pic! There's also a nice place where u can ice skate in winter!
Ice Skating!. Aww ice skating was amazing, the area is so lovely, brilliant photographs! Loved that area. Also in close proximity to leidesplein.

RIJKS again and again. I came for the RIJKS museum, mainly the newly opened Philips wing and of course the Asian pavillion.I also did 2 tours on highlights and the architecture, each lasting 1 hour and costing an extra 5 euro's (worth it)

A must!. The Museumplein is a superb open space! We were only in Amsterdam for the day, but seeing the area's potential on a crisp, clear December day has inspired us to make plans to return. We visited the Van Gogh museum - a must for art lovers; watched the skaters on the open-air rink and enjoyed a hot drink and a bite to eat. However, there is so much more to see and do - we'll be back!
Worth the visit. Fortunately we had lovely weather for our visit. The view of the sign and the park was amazing. Plus there was free entertainment of street dance.

Great weekend trip. Museumplein is a good place to visit when visiting Amsterdam. With serene gardens and many museums around, visiting Museumplein takes quite a lot of time.Great dining options nearby, and a better accessibility as this is served by many trams.

Beautiful park in the heart of Amsterdam. Museumplein is a wide expanse of green grass in the midst of the city. It creates a beautiful setting for the newly renovated Rijksmuseum and is a great pleasure to pass through this beautiful park on the way to the US Consulate.
Super Neighborhood. Lots of really fun things to do. Spend a whole day in museums or lounge in the sun on the surrounding green.
Beautiful. Every street and corner in this city is remarkably beautiful but the Museumplein has a distinctive beauty and atmosphere. Definitely a must see.
All museums. This is a square of museums, that you can visit again mostly free with a I Amsterdam card, there is Van Gogh, diamond, Amsterdam, Bols museums to name a few.

A fine interlude. In between major museum visits is the Museumplein, a pleasant place to relax as you decide your next cultural foray. Love Amsterdam, there are so many worthwhile cultural icons to check out
Beautiful public recreation area. This is a great place to people watch and enjoy a beautiful day. We enjoyed watching the ice skaters at the seasonal rink.
Great place. Great place for a short or longer break between other attractions. A lot of space to sit and a nice view.

Wonderful stroll in the park. Whether you want to check out the 'I Amsterdam' sign, The Rijks, or the Van Gogh museum you must take a minute to check out this breathtaking space. My favourite part right now is the skating rink.

Always a wonderful experience. Museumplein lies in the heart of the world's one of the most dynamic city Amsterdam. This place is always busy with lot of tourist. Whether you would like to ride a bicycle through inside the Rijk's museum or you want to take a photo with Iamsterdam blocks, or you wanna just sleep in the grass with your favourite book.This is the right place for you. Amsterdam's three best museums, namely Rijk's, Van Gogh and Stadelijk museums are nearby by.
Art is in the air. Get a view of a few of the best musea in the world. A beautiful square with art and nature that makes you feel good

Different face of Amsterdam. Probably one of the most recognizable places in whole city. Great park surrounded by museums and of course famous big letters ;) Family atmosphere , and great place to relax even in foggy autumn day.

I AM AMSTERDAM. We stopped at the Museumplein on our way to Coster Diamand House and the Zoo. The park was nice and I liked the pond with all the flower pots full of colourful tulips also the Rijksmuseum wiith the words I AM AMSTERDAM in front. On our way back from the Zoo the place was so different, people were climbing all over the letters, the pond had rubbish and people inside it , what a difference from the morning, also the park was full of people & rubbish,it was a shame to see people so untidy.
Waaaaaw. Its an amazing place for viewing natural and traditional themes with the great weather of 3-4 C tempRecommended for all to visit
Best place to relax. The best place to relax or chat with friends. You can sit, even lie down on the grass!! And there usually be many activities there, so travelers or residents can get fun there.

Museumplein.. Not only is Museumplein close to the "Leidse Plein" and city center, but it also offers 3 of the greatest museums in Europe. The Rijksmuseum" displaying all the great old Dutch Masters (Rembrandt, Vermeer, Frans Hals etc.), "the Stedelijk Museum" (more a mix of old and new) and of course the "van Gogh museum". Together they provide great insight in the rich cultural history of the Netherlands.

So much close at hand. Easily accessible from the town centre and our hotel on the west outskirts of the city. So much within easy reach, the Riksmuseum. the museum of modern art, Van Gogh museum, diamond museum and if the weather is with you a short stroll to the Vondelpark. A must visit area if you are in Amsterdam for more than just the beer.
Open space in Amsterdam. Wonderful open space among museums, theater, and canals. Full of life / activity. Great place to take a break between musuem visits - especially on a sunny day.
Nice tourist attraction. Best tourist place also called as museum district, as we are young and in a group who really dont have lot interest in museum,, but recommended place.. nice

Nice open space for a picnic!. Bounded by concert hall, van gogh and rijksmuseum, its a great spot to sit and have lunch, people watch or just chill out on a sunny day. There is a big underground supermarket at the concert hall end.

I Amsterdam!!. A proof that you've been "amsterdam-ed"!! Lots and lots of people with unique and funny post around the words. Interesting landmark to have a few poses. And to have a rest from the museum visits. It is within the vicinity of Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum.
Rijk Museum. Masterpiece paintings. Historic review of Netherlands. 1600 - 1900 art work. Good service for keeping bags and umbrellas. Overall enjoyed the visit.

Great plein. A nice place to sit and have a drink once you have visited one a many surrounding museums--rijks, van gogh, diamond etc. And of course, dont forget to take a picutre in the liddle of the big red and white"I. Amsterdam.
Brilliant nightlife. A great place with plenty of restaurants and bar to suite all budgets and visitors. In the night it is without doubt the place to be and to enjoy.
perfect for evening hangout. this is the perfect place for evening hangout and specially in summer this is the best place for meeting, recommended.

Heart of famous museums in Amsterdam!. If you only had a few days to visiting Amsterdam, you should go to Museumplein. Its located between the famous museums in Amsterdam such as Rijksmuseum, Stedelijkmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, Concertgebow hall and Diamond museum. There is also an easy access to get there. Using tram is very recommended, and its about 10 minutes to/from Amsterdam Centraal station. If you getting tired from tour walking inside the museum, you could take a few minutes to relax in Museumplein park, and drink or eat some snacks that you could buy from Albert Heijn the supermarket besides the Stedelijkmuseum.

Take Five. Museumplein is the perfect spot to sit and take five. It is on the to do list of most visitors as it is centrally located among a number of museums. Also, the kids can have fun on the sculpture Iamsterdam, which is perfect for pictures. There are the usual tourist souvenir carts and shops within walking distance and cafes. The museum gift shop is worth browsing. I recommend this venue for just enjoying the city and its visitors.
I Amsterdam. Very crowded on weekends. Museum square with Van Gogh Museum at a walking distance. For the museuns, buy online tickets and avoid lines

A cool place to hang out. This is one if the best places to take a pic with the largest Amsterdam sign I've seen. Good place to people watch and have a walk round. Some cool squares close by full of bars to visit and enjoy

Far more activity here than at the Vondelpark.. Wonderful place to join the crowds of people milling about, visiting the museums, climbing on the I Amsterdam logo, taking photographs or playing in the park. There is a really good atmosphere here, great for people watching. The were a few street artists performing and loads of schoolkids playing sports on the green. There are cafes, bars and a large museum shop along with various museums, the crowning jewel being the Rijksmuseum overseeing everything. Worth visiting even if you don't want to go in the museums.
All the museums come together. It's a cool piazza of sorts with all the museums surrounding. An expensive area of town but it is very old, busy and picteresque.

A great place to hang out and people watch!. Usually just walking through from one museum to the next or checking out the snack vendors. There currently are some very interesting mosaic pieces (balls and furnitures) to view and take pictures of. And like everyone else...you have to get your picture taken in front of Iamsterdam

Must visit place in Amsterdam. They also have Iamsterdam in front of the Schiphol airport which is way less crowded but the one in Museumplein is better to visit! It has Rijksmuseum in the background and Wi-Fi all over the place. You can find phone charger for all brands too!

Decent place. But extremely crowded. What attracts people to this place is the "I Amsterdam" sign. Of course, the presence of the van Gogh museum and the Rijksmuseum makes it a good place to visit for art connosieurs. But otherwise, nothing much interesting in this place other than the "I Amsterdam" sign which is always full of people taking photos and selfies.

Great for World Cup Viewing. We were lucky enough to be here for the Netherlands/ Chile game of the 2014 World Cup. They had it set up so that multiple jumbo screens were showing the match and afterwards they had a short DJ set/ concert. As you can imagine it was wild, but, with the exception of one goof, everyone was very friendly (even though I was sporting a Chilean jersey lol). Would definitely recommend coming here for the 2018 matches if you are in Amsterdam and NL is playing.

No invalid toilet at restaurant/terrace Cobra Museumsquare Amsterdam. Good food, not over prices, but extremely long 'waiting to be served time' and toilet is situated at the end of a tiny pair of stairs and therefor unsuitable for invalid people, especially with a wheelchair.
location. excellent location of museumsplein, good connection to the center of the city, very nice streets and parks
excellent museums. there were some long queues for the museums (especially Van Gogh museum) but definitely worth waiting! especially for Reijksmusem
lively. Lots of interesting museums in this area (as the name suggests), as well as lots of people from all walks of life; a great spot for people-watching!

Wonderful Place for a Picnic. This is in the middle of the major museums in Amsterdam, the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh and Stedellik as well as the Concertgebouw, the main concert hall. There's always lots of people having a good time. There's a good supermarket close by (Albert Heijn) to grab the fixin's for a picnic.
Not that special - . The only fun thing is that this is where e-very-body makes the "I Amsterdam" photos. Just a touristy thing to thick off your list.

I Amsterdam!. We didn't go here until the last day and just realized this is the place where all those cliched "I Amsterdam" selfie pics are taken. This is just the square where the Rijksmuseum and the Concert house are located. Nothing fancy, except for the big "I Amsterdam" sign.
Free wi-fi and charging points for your phones!

Lovely to walk around, good cafes and atmosphere. We walked across the area several times, we had our photos taken on the mirror-tiled sofas, enjoyed watching men blowing huuuuuge bubbles from a loopy lasso, and loved the atmosphere in the area.mit is vibrant with street cafes along one side. We ate a delicious soup and salad lunch in a cafe near the tourist info building. It is so well situated for visiting the Reijksmuseum, the Van Gogh museum and the diamond museum.
Good for kids. If you want to keep your children busy for an hour, let them climb the "I amsterdam" installation.Also there is a normal playground.

Cobra Cafe and Museum Shop. Loved the fact that the Museum Shop will sell you books of postage stamps without having to buy their expensive ( 1Euro each) postcards. great source of tickets for all Museums too.Cobra Cafe - opposite when exiting Rijksmuseum and heading for Van Gogh/Stedelijk Museum is a gem. 2 Lattes and 2 large slices of Apple Tart and Cream for 12 Euros. Worth a visit to use the Loos ( 50 cents). The cubicles in the Ladies have clear glass doors but don't freak- they turn opaque when you lock them. Funky though!
Chill. Awesome place to hang out and relax. There was an art collection outside that we loved. Got some coffee and stroopwafels and took a nice break here.

Museum bookend backdrop for players. What's not to like?. Museum bookend backdrop for a weekend of players; Market full of cool crafts; smokin' munchies to nosh; people watching plus. What's not to like?
Nice spot for a picture. I went to Museumplein after going to the Rijksmuseum as I wanted to see the I am Amsterdam sign. We took pictures here and enjoyed the little lake that is there.

Lovely atmosphere =). The whole area of Museumplein is quite lovely. Tourists gathering around the "I amsterdam" are a bit annoying, but you can't leave Amsterdam without a photo there. We bumped into a market that takes place every two months. There were plenty of good food from amazing food trucks - pasta bar, fresh pizza from the oven as well as unique jewelry adn furniture. We had some wine sitting on the fountain and enjoyed all the buzz. If the day is sunny and nice, have a picnic there!
Lots of Museums. Don't miss the Reijksmuseum, Van Gough and Stendelijk Museums. Cafe at Van Gough is best of the three museums

COMPACT. Most of the museums are so close to each other and it is very convenient to hop from one to the other. But of course I will prefer to visit one a day so that I will not get so bore indoor for many hours.

Wait for an event. Not much in itself, but when there is an event on it's worth a visit. We last went when there was a quarterly artisan market on, with a wide variety of interesting stalls - lamps from oil cans to clothes!

One-stop culture. Three world class museums in one area. The landscape design and outside seating, shopping and eating areas are all simply wonderful. Across the street you have a concert hall, and there is shopping close by. Everyone should spend a day here and visit at least one of the museums.
Loved it. Beautiful area of gardens and trees linking the museums. It's where you will find that classic IAMSTERDAM picture. If you like museums you will like this.

good space. Both times we were here, it was sunny, which really made it a great space. Nice external art exhibits for interest. Iconic 'letters' were swarming with people climbing all over them for their photos, but all part of the fun. We particularly liked the gardens off to the side, where we ate our sandwiches.

Great area for shopping and a little culture. Head to this area for the 2 big museums but also the designer shops on PC Hoofstraat. You will spend a day doing just one museum and shopping so you may need to plan a couple of days down in this district.
Nice calm area. It's a great place to have picnic in between the museum visits or just to sit and enjoy a great relaxing afternoon. Worth an hour or so.

Museums with young atmosphere around it. Different from my expectations, Museumplein is an intense place. Beautiful place to have a nice walk, visit some museums, have a snack and take photos. It may be crowded sometimes, but nothing too annoying.

do it. A great place to people watch, walk around, or sit and relax. This would be enjoyable whether or not you choose to tour the surrounding museums. It is a nice open space of grass, plants, sculptures, surrounded by museums.

Nice for photo. We went there just photo. We didn't go to any museum. Just spend time there for an hour, taking photo and look at people try to climb up the letters to take photo. Then we walk to Albert cuypmarkt for lunch.

Lovely place to spend a lazy afternoon. I went to Museumplein without actually going to any museums.I realise that this might, on the face of it, seem like an odd choice. If you go there yourself though, you will realise this is actually a perfectly pleasant way to spend an afternoon.It is really very pretty. The surrounding buildings themselves are quite spectacular, and there are a few bits of free artwork outside you can appreciate for free (mosaic-clad spheres, and a lovely mosaic bench depicting Van Gogh and his Sunflowers painting).
Museumplein visit. A very nice place to go and walk between the museums. You have a park in front of the National museum where the "Iamsterdam" sign is located and all the people are taking pictures.
Nice area. Great to eJust walk around big market on a Sunday kids playing basketball and some street entertainment
BEAUTIFUL BUILDINGS. Well worth stopping off on the tram here, the buildings are some of the nicest in Amsterdam. Rijks museum/Van Gogh museum/Concert Hall can all be found here.

Lots To Discover. I recently visited the Museumplein and found it to be busy, and full of life. On one end is the Rijksmuseum and the" I amsterdam" feature, it is sided by the Van Gogh Museum and the far end has memorial statues to the Nazi victims of Ravensbruck Camp, and the Roma that suffered in the same period. There are also cafes, fountains and a wide variety of other statues and attractions.It is a great place for photographs, and to people watch. There is lots to explore.On the day I visited school groups were also doing sports activities out on the green spaces.Sadly some of the commemorative memorials at the far side of the green are not cared for as much as their subjects deserve, with graffiti and a little general neglect.
Great Place to take Pictures. Loved this to take pictures but be forewarned there are lots of people so getting a solo or couple shot without 100 people in it may be hard.

Amsterdam's Main Museums in one Place. This is not a building but a large plaza which includes four of the main museums in Amsterdam and the popular "I Amsterdam" sculpture. Most of the tram lines stop right there so it is easy to get to but walking from Center City is better to see the town.
Nice on Sundays. Nice square between the Rijks Museum and Van Gogh Museum. On Sundays there's a fair with many food (from many countries) and things.

The best place to stay in Amsterdam. If you are a museum and concert fan, or if you want to stay a little bit far from the crowd it is the best place to stay in the city. It is not close to the Central Station, but you will find some trams stop that goes to the Central Station or to the airport.

A bit overrated...and muddy. Parts of the museumplein were rather muddy due to recent rain. There were quite a few rowdy folks on the Iamsterdam statue, making it less pleasant for those of us of a quieter nature.

Another must for tourists. We were staying at the Best Western Apollo Museum Hotel which is literally a 4 or 5 minute walk from the Museumplein. I think that we passed through the area on several occasions both during the day and night. Its well worth the visit during both daylight and darkness as it looks so different.

A nice place to relax. We stopped in this park with the I AM sterdam sculpture and reflecting pools several times while visiting the museums. Both peaceful and vibrant, it has places to sit on artsy "sofas" or on the ledges of the reflecting pools. Great place to watch people.
Beautiful space,beautiful place!. So many good things in one area,museums,parks,gardens,cafés and a broad expanse of green in the city.
Visit the square and the nearby museums. A great area to chill out and very close to the major museums. Touristy but great chill out area and very popular
Sunny afternoon walk. Great place to people watch & have seat in the park area before going into the 3 museums that are there.

I love amsterdam!. Our hotel is walking distance to this park. Breath taking beautiful open park! 'Twas raining, 'twas sunny then again some drizzle. I couldn't complain. We want to stay longer time just to sit, relax and inhale but we are caught up to the places that we must visit. Before we head go down to paris we had to come back and enjoy this beautiful park. There's a souvenir shop on the side to buy gifts for friends and family.We will definitely come back in Amsterdam and we will come back to Museumplein again!

tourists everywhere. This is one of the super touristic centres in Amsterdam. Full of bars, coffeshops and bars. It's a nice place for a crazy night out, but beware if you are not the tourist lover. It's compete mayhem,

Beautiful plaza to take a load off. This place really does look like it's out of a painting. Absolutely stunning. We meant to just walk through but sat and enjoyed for a couple hours instead. If your trip through Amsterdam takes you near Museumplein definitely stop by!

Open space. Wide open park green with a little market to walk through. We bought our tickets to the Van Gogh museum from a booth here and didn't have to que when we got there. Great views and a not a bad place for a picnic.

A Great Space. It is wonderful to have a lovely plaza that contains not only the Rijksmuseum but the Van Gogh and the Stedelijk as well. The Cobra cafe is a great place for lunch or just a drink, especially on a lovely day when you can sit outside.

More than expected. Lots of museums closeby. It takes time to visit all of them. You should go early in the morning.
I Amsterdam.
Great open space. when the weather is beautiful, this is a super place to stroll around after visiting the museums on its edge. Have your picture taken at the famous letters :)

I Amsterdam. A must-see square where you will find the national museum and the Van Gogh museum besides the famous 'I amsterdam'.
If you wanna take a good photo you need to get there very early in the morning.
This square is a nice place to sit and relax.
Very scenic beautiful Amsterdam. Gorgeous food stalls and pretty gardens and flowers and lovely spot to sit and reflect. Take in a walk of very scenic area. Busy but not overcrowded.

A Photographic Must. Even if you don't visit the museums in this area (we didn't) it's still worth a visit as the area is vast with plenty of space to relax. The I Amsterdam is a must for a photo opportunity although expect hundreds of others doing the same thing!
nice place but crowded with tourists. I guess that's a must-do in amsterdam - to take pictures with "I amsterdam" letters. Besides that, a really nice place to chill, specially on a sunny day

A very neat area surrounded by culture!. There are three great museums within a very short walking distance around this area. Each of the museums has a different story to tell, and each one is magnificent! The Rijksmuseum has the old Dutch Masters, the Van Gogh Museum has a plethora of Van Goghs and his contemporaries, and the Stadmuseum has a lot of modern art. Depending on your leaning all three offer incredible viewings, and we adore all of them for what they provide.
A locality to investigate.. Best to use tram; walk about before the crowds descend later in the day; try the side streets with their upscale boutiques.
nice area. It's very nice area with a lot attractions. During nice weather it can be a bit crowded. Photo with IAmsterdam is a must.

Beautful area with plenty to offer. This is a fun area to spend time between Museum visits. Nearby are the Rijksmuseum (MUST see for art/history lovers) and Van Gogh museum. There are shops and cafes around to relax and many great photo ops. The "I Amsterdam" sign is a popular attraction and there often many people in this area (that's good or bad depending upon the person). I would definitely recommend a visit.

A fun photo. Located right in front of the Rijksmuseum, and around the corner from the Van Gogh museum, this is a fun photo op but expect there to be thousands of other people in your way. Try it early in the morning or in the early evening.
lively green spaces. nice area with the museums all within eye-shot, the water pool, cafes and shops, sports area. A lovely spot to just walk about. I saw lots of folks walking their dogs.
You need to take your picture here. There will always be tourists, all the time, so just be ready to tkae your picture with other people.

Worth it absolutely worth it. Once you start approaching the sign. Get a friend to take as much shots of you until you get to the sign. You haven't been to Amsterdam until you take a photo here. Worth it absolutely worth it.

I Amsterdam. A landmark of Amsterdam, take the picture in the famous phrase ... but do not be disappointed if you can not take the picture alone ... is impossible. Indulge with a wonderful park and museums around you ... so choose ... it gets easy tram.

Oranjeplein. Came here during the World Cup when it was transformed into the "Oranjeplein." Just a bunch of Dutch people watching football on a big screen, drinking Heineken and enjoying their team win. I visited a number of countries and the Dutch football fans were more chill and good natured than anywhere else. There was even a performance by the Vengaboys (I had forgotten that they existed!)

Tip for pictures.... Yes, it's great. But to get a good picture without smothering in all the other tourists, go to the end of the fountain across from it and stand on the edge of the fountain while you take the picture. Then it focuses on you and you can see the entire sign and Rijksmuseum. Around, there's a bunch of great restaurants, though I'd walk a bit more east for lower prices.
good. loved the way the night watch has been adapted in the form of sculptures.visit early to catch the place without the tourists

Museumplein a great hang out n see a museum place!. It's really wonderful to have such a wide variety if museums all in one place! So convenient and accessible by train or bus. There are places to sit and 'people watch', there is a large water fountain, the uber large letters that spell IAMSTERDAM to climb and take photos of. If you end up going to any of the world famous museums you will be in Museumplein!

Most iconic place. Hello, as soon as you get to Amsterdam you should visit this place so you can feel that you are really in Amsterdam and take your picture with IAMSTERDAM sign for memory sake! .Also, It's a good place to relax and have fun.

The Hub of Amsterdam. Seemed to be a focal point of Amsterdam, with the landmarks of the Rijsmuseum dominating the square and Van Gogh's museum to the side. Lovely landscaping of the park and the I AMSTERDAM sign attracting tourists and numerous photograhs. Stands selling souvenirs and food add to the liveliness of the place. Well connected by trams to the city centre as well as good bike provision (as with everywhere in central Amsterdam!). Lovely place to come for a day out.
Great art. Fabulous museums, cool place to visit. Renos are outstanding for both Rijks and Staedelyck.Night Watch blows you away!
Square between Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmueseum. A nice place with some interesting benches and a little pond in the centre. A great place to take a short break when sightseeing.
Convenient location - photo friendly . Very good location. Very close to all museums, very photo friendly spot. A must visit. Nearby places include rijksmuseum, concert hall etc.

Overmanaged, overcrowded. This square has changed over the years, and not always for the best. Taking a taxi from here at night has been a struggle for years, with drivers refusing to take people places they judged to be too near, getting into fights with each other, shooting and brawling with passengers.. it's a mess. During the day, you've got tourists on bikes that ride the wrong way down the tram tracks, while the locals somehow think that a crowd will just make way for them, and get made when they don't. Take a sidestreet, and give the zoo a miss...

Great place to spend a Sunday afternoon. We just happened to pass by on the way to the Van Gough museum and found a great festival of people enjoying a beautiful day in the park with bands and lots of traditional Dutch costumes and events. We just sat with a beer and enjoyed the friendly atmosphere.Not sure it would be a highlight during the week when nothing is happening.The photo opportunity next to the letters spelling Amsterdam is worthwhile anytime.
Convinience. Museumplein, from where you can go to the different museums, or watch painters paint, who try to make it big, walking distance to all kind of different places

It's a field. Not sure why this is rated so high. It's a very big grassy open public space anchored at one end by the Rijksmuseum and sided by a few others. Not even a park, it's just a manicured field. When we were there, nothing was going on, but presumably there is the occasional concert or festival to liven things up. In front of the museum is the Iamsterdam sign, chunky metal letters that people climb on for photo ops. Adjacent to the field is the Van Gogh Museum, the Stedelijk Museum and a concert hall. If you go to any of these places, you will cross or walk along Museumplein, so you will see whatever there is to see here regardless. By itself, though, this is not likely to be a top-pick destination for anybody.

Good, central spot.. This is a good place if you want to hit the highlights of the museums in Amsterdam. The Rijksmseum, Van Gogh museum, and the Stedelijk Museum are all right there, with in walking distance of each other. The Concertgebouw is there, too. Great place if you're short on time, and even if you're not. :)
Photo ops. This area has some wonderful places to take photos. All the big museums are there as well as the I Amsterdam sign and some fountains. Worth a trip!

A great open space!. I like open space - especially in built up cities. This is a great open space. At first when we were there it was full of food an drink tents with shows and entertainment ( it was a weekend family festival) it was brilliant. However, when they all left, the park that was left was a huge open space on the edge of the city but slap bang by all the big museums.

It is very had to take a picture alone. There it is the famous "I amsterdam" totem. It is very hard to take a picture with only you in it, for obvious reasons. Everybody wants to do the same. There is a very pretty garden in front of it, and a 4 museums to visit. Worth the visit!
Great open space. A big grassy area to sit and watch the world go by, with the Rijksmuseum, Concertgebaouw and the Stadelijk close at hand, and a wonderfil Richard Serra to admire near the Stadelijk.
Museum Plein. Great for taking pictures. Magnificent view of the Rijks Museum.Lovely athmosphere. Lots of people bor not crowded.You can take a breather here, sit down and watch people going by.
Empty. Hmm, I can't say I got the idea of this square. Big area with nothing there. People say it is used as a place for looking football on big screen.
Relaxing beautiful. A nice lawn for picnic, surrounded by beautiful musuem and also a not-miss-a-snap IAMSTERDAM in front of Ridjk Musuem

Great place!. Great place .... All the Great Museums like the van Gogh Museum, Rijks Museum, Stedelijk Museum and the Concert Building are there. And last but not least you can make a picture in front, on, in between the Sculpture "I love Amsterdam" ....
Museumplein. A great gathering place for locals and tourists. There always seem to be a lot of activities in this area as well as the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum.

A sunny afternoon has everyone outdoors in this scenic and historic district. Open park setting, many with picnics, pets playing. One can stand most anywhere in the park area and determine the next museum or shop to visit.

Can´t miss it!. We´ve planned to spend a day visiting all the museums and enjoying the place. Always full, but can´t leave Amsterdam without the famous picture at "I amsterdam".
At the Square there are some good trailler foods and restaurants; staff always kind.

Brilliant place!. Walk here from Central Station and Amsterdam will blow your mind in the best way possible. Enjoy seeing the bikes, the trams, the canals, the woman & the weird things you see along the way. The I AM STERDAM letters are here, quality photo opportunity. Loads of class museums, coming here is a must, Vondelpark is just round the corner also.

One of my favourite areas of Amsterdam!. I could honestly come here everyday to lay out a small blanket and read or picnic on the grass. People-watching is also inevitable as tonnes of interesting people are either passing through or taking smoke breaks before they hit up the next museum on their list. The only thing I'd like to try out next is to visit Museumplein during low-season where I'll be one of the few tourists still snooping around!

always something to do and see here. Most of the Musuems you want to see, restaurants and more all all situated in this one location so you can tkae pictures, visit many musuems as you want and take a picture by the I am amsterdam letters. A must visit location during your Amsterdam trip but plan it correctly as it is always filled with trourist throughout the day.

Nice pleasant & cultural walk. Museumplein or Museums Square is very close to city center and hosts famous ducth museums. Also, in the middle there is a park - nice to walk through, in winter was an ice skating place, so overall nice envirnoment

A place to visit. This place is like the symbol of Amsterdam beside the long canal. My girlfreinds were dying to take pics with I AMSTERDAM. There was nothing much to see there beside the museum but it's just cool to go :)
Popular place. One of those places in Amsterdam you have to see, quite a busy spot with the tourist but a must see if you are near

Don't miss the picnic/people watching spot. Directly in front of the modern art museum there is a grass knoll that is built up to create almost an amphitheater like seating. This is just a terrific spot to have a little picnic or just to take a break and people watch. Instead of a play or concert, your entertainment is all the people walking to and fro in front of you. These people are Amsterdam residents who happen to cross the Museumplein in the daily life and people from all over the world exploring the best museums in this world class city. Pick a seat for fun, relaxing and free entertainment!

You can't miss it. If you are visiting one of the 'big three' museums or Concertgebouw it would be hard to miss Museumplein. This is central to all of these.The 'I Amsterdam' letters were covered with people, seagulls were enjoying the duck pond and there was an interesting mosaic display/ competition. People were just enjoying the space.
Relaxing. An interesting place to hang out. The children can climb the Iamsterdam sign and play on the grass, walk in the fountain and play in park while parents have refreshments in nearby eatery.

Popular spot. Found in between some of the main museums in Amsterdam and home of the popular I amsterdam sign. The best time to go is after 7pm (19:00), the crowds are gone and you are able to get a picture of the sign without a bunch of people all over it.

Cross roads of people with diverse artistic interests. With many different museums and the concertgebouw all scattered around this square, this is a busy place with long line ups for tickets and even to get into the overall gift-shop close to the large 'I love Amsterdam' sign. The garden restaurant on a dry day is a nice heaven for a quiet break between the chaos.
If you love art and antiquities then go!. Lovely area with huge amounts to see and do. Lots going on, nice gardens to sit in and cafés to eat at.

All Art Forms at your Finger Tips. This is a lovely green area which connects all the major museums. When I was there 30/08 - 03/09/14 there was a festival on and the area was filled with performance artistes, pop up shops, bars etc. I spent a lovely evening at a Sound of Music Sing Along whilst trying out the Frites & mayo washed down with some of the local beers. This is where you will also find the IAMSTERDAM sign which is a great photo op
stunning place. it is a mix of history and modernity and there is no doubt the Ducht have the ability to exploit their culture and masterpieces
Good place to relax. Home place to the I AMsterdam sign and many museums, but a nice pond to lots of green places to just hang out with your friends and relax and take picnics!
cultural centre. Surrounded by some great museums there was enormous and varied activity enjoyed by many people by day and night.
Great view of all the museums. Everyone should visit the Museumplein,, 3 of Amsterdam’s most popular museums are located together. You can see all of them from the Museumplein sitting on the grass.

You NEED a picture with the I AM AMSTERDAM sign!. Lot's of great museums and restaurants to visit here but the main attraction seems to be the I AM AMSTERDAM sign. The sign tends to get crowded but be patient and you will leave with an awesome picture!

Nothing plain about the Plein. If you have enough energy left after a visit to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh then you have to go round the back and take in the sights, and sounds, of Museumsplein. It was fantastic. They have different events and activities going on all over the place, with marquees and mayhem everywhere. Decent amount of cafes and eateries to chose from too, because you will need to keep up your stamina. Just find a place to sit and watch the circus going on all around you, then stroll along and discover the happenings and the hip people organising them.
Great area for people watching and seeing museums. We enjoyed this area as a place around the museums. Everyone seemed to enjoy taking a picture with the IAMSTERDAM sign. We did too.
Photo Op with the famous sign. This place is worth visiting just to take a photo with the famous "I Amsterdam" sign. It's a great keepsake. After you can take a long and beautiful stroll in the area.
Good for a Visit. With it's location near Van Gogh, Rikksmuseum, Modern art musuem it's worth a walk through. Every kid had to climb the Amsterdam sign.

good people watching. Walked through this very lively area every day - it was on our way from our hotel to city center. It lies between the Concert Hall, Van Gogh Museum and Rikksmuseum and there is always something happening there - from people watching to outdoor concerts.

Relax, enjoy the view, the park, take a break on the grass and just breath in Amsterdam. This place is the one that will make you want to move to Amsterdam. The mix of people is incredible, you have tourists of course, teenagers, the corporate folks having lunch in the grass, the entertainers playing their role near the I AMstardam sign, the entire atmosphere inspires you to let everything go and relax, sit near the fountain or in the park, watch kids play ball, tourists take pictures, some ducks begging for food and so on. This place is a story itself

An Exciting Area. Besides the museums, it was exciting to sit in the square and people watch. Also the I Amsterdam letters were close, so it was busy. There was also an orchestra playing that was lovely to hear. On the far sides, there are open fields to have a picnic at.
Phone. You can charge your battery's phone near the big letters/ fountain. ..Very crowed, best at the end of the day..

A great place to relax between museum visits. With the concert hall, Rijks museum, Stadejilk and Van Gogh museums in or around it's edge and the I Amsterdam sign, water feature and expanse of lush green grass within it, the Museumplein is a great place to relax between museum visits. It has lot's of nice bars and restaurants on it's fringes and the high end shops such as D&G, Rolex, Jimmy Choo, Ralph Lauren and the like only a block away for shoppers. It also has a supermarket under it, if you should want to purchase the ingredients for a picnic on it's grass.

Great vista & atmosphere. It was very busy the first time I visited but there are so many different architectural styles it is a must see. If you can grab a quiet moment to get your "I Amsterdam" pic, you're lucky but it's a great experience
Cool to take a walk. Just go there in the end of your day, take a cool walk, and the standard Amsterdam picture with the letters
Museumplein. Nice area to relax and chill after a long day walking around Amsterdam. Very busy place, with bars and restaurants around.
good meeting place. A nice place to meet friends - on the plein if the weather is nice or in the Concertgebauw cafe if not. Newly renovated, clean and friendly.
Beautiful.. Great place to chill out after the excesses of Amsterdam. Quiet, peaceful, clean, safe, lots to do at sedate pace.

Museumplein. A pleasant destination [not too crowded] retaining much of the original setting with a very good walk from the south along the canals to reach it. Some good bars, restaurants and cafes in the area.

What a large Plein!. It's a huge space, a great way to move away from the queues outside the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum. You can also buy tickets at the booth here for both museums, and save on your queue time at both.
On a hot day hang out by the sprinklers fountain. The fountain sprays at random - you can try to stay dry or you can just give in to the heat and t he joy of life and get soaking wet.

A nice part of town to chill. It's about a 10 minute walk from Leidseplein. A nice open space surrounded the fabulous museums. A good place to walk and take some snaps even if you aren't going to the museums. Better later in the evening when it's less crowded. No place to buy food in the gardens itself but enough place to sit so get some food and have a picnic or a siesta in the afternoon.

Lively outdoor park area. The Museumplein is easily accessible by tram. We stayed in this area, so it was a 5 minute walk. It is also close to Vondelpark. The museum park is family friendly with plenty of action and live music. A great outdoor space when you need a break from great art!

Picnic spot!. Museumplein is scenic and a nice spot to take a break. I'd recommend going to a nearby grocery store (there is an Albert Heijn on Museumplein), grabbing a bunch of supplies (deli meats, cheeses, etc. - you can't barbecue here) and having a picnic on the grass! It's beautiful and relaxing and - on a warm day - there will be lots of people-watching opportunities.
Good photo opportunity! . This is where the I am Amsterdam sign is located, as well as various large museums. Plenty of photo opportunities and a great place to sit/picnic on a hot day.
nice area. Public park area with cafe bars and market. Had lunch there twice and bought T souveneers at good price

Buzzing atmosphere!. One of Amsterdam's top 5 photo spots! Can get really crowded during peak months of tourists. My family and I walked up and there was a cool street entertainment show happening. Great place to meet up, chill, people watch, relax.
Relax and enjoy. Many groups of people sat on the lawn near the three museums. What a wonderful way to enjoy the summer and drink in the atmosphere of the city.

Beautiful!. Very popular square, lots of interesting human activity happening all over (even though very touristic). It's a beautiful place to stroll around, sit on the grass, take photos with the sign, eat some wonderful waffles or even better hot dogs, and buy some souvenirs. It's close to a lot of things, so there's no reason not to stop by.

Great meeting point, no shortage of options for large groups. The museum quarter has a perfect layout for any large groups that contemplate breaking up depending on varying interests or for anyone looking to swing by multiple museums in a short a time span as possible. The large central court yard with various art stands and cafes allows for easy loitering while awaiting family or friends. The grounds are really well maintained and the museums are generally engaging with various architectural facades. Restaurants and bars in the area are a bit steep if you're looking to grab a bite or pint. But can easily be combo'ed in between museum trips to make sure everyone stays within a central location.

Nice area!. Great place for chilling out, people watching, and photography! I especially enjoyed seeing the kids and dogs in the fountain area, and of course, everyone has to take a picture (or more) at the I Amsterdam sign. All the museums in this area are wonderful and worth visiting! This area is easily accessible by tram.

An excellent place for chilling out, kids will love it. Not only can you visit a few of the famous musuems , the house of bols experience is nearby (great for adults free cocktail chosen by you & 2 shots too) .so is one of the diamond places that do free tours and a diamond museum too. I didn't realise until we left I had discount entry! it's also great for kids as there play areas, green park area, some water and also play fountains just outside therijks museum with seats & coffee stall for parents (its not cheap for coffee (vsmall but home made lemonade like pimms with fruit etc 2 euro 50 well worth it). im bringing my kids here as soon as I can :)
Great area. Get the Amsterdam pass and you can get into plenty of the museums included in the pass, the diamond museum and the bols experience were great

Vibrant area a hum for museum fans. A lively open space ideal for people watching and enjoying the sunshine with many photo opportunities an next to the museums and easy walking distance to canal boat trips and restaurants.

Museum square. Almost all the museums are located at this square and this has to be also one of the most photographed places in Amsterdam. The I Amsterdam sign is what attracts every camera to the place along with the beautiful parks and food stalls around. It’s a beautiful location and many people can be seen enjoying it as a great picnic spot.
Wonderful place. This is a great place to people watch, eat, shop, or rest between museum visiting. It also is the home of the original I amsterdam sign which is a photo must.

Nice park to take a break in. A fun place to take pictures and let the kids climb on the big I Amsterdam sign, then blow off the rest of their steam on the swings and jungle gym type things that are big enough for the teens to climb and swing on and enjoy too. There are smaller ones for smaller children too. Great lawn to have a picnic from the grocery store at the far end and just have a rest.

The museums are great, the square is to be seen once. Museumplein is a place full of youngsters and tourists in Amsterdam. Local youngsters love to hang out there during the day and specially at night, more yet during events like the Koningsdag (The King's Day/ previously, the Queen's day).Tourists come there mainly for two reasons: 1) it has one of the the symbols "I Amsterdam" spread in some points of the city. This one is the easier to visit from Amsterdam centrum; 2) Like the name says, it is the area which concentrate 3 major museums: Rijksmuseum(the most valued Dutch museum), Van Gogh Museum (the best and most complete museum from the famous Dutch artist) and Stedelijk Museum (The main modern art Dutch museum). Those museums are of cours worth a visit. As for the square, it's a place to see once. Nice grass, with the view of the Rijksmuseum in the background. A couple of pictures in the "I Amsterdam" and it's done.

Very relaxing. Similar to Vondelpark, but smaller. Lots of lovely restaurants and stalls surrounding the park and a great supermarket too and of course surrounded by museums and lots of culture. Beautiful place to hang out.

Great area to stay in.. Museumplein is a fantastic area to stay in during your trip to Amsterdam. Its got all the main museums nearby, as well as shops and cafes around and the beautiful Vondelpark. Also, it's only a 30-40 minute walk into the centre, crossing over the lovely canals and passing quaint shops and cafes. Tram and bus stops are also all around.I would recommend Vondelpark and you must visit the Rijksmuseum for the 'I amsterdam' sign outside!

Lovely open space. Stopped by this plaza en route from the Van Gogh Museum to the Rijksmuseum. Great to see so many people enjoying the amenities. Recommend a drink or bite to eat in Cobra, overlooking the water feature. There was some great breakdancing and body popping from a group of guys going on the day we visited.
Nice area...but full of tourists.. It's nice to get an ice cream, sit by a fountain, or just people watch. But it's crowded with tourists heading into the museums. Fun, but not particularly relaxing.

Lots to do. The Museumplein is a great place to spend a day. Whether it's relaxing on the carefully manicured lawns or wandering enraptured through the Rijksmuseum that dominates the scene, you can spend at least a good part of your day in Amsterdam dedicating yourself to a few of Holland's best museums.

THE place for art lovers in Amsterdam. In addition to the three superb museums, the grounds are fun to stroll in and there is a play area for children. Lots of locals enjoying the sun, playing casual football, biking, etc.

The famous I AMSTERDAM. I was so happy when I spotted this sign! This is a very busy area but its funny watching all the people climbing on the sign trying to get a good picture. There are also food stalls around and of course its 1 min away from the Rijks Museum and Van Gough. SO its a great spot to relax in between museum visits.
great open space. A great open space. hub of museums, street performers, out-door music, people watching, small shops and food vendors. A pleasant distraction between visiting the historical museums
Worth it. Nice square: it is between the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum; a green area spreads across the two, and the typical "Amsterdam" signboard for tourists' pictures is there.

Crowded :<. It was so crowded when we got there. There were street dancers that was in front of the sign. It was very annoying. Getting a good picture by the sign is impossible. You just have to work on what you have. Overall experience in Amsterdam is great though.

Great town!. Yes it is SUPER crowded, and you have to watch for bikes from the toddlers who can't hardly walk to the senior citizen everyone rides. Everyone is helpful. All the museums are within walking distance. Will return.

Always crowded. It's a big square surrounded by museums, Stedelijk museum, Rijk museum and Van Gogh museum. There is always activities on it, like concerts, something with soccer or people hanging around. It's a place to be for every tourist because of the big letter "I amsterdam". Everyone wants to have a picture with it. If you want to have picture with this letter alone, make sure that you come early in the morning or.... look at the internet where the other "I amsterdam" letter will be placed at the moment. Go there and you can take picture as many as you want without other people next to you.

All the famous museums in one place. We stayed in this district and really glad we did, because we were able to visit two out of three museums inn Museumplein. it is also right by the famous I am Amsterdam sign where everyone wants to climb and take pictures on top of. If you are into it, make sure you get there at 8am to get the best picture when noone else is there. There are also the best street waffles and crepes that they sell in the booths on the street. They are so delicious!
Great place to stroll .... And people watch here in this park like setting. Lots of activities happening, there are restaurants near by or just bring your own food and have a picnic.

Crowded!. Get ready to be super crowded and have 100 other people in your pictures! You have to visit the sign and the museums around it cause ur there! We went at midnight one night and it was much more calmer! Great park with a beautiful water pond. I recommend night or maybe super early morning if your a morning person

Everything in one place!. All of the great art museums of Amsterdam are right here! The Iamsterdam sign is a great place to document your trip, but be prepared for a crowd. There are a lot of street venders around which is a great place to grab a quick, cheap bite to eat in between museums.

A great spot!. A great spot to buy an ice cream, or a burger!
Definitely worth a visit! Lots of picture opportunities available here too!
Are you Amsterdam?
The centre of Art. Amsterdam is a living museum. The museumplein lives museums containing the likes of all renowned dutch painters. Just great to embrace the ambiance to be engulfed by sheer art.

Spend some more money and take a couple of snaps after a museum trip!. A nice little park, conveniently located within the museum quarter of Amsterdam, lots of street traders selling their touristy wares, lots of opportunity to have a pint of the local brew, Heineken in the many open air cafes, though not much time to meditate and enjoy the view, as there are a glut of tourists here.I had a nice time here anyway, two pints of H and a 'Starry night' poster of Van gogh!If you are visiting the museums, you can't avoid this place, but it is nice, nicer than their cities, and the Dutch are so friendly and engaging, you just can't resist!
Museumplein for World Cup. We watched with 10s of thousands of Netherland fans on the big video screens in the park. LOTS OF FUN!!

Amsterdam's primo museums--all in one place!. The grandeur of the Rijks Museum building presides over the area where the best of the museums reside. The Stedllijk and the Van Gogh Museums are nose to nose next door. One can easily visit this area for two + days. Bring an umbrella to wait in line..but worth the wait for all three!

I amsterdam sign.... Lets be honest, many people visit the museum plein without visiting even one single museum. People like to catch a letter from the sign and take a photo with it (if they are lucky, the first letter of their name). Usualy you need to stand in line for that cause people like to pose next to it in million variations. Getting back to the topic - On a sunny day it is nice to sit there and sun bath. On a snowy day, you can skate on the water like a real Dutchy. Either way, worth a visit. Later you can wait for about 2 hours to get to the Van Gogh Museum...Good luck!

The place to be!. Everything is close by, the museums, the tram station, cafes and of course Museumplein itself, filled with people regardless of the weather conditions. A central location surrounded by nice hotels, and a perfect chance to observe the locals and get a taste of their everyday lives.
one of landmark of Amsterdam. around museumplein with nice museums, concert hall, and luxury brand shopping street, it's very pretty when the weather is good..

All museums in one place. If you want to visit the most popular museums in Amsterdam visit this square. Everyone will find a place to their liking. Besides you can take a picture with the famous "Iamsterdam" sign)
looking a bit untidy. as seems to be a lot of roadworks and repairs.lots of people about and street entertainers tooa good place for a short relax between museums though

nicer than Dam square. vibrant area with lots of cafes and restaurants on a cross roads. Lovely atmosphere. Sat and had a drink in one bar and soaked in the atmosphere. Its mainly a young persons area but we loved it.

Lots of things to see and close to the luxury shopping street. This area is very well kept. The museums are close together with lots of stores where you can buy luxury items and delicious treats to eat.

Nice every time of the day. I enjoyed this park with my family and would like to offer some information I did not see in any of the other review.There is a basketball court, and a nice new skater park. There is a playground that is best suited for kids 6-12 years, and the small water fountain thing in front of the I Amsterdam sign is not really deep and lots of locals kids waded through it in the afternoon. It is really quite close to central and you should at least see it if you are in the neighborhood.

I amsterdam!!! Don’t miss this.. This square is really nice place to chill…rest between museums and even have a picnic. Of course you have to take a picture at the famous “I amsterdam” sculpture. This is a perfect place to take a break or even a nap with lots of green space. Don’t miss this.

Museum center of Amsterdam. This area is the concentrated center of Amsterdam's thriving arts district. Here there are several world famous museums (Rijk and Van Gogh) and some less famous ones like the diamond museum and the music center.

A plain with a lot of art!. The Rijkymuseum on one hand - on the other the Concertgebouw. In between van Gogh, the museum of modern art. And the plain itself is ready to sit, relax, enjoy and come down, before seeing the next wonder of museum

interesting,. interesting place to visit to see the museums or just people watch. Of course you must take your picture at the IAMSTERDAM sculpture in front of the Rijksmuseum. we love the big square of green grass,

A nice square. We went looking for the televised World Cup game, but were disappointed to find out that they moved the games to a stadium outside the center of the city. The square is big with lots of grass and the gardens and play structures looked nice as well.

Stedlijk museum. This is a review of two halves: my wife who is an artist loved it. I disliked it, finding the art grubby, depressing, and not aging well. Only the Mondrian lifted the mood a little for me. Basically you have to like modern art to go here.

Soccer mania!. The Museumplein was partially closed off for free large screen viewing of the World Cup Netherlands games. We could hear the crowds cheering at our hotel 2 blocks away which was exciting. It made it difficult to cut through the square but the Museumplein is still an interesting place to visit to see the museums or just people watch. Of course you must take your picture at the IAMSTERDAM sculpture in front of the Rijksmuseum.

Enjoyable ambiance!. This esplanade is packed with tourists just enjoying the Rijksmuseum's view and the IAmsterdam sign. Have a look at the Museum store to buy some nicknack from any of the Dutch classic paintings. Enjoy the street performers that come here sporadically.

Just another square. Not much more to add - bit like Covent Garden with the street entertainers and pigeons. The buildings are quite stately and intriguing to look at but if you don't get there, don't worry

Nice square and park. Loved it. GThere is the IAmsterdam sign which is perfect for your mandatory touristy photo and then the park and plaza with small food vendors and museums surrounding it. Definitely something to walk by while here.

Oranjeplein!. I went to watch Netherlands Vs Chile in the World Cup group stage here, when the square had been turned into 'Oranjeplein' - I recommend anybody and everybody, dutch, sports fan or other to attend a match here. 3 fantastic big screens and an awesome atmosphere. Just make sure to wear orange!

Beautiful place to chill. This spot is just beautiful, you have a big park where you can sit and chill at,
It is right next to the Rijksmuseum, and the the iamsterdam sign.
I recommend coming there to chill for a couple of hours between sight seeing, having some good coffee at one of the coffee houses near, and enjoying the peacefulness of Amsterdam.
A great collection of museums. The three museums here are all great. In this open area visitors can relax and there's a great museum shop.

Great for taking photos. Musemplein is just a square between museums with famous gigantic letters IAMSTERDAM. I suggest it for visitig just to take photos and realx but it's really nothing special. THere are some food to buy like waffles with ice cream ( recommend! ), but more than haf an hour is too much.

Hosting 45.000 peoples. . . .. The centre of cultural Amsterdam, with all big musea, shopping, dining and wining. The place can host 45.000 peoples for watching football games on large screens and many other big demonstrations.

nice views, lots of museums -and phone charging station!. Spent over an hour sitting here in front of the water pool/fountain, just basking in the sun and people watching. Great view over Museumsplein right in front of the Rijiksmuseum. The I amsterdam sign is here (though very busy with lots of people taking photos -I'd recommend going to Vondelpark to take photos with the sign as there is one there too!!) and there was a dance group busking in front of it. A nice atmosphere!Also for the tech addicts... there is free wifi (from the van gogh museum) and there is a charging station you can use for free to charge your phones! Lots of different brands available. Just by the right side of the pool in front of the Rijiksmuseum (right side looking onto Museumplein, with the Rijiks behind you)
very cool park area housing top museums, cultural attractions. neat open, public space that connects several top museums and cultural institutions -- one of the reasons why Amsterdam is so cool

too many queues. Museumplein needs at least one full day in order to visit the museums. The Riks museum which recently open again is worth visiting and the Van Gong museum if you are a person of the arts. Bear in mind that you may have to wait in line a lot.

Better in good weather. It was pouring down with rain the day I visited and the building works rather disrupted the space, but it's a lively area with lots going on, always busy with visitors and locals. Bring an umbrella or raincoat!
I watch footbal. I watch the mqtch of holland there 1000 people nice atmosphere big screen great after this we go to rembrandt sqaure and party over there
Nothing Special. Not sure what the attraction is here except for the gift shop shared by the Rijksmusem and the Van Gogh Museum. Crowds, some food, a big Amsterdam "sculpture" -- didn't stay long.

Nice picnic place. Where the famous I Amsterdam sign is, there is a lovely park that overlooks the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, Stedelijkmuseum, and is also very close to the Concertgebouw. This is the perfect place for a picnic, as it has a lovely fountain, there's nice, grassy areas, and it's just like a regular park, so people bring there dogs there for walks. There is also a supermarket nearby, where I bought food and had a picnic on the bench while watching street performers. A great place to take a break while visiting museums!
A fun place. This area is a happening. Loads of young people having fun. Street performers were terrific. Lots of happy folks with pleanty of spots to buy a snack.

Take the time to sit and enjoy the square!. An area between museums in the heart of the museum area of Amsterdam. Open square with street vendors, music, and people gathering and talking and having fun. People climbing the IAMsterdam sculpture. Museum bookstore right in the middle. Just a great open air space.

Lovely park. We enjoyed sitting I the park as a rest, having a picnic, and just looking at the flowers. It can be crowded. We went at 7am one day and took amazing photos without people all over the I Amsterdam sign.

Nice Grassy Expanse. If you are tired or just want to watch the world go by, Amsterdamers relax in this area just as New Yorkers will while away time in Central Park. You are surrounded by the Rijksmuseum, Concertgebouw, Van Gogh Museum, Diamond Museum....Lovely but no real attraction in and of itself. TIP: The "I AMSTERDAM" sign at the Rijksmuseum is also in the Vondelpark. It's easier to get a good photo in the Vondelpark.

I Amsterdam. Large green space in front of the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum. The comings and goings change daily as do the crowds You might see students on a field trip playing futball during their lunch break or people enjoying picnic lunches or I was lucky to be in town when the "plein" was turned into a huge viewing space for Holland's FIFA world cup game & defeat of Spain. From my experience, I can say the Dutch know how to organize an event & despite the thousands of people, there was no waiting for a bathroom!I visited one night after midnight, with my son-in-law, for a few night pics & never felt threatened or fearful for my safety. It is well lit and people were active even that early.A must stop if you want your picture in front of the I Amsterdam letters or if you just need a place to sit & relax before continuing your city exploration.

Getting Arty-Farty!. We, 4 Singapore ladies got into the arty-farty mood and visited this touristy spot on a cold, rainy day in April.The atmosphere was great and got us feeling artistic. We had a wonderful time strolling around the garden and took pic in front of the big I am Amsterdam, despite the cold rain. It brought back the nostalgic feeling as a teenager getting drenched in the rain. Shopping in the museum shop was very fruitful too. There is wide selection of souvenirs of good quality, ranging from accessories, apparels, stationery and cups etc. Time well spent indeed!

Nice open space to rest and relax. This is where the I Amsterdam sign stands where people can just relax and chill out in the open spaces and field behind the Rijksmuseum. Had a blast of a time as they used the location to set up big screens to show live World Cup matches involving the Dutch national team.

Incorrect map location on TripAdvisor for Museumplein. For whatever reason the Trip Advisor map incorrectly marks Museumplein in Dam Square. IT IS NOT! It is much further south west outside the old canal rings, close to the Rujksmuseum
Touristy, but a must. Everyone gets their picture taken here, but just do it! It is in the middle of a lot of great museums, so minus the crowd, get in there and get a shot of you too!

Amsterdam sign is great. you have to visit Museumplein when visiting Amsterdam, although we didnt have enough time to visit anymore museums there we of course had to take our photo with the I Amsterdam sign in Museumplein, we went there very early to avoid the big rush of tourists and it paid off as we were the only people there at 07:00 in the morning and got some great photos
Great area. This is a great area to visit. There are many sit down restaurants as well as take away booths. The playground and grassy area are great with kids.

The Huge I-am-sterdam letters. Must-visit place to take pics with the huge I-am-sterdam letters (there are 2 other places if I'm not mistaken). DO NOT go on weekends or weekdays after 11 AM if you want good pics of yourself here without the letters being swarmed by other tourists. Bring a tripod if you can to take pictures of the all the letters.

Cultural Rest Place. We wanted to visit the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Foundation, but they were filming in the walk through to the Museumplein and there was an erection going on (TV screen for Spain v Thee Netherlands or maybe a POP Group like ONE DIRECTION were going to visit on 12th June 2014).wE DID GET TO THE Van Gogh Museum thoughHope the Museum plein will return to the quiet Cultural Rest Place so that people can relax after a visit to the R or VG Muiseum.
Too crowd!. Its a must see place when u go to Amsterdam cuz is already very traditional to take photos etc. But omg, its completely crowd! If u want to go there in a "peak hour", u must go with time!

Touristy spot for touristy people. Nice plaza with cute shops and food places around, made for tourists. You will want to get your picture taken at the sign and you will just have to settle for a picture with some other stranger posing not too far from you.
