Another Fantastic Museum. How can you visit to many museums? Again very busy and well attended on the day we went. Like most museums there is a variety of exhibits held inside. Thankful for all the historians and collectors who make these features available for us as tourist to see.
It's also fun to take a photo with the HUGE sign outside.
Funny, beautiful, good pictures. It is nice, beautiful garden, a lot of people, the classic buildings amazing, good for pictures, very interesting olace

Relaxing. We were tired when we arrived here after a long day. We got some food at the stalls and sat around the fountain. There were lots of children around and playground for those who are bringing children. Large green area too. IAMSTERDAM letters are cool, although it was packed so couldn't get a great pic!

Perfect. My favourite place in Amsterdam. You can see all sorts of shops, restaurants, bars and beautiful little streets. I just love to get lost there. At night Museumplein is also very lively, you can just walk by several bars and enjoy the music and dance, if you like.

Gorgeous park between all the great museums. This is a very pretty large green space between all of the main museums. Has the iamsterdam letters which are good fun! Lots of awesome photo opportunities. Lovely.

Nice place to relax after day long exhausting museum trips. We were really tired when we arrived to Museumplein after a day long walk and we were really happy to have place to sit down and relax. Don't forget to take your picture in front of the Iamsterdam sign ;)

Attracted to the surroundings. Amazing place to hangout. Beautiful garden and a cosy spot to hangout near the fountain. Really love the small stall with their nice hot chocolate and fudgy brownie. Such a delight to be here and lots of beautiful and memorable pictures. The only downside was there is just too many people and it was hard taking personal pictures.
Good area to recharge n relax. Nice stalls selling coffee , Ice cream , souvenirs n light food for reasonable price . kids love the play ground . There is also a Hugh supermarket in the vicinity .

The place to see cooridinate your visit to the museums in Amsterdam. We have been here twice. Once in February 2007 and again in May 2014. In February, kids and parents were ice skating and in May just relaxing by the water and enjoying the day. You can see all the major museums from here and decide which one you want to see.
Fun area/street performers. Great area, beautiful buildings and awesome street performers! I really loved this entire area, good view of the museum also.

A Must not only for Museum Lovers. When we decided to stay in the Museum Plein district, our first thought was the museums themselves - as we just love the stimulation of the great creative talents across the ages. BUT THAT'S A BIG MISTAKE. We stayed on a quiet tree lined mini square off Jacob Obrechtsstraat and Vanhultstraat with a charmiing Saturday market. We realised that we were not only in the middle of the museums but a short walk to Speigelstraat, Leidsestraat/Leidseplein/ the charming Kerk Straat and as close as one really requires to the Pijp restaurant/nighlife district. Of course the beautiful Vondelpark was a skip and a jump away. We easily walked to the "NIne Streets" where we bought the most delicious chocolate at Pompadour great bakery and cheese shop as well as the very creative "frozen fountain" where we bought the most unique umbrella we have ever come across.The plein itself is a grassed space that you must visit on the weekend to experience local families and footballers letting their hair down. (By the way we have stayed on the canals themselves but our choice is still the " M" Plein.

Interesting area. Our hotel was in this area so we explored most of it on foot. The canals were looking attractive with the trees bright green new leaves framing them. There is a large open market in this area too.

A nice stroll around in the sun.. We initially went to the area to visit the Van Gogh museum, although we did not actually go in because of the long queue.(we later realised we could of purchased a ticket from the nearby tourist & tickets and gone in via the shorter queue..we used this option for Madam Tussauds).The area is nicely laid out while you go between the museums, and there are several vendors selling souvenirs or food. A short walk away you can find 'De Carrousel' pancake cafe which is worth a visit.
Beautiful. Beautiful place! If you travel to amsterdam you must spend some time and check this place just next to the museum. Plenty of colorful tulips it is a really beautiful place.
Don't miss it. Rijksmuseam, Van Gogh Museam, Contemporary Art Museum all in a beautiful park setting. What is not to like?

A fascinating open space. A fascinating open space that lies between the main museums and the Concertgebouw concert hall. There is a wonderful shop that sells waffles and an ice skating rink for those daring enough to put on some skates. Be warned; it is bitterly cold in February!

its just a simple sign. the sign is like a mascot for the city. well of course why not when it displays the name of the city in massive size. I amsterdam sign set towards the front of rijksmuseum and the van gogh museum and the surrounding area of a beautifully manicured lawn is what makes up the whole Museumplein.

Good open space with interesting things to look at. The wide open spaces give relief from the crowds. The park is kept clean and neat. The outside of the museums are interesting to look at, in addition to their collections.

OK but be prepared to share the view. Located right outside the gates to the Rijks and down the street from Van Gogh. We didn't bother with a picture because there are always a million crazy kids standing on top and you will NEVER get a picture of yourselves. Good place to get a photo of the outside of Rijks, though. We got lots of other shots to prove we were there:)
Interesting. I enjoyed my visit there. There is a wide variety of work in all mediums, some was strange but very thought provoking,

The rain didn't stop us. We went to Museumplein while it was raining but it didn't stop our enjoyment. It is beautiful and very picturesque. The famous "i amsterdam" sign which is near on impossible to get a picture of just you or just your group on as there is so many others but it is still an experience.If it wasn't raining it would have been a beautiful area to sit and relax, taking in the views before going into one of the many museums.

Lively open space on a lovely day. Walked through/round/back again on way from Rijksmuseum to Van Gough Museum on a beautiful May Sunday.Lots of children playing, dogs running about, tourists taking photos and lovers loving on the grass! Great place to be just a few minutes away from a throbbing city.
Bustling. An unexpected pleasure in the centre of a city to wander round a beautiful plaza and people watch, always an interesting part of a holiday, a magnet for all visitors from around the globe.

Not much. Museumplein is not much of a place but a huge symbol “ I Amsterdam “ set in the middle of beautiful gardens and scenic beauty. For those who visit Amsterdam this could be a great place for photo op as an actual proof of been to Amsterdam. The whole place lies in front of the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum and can be incorporated into your itinerary while visiting them

Space to breathe. Museumplein is the open space between the Rijksmuseum and the Concertgebouw. A fine, grassed area with fountains and a good playground for the children. There are several places to eat, and a toilet within the Cobra Cafe, which costs 50c. It was a bit disconcerting as the cubicle doors are clear glass until you lock the door when they become opaque. Lots of stands selling the usual tourist gifts, and a Museum Gift Shop.A good place to chill between museums!

Place to stop rest and watch the world go by. With the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh and Stedelijk Museums and the Concertgebouw on the edges you can either buy a picnic at the supermarket nearby and stretch out on the grass or sit in one of the many pavement cafes between the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. Wander over to the area outside the US consulate and look at the memorial to the gypseys - an interesting sculpture
A must visit. Liked the quiet beauty of the area, and the proximity to museums, restaurants and the Dam. Take a basket and have a relaxing lunch in the area.

Nice place to sit back. We rested on the Museumplein a couple of times during our trip to Amsterdam. It was just this great place to sit back for a while, while on route to someplace else. There's this Albert Heins supermarket very close by and we'd buy something to drink and munch and then go pick a spot on the fresh cut grass. There are also a couple of bars there, with terraces (and equally important - bathrooms!). We were expecting them to be really pricy for such a good location, but a coffee was just 3 euros, a pitcher of beer (1.5l) was 15 euro, so good value for money for Amsterdam.

What a great area!. The trams go here and it's so easy to get around. All the museums are right in this area...well the big three anyway. There are restaurants - try the french pancake place. It is busy and full of people, there are gift shops and good stands just to get a snack. Very nice area of the city for sure!
Museumplein. Great open-space square where multiple museums are located and where you can sit, watch and enjoy the atmosphere around a famous IAmsterdam sign.
Beautiful area, close to museums. If you like museums, this is the place to go. Beautifully landscaped when we were there with tulips in full bloom.

Neat area. Here you will find many of the big museums like the Van Gogh museum and the Rijksmuseum as well as many others like the diamond museum. This is a great area to visit for museum lovers. The area also has many lunch trucks with anything from waffles and burgers to vegan hotdogs; truly something for everyone to eat during a long day of museum visits. There are also very odd little trees in the area, which are fun to photograph. The "IAMSTERDAM" sign in front of the Rijksmusem is also here and fun to take pictures with. This is a great place to spend the entire day or even two.
Greeeeeeny green. Its green.It was sunny when I was there.It is so large area where you can just lay down and chill...It is so amsterdamish :D

Dutch version of the Tuileries. Lovely open spaces, sidewalk cafes (except it was raining, so not much going on). Can imagine that in the summer months this place is rammed with people. Great café at the Stedlijk - and for picnics, pop into the supermarket and pick up some lovely bread and tapas (oh, and a bottle of wine, of course.)

absolutely beautiful!. the museumplein (museum square) is one of the most beautiful sights in amsterdam! the very large square for pedestrians is surrounded by the Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh Museum, the Stedelijk Museum (museum of modern arts) and the Cocertegbouw (concert hall). take a picture of yourself in front of the Iamsterdam statue and take in the beautiful scenery: large pond, tulips, gardens, tourist stands, cafés, benches … best when the weather is good!

A good place to start. After a park and ride the tram dropped us off at the top of the square. We wondered towards the Rijksmuseum briefly stopping by the Van Gogh museum where the hoardings around the building work are great. In front of the museum is the IAmsterdam blocks. Very busy but fun.

Fun place. Its realy nice Fun place to visit. Beautiful Park all around it. Fun place to take some awesome and funky pics. Have to be careful no to fall though and have to wait for your turn as its mostly crowded place.

A wonderful open space. This large airy square has the Rijksmuseum at the top and the Concertgebouw at the base.The Van Gogh museum is along one side. It is close to the Vondelpark. Pleasant walking territory and pleasant if pricey cafe.
Culture. Lovely place to relax and take a moment from the museum visits which are around the park. Nice ocasional music to listen to and nice tree shades to take a break.

Unique place. Well once you get there you feel a nice relaxed atmosphere, very much what Amsterdam transmits everyplace, but will give you that sense of where all your friends have taken that famous "I Amsterdam" picture.

Lively place to stop and rest between museums.. The Museumplein, or Museumsquare, is the public space that connects the three main museums: the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh and Stedelijk. There are large areas of grass to play or sunbathe, a pond currently full of bowls of tulips, a children's play area complete with basketball court and a square with cafes, ticket stands museum shops. There is also the iconic Iamsterdam sign. Great place to sit and people watch in between visiting the museums,

Lovely place for a lunch break. We were there in April on a beautiful, sunny day. A nice place to get a sandwich and sit by the water to enjoy all the tulips in bloom. A nice interlude between musuem visits.

An absolute delight in the Museumkwartier. Located in the Museumkwartier, right outside the Rijksmuseum is an absolute true Amsterdam delight. Museumplein is a large area filled with small cafes, gazing pools and beautiful landscape. A true favorite among locals, the large field in front of the museum is always dotted with tourists and locals alike relaxing the day away or catching up with friends while enjoying the afternoon sun. Don’t worry about not finding a place to relax as there is plenty of room for everyone. Numerous restaurants, cafes and shops are located within walking distance. Trams 3, 5, 7, 10, 12 and 14 drop you off right in front so transportation is very convenient. Bus 358 also stops right at the same station. Spend an afternoon relaxing in the grass like a true local and don’t miss this Amsterdam delight.

Home of the Iamsterdam sign!. A picturesque space- lovely in the sunshine! A nice place to stop for a drink (albeit an expensive drink!) before visiting the museums in this area. Easily accessible by tram. The Rijksmuseum building is stunning and the Iamsterdam sign makes for some fun photo opportunities. There are also lots of beautiful tulips dotted around which are fab for any aspiring photographers.
Great space. Don't miss this area. Excellent open and very picturesque area, great museums, and easily accessible by tram. Either buy tickets in advance or go later in the day to make the most of it.

Photo op. It's a great place to take some pictures. It's a bit crowded at times - Obviously. There are some nice cafe and coffee shops around. It's centrally located and easy to find. It's worth the photo op if you don't mind having many others in the picture.

Stay around here. Great location in Amsterdam for quiet streets, thus quiet hotels. Many cafés bars and restaurants of varying quality abound so choruses for every one.Some fabulous museums reside in this quarter and th great green space of Vondelpark is close by.
Open Space. This area is very open, the museums are arranged around it. Quite a constrast from the queues for the museums.

Lovely green space and excellent museums. I really liked the Museumplein - a lovely open space to sit, play football, have a picnic - a bit of breathing space for the city. The museums on the square are brilliant as well.

Great place to start your Cultural Experience. With the Rijks Museum and the Van Gogh Museum near by, it is a good place to being the day. Pavement cafes and well kept gardens, beautiful buildings and a very pleasant atmosphere. It is easy to reach on the number 10 tram.

The Best Museums in One Place. You need some stamina, but you could see the best of Amsterdam museums within a 5 minute area in the Museumplein. Try to get tickets for the Van Gogh and the Rijksmuseum in advance if possible. The lines are incredible but the museums are easily accessible.
Beautiful. It was a sunny Saturday and everybody wa enjoying a little of outside living. It was full of families, tourists and artist, showing theri goods and making performances. It was fun!!!

Nice open space, but crowded near the "I Amsterdam" sign. Just behind the Rijksmuseum and close to the Van Gogh museum, it's perfect to bring children to play or to spend some relaxing time before or after visiting the musems.
Taking a picture with the entire famous "I Amsterdam" sign is an impossible mission. Don't sweat it and just try your best to get a somewhat "clean" shot.

Supermarket with a grass roof.. Fun place to hang around. Don't forget to look on the street side of the sloped lawn and discover a great supermarket underneath. Eat lunch on the lawn and watch the world come by.
Central and lively. Lively location close to the key attractions and to the fashion district. Convenient supermarket located just off museumplein.

relaxing. A great spot to sit and relax between visiting museums that are near,
A great photo op of i love amsterdam, Bring a picnic if the weather is nice as play area here
also used as a skate park in the evenings. you can eat in the museums as well.

Wonderful open space. Lovely big open space in the middle of the museum quarter. Fantastic children's play areas including an interactive water fountain. Lovely open air and indoor bars to relax in. The I Amsterdam installation is great for photos and for the children to climb on.

Wonderful. This is an excellent area to visit, with the major museums nearby, near a canal, and near tram routes. Recommend eating in the Rijksmuseum and the Stedlijk museum restaurants - superb food and service.

Lovely in the spring sunshine!. This is a lovely park, mostly grass, but full of interesting things to see. Between the Van Gogh & Rijksmuseum, , it a great place to get some fresh air in the sunshine!

Pleasant area between some great museums. This is a great space between the various museums of the Museum quarter with an ambience you can only feel with experience. The area is green lawn mainly and lots of human activity of all kinds. There are some good cheap eating places off to one side and its a nice place to visit and photograph.
Museumplein area. This is a great neighbourhood to stay in - lively during the day, but quiet at night. And you are very close to three great museums.

great people watching, nice stop for a break. This park is well situated between Van Gogh and the Rijksmuseum and has lots of places to stop and rest before continuing your adventures. We were there at 1000 on a weekday and noticed the I AMsterdam sign was empty (great opportunity for the photo...) but by noon on our way back through it was crowded.The playground next to the reflection pool looked like a lot of fun, but is probably not an ideal location to stop and play for children under 3.

A lovely spot to people watch. This is a lovely green space in the city and is a great place to sit with a coffee or a beer and watch the antics of the tourists on the IAMSTERDAM sign! Prices are not exorbitant either!
Perfect on a sunny day. The area it's very clean, and perfect on a suny day. The park it's amazing and we can have a little moment to relax there

Lovely outdoor space. The title says it all really - if the weather is good and your intent on hitting the museum's, you'll be pleased that this square is there!Plenty of places to sit and relax and a number of cafe's along the side to grab a refreshing coffee!

Take a Break and Relax. This is a very nice place to rest, relax and catch your breath and enjoy your beautiful surroundings. It is located behind the Museum and has a large area of grass, a water feature and people doing all kinds of things. The day we were there we were entertained by a Scottish Bagpiper.

A good place to rest. At the back of the Rijksmuseum & Van Gogh Museum is Museumplein, a large expanse of parkland stretching down to the Concertbouw. This is a great place to rest or a picnic after visiting the museums, there are food & drink and souvenir stalls, plenty of space, benches etc. There's an Albert Heijn supermarket in the southern corner, and you're just round the corner from the poshest shops in Amsetrdam.
Hello Amsterdam. Loved taking pictures here and enjoying the parks. Make sure you sit on a bench and enjoy a warm waffle from one of the venders

Nice Area.. An area with a really good atmosphere. Lots of tourists and locals alike use the area for many reasons. Often buskers and street performers to make it even more fun. Plenty of vendors and near by cafes to grab food from as well. It was fairly chilly when I visited but I would assume it's nice on a sunny day.

Standard "I AM STERDAM" Photo. If you want the touristy "I AMSTERDAM" photo, then this is the place you go! It was raining when we were here, but it was still a nice place to visit with the museums surrounding :)
Pure Culture!. This is the square where many Museums are located. We visited the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum and there is a Diamond Museum as well. SO much culture to soak in....

Nice place where all the Museums meets. Single place for 3 museums...A nice area in front to sit and relax and more over I amsterdam sign is located right in front of the Rijks mueusem...So a photo spot to cover lot of things...

Wonderful and vibrant!!!. The Museumplein is one of the most sunny and vibrant places in Amsterdam. The place has got it's name because of a large number of museums in the vicinity. During the warmer part of the year, people enjoy sport and games or just lie around soaking in the warmth. There are a lot of good places to eat as well, there is especially a famous place for burgers and soft ice cream. You will be here by default if you wish to see the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, Diamond Museum or the Concertgebow. Wonderful place!

where the locals hang out. On the top of this rectangular square you have the Rijksmuseum, on the bottom the Concertgebouw, on the right the van Gogh museum and the Stedelijk Museum (contemporary art), and on the left you have business and also the US Consulate. The part close to the Rijksmuseum has a cafe and a museumshop as well as a small pond (an ice-skating ring in the winter months) and a playground; often the big IAmsterdam sign is up, which has turned into a major tourist attraction in its own right, particularly for those brave enough to climb on it. The rest is a big lawn. Many tourists hang out here, but also many locals, largely for playing soccer or other sports. Under the square (in the lower right corner) you have a supermarket which is open 7 days a week from 8-22 h with only very few closed days per year.

Lovely place to walk and soak the ambiance. the Von Gogh Museum can be seen in a day but you need at least a week to just walk through the Rijksmuseum. The queue is shorter if you have the iamsterdam card, and some places have a discount and others are free for card holders. This area is best seen on a weekday as weekends would be too packed and you will spend minimum and hour trying just to get in.

I AM STERDAM. This is where the huge I AM STERDAM sign is. This also where the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum are.We came, we had a photo with the sign and we moved on. Nice place to come to have a rest. Not much to do if you're not visiting the museums.

Photo Stop. On the must do list for Amsterdam - have your photo taken next to the I Amsterdam in Museumplein! Always lots of people. Quite a few nice coffee shops and eating places around the square for a pitstop break after visiting a museum.

Funny place. The musemplein or museum square is a very interesting place to visit. The square is in front of the Rijks Museum and I can find one of those interesting "sculpture" IAMSTERDAM and you can find a good place to drink something wile you are resting of the museum' visits. Nice view of the city

Photo with the sign. Very busy area, mainly with tourists clambering for photos with the IAMSTERDAM sign. Was blowing a gale when we were there so our stay was short lived, but the Van Gogh shop is right next to the sign so good for a wander round and there is a café nearby with Wi-Fi if it gets too cold.

Square of Culture. There's a lot of people there taking the typical tourist photo! You should too if you want, but the real beauty is not on the I amsterdam letters! You have beautiful places in the museumplein where you can take some pictures: in the rijksmuseum garden, in the icerink (if you go in the winter, till feb 1st) and in the park next to the Stedelijk museum. There's a burguer place that is amazing and you can enjoy the environment of this square as well!

Perfect tourist-sy photo opportunity. Museumplein is actually a big open area (or a square) that's a short distance from most of the major museums in Amsterdam and Vondelpark. The main attraction is to take a photo with the letters- and I think that yes, you should do that if it's on your way! After all, when in Rome do as the Romans do. After taking cutesy photos with the letters then there'll be no end of museums around to fill your time or to simply go on a cycling excursion in Vondelpark.During winter when it's cold enough, there'll be an ice-skating rink just in front of the letters,

Lovely Open Space in the City. Large open space surrounded by beautiful buildings housing museums and concert hall, trams trundling across at one end and lots of trees, fountains and sculptures old and modern. A great place to sit and draw breath whilst on a trip to the city

Good for a short visit. Museumplein is actually an open area between the biggest museums in Amsterdam - Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum & Stedelijk Museum. It has beautiful surroundings with fountains & sculptures and the famous Iamsterdam sign(similar to the one at the airport, but more fun here). But to get a decent photo with the Iamsterdam sign, you need to visit it early as it becomes busy & people are all over it to get pics with no regards to others.Nevertheless its a beautiful area with good mix of locals & tourists and must be included during the first visit to amsterdam. The place is also near to vondelpark, leidseplein and the canal cruise, so can be included in the day's itinerary.
Great pic. This was a spot on our bike route. Took cute picutres, we were there while the ice ring was on, super cute sight. I Amsterdam sign there makes a cool picture opportunity.
Awesome atmosphere. Open spaces and fresh air... Great place to be and ofcourse no trip will be complete without a pic of the "I amstermdam"
Great spot to people watch. Museumplain is a huge open square connecting the main museums. Colorful, bright and enjoyable place to sit and watch.

Fun area. We were in the area when the ice rink was out, the sun was shining, and everyone was having a good time. This is where you find the iconic 'I Amsterdam' sign and many museums. It's also not too far from the Heineken Brewery.

An Action Packed Square. It is a square where all actions begin. The 3 major museums, the Rijkmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and Stedelijk museum are all located within 3 minutes walk. Besides the iconic red letters, 'I amsterdam', there are also a restaurant, museum gift shop and an ice rink. This is the place you want to hang around in Amsterdam.
Must-See. Definitely a must-do for travellers in Amesterdam. The 'iamsterdam' is very large and easy to climb. Nothing else but those letters. Worth a 30 min-1hr visit!

Must see while in Amsterdam. This is the first place to go when you begin to visit Amsterdam and Holland art History because you have the Rijks and the Van Gogh Museum, two of the majors art museum of the city.The place has its own attractions, the famous letter from I am sterdam.Perfect place when it is sunny! Definitely a must see!

Buy the Museumkaart!!. Beautiful museums all around. We went to the Stedelijk first then the Rijks and finally the Van Gogh. Don't try to do them all in one day. But do get the Museumkaart if you plan on going to several. The price will save you money if you plan on doing several museums. But far more than that there is no wait at the museums with the longest lines, such as the Van Gogh, the Rijks, and Anne Frank House. Do the Kaart first thing. The Museumplein is a great experience in itself. We loved the ice rink!!! And because the tram line is right there, it's so very easily accessible to all of Amsterdam.

Must do for a picture when in Amsterdam. A picture next to the "I Amsterdam" sign is a must when you're visiting Amsterdam.The area is very nice and it has a nice atmosphere with everyone having fun getting pictures next to / or on the sign!When we were there there was also an ice rink nearby for Christmas that was full of people and seemed to be good fun! Best to Arrive early if you want to get a picture alone as it gets very busy very early in the day!
Clean and so many attractions. lots to see and do, there is also an ice rink there at the moment. Clean and busy with lots of tourists

bring the family. A lovely place to bring the family, summer or winter (ice skating rink!). There are play areas for the little people, the huge I AMsterdam sign to act goofy whilst taking photos, the newly re-opened Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh and other museums surround the large open park, everything within walking distance and easy access.

Lovely place with an iconic view and fun atmosphere. We came the week before Christmas and with the sking rink and replica of the skinny bridge overlooking the I Amsterdam sign, it was quite a great place to hang out, walk around, and take in the great view with lots of people enjoying it. A very memorable area.

Good place for a break. We came out of the rijksmuseum and were pleasantly surprised to find this relaxing spot on a sunny, cold afternoon. Of course my daughter got the obligatory pic in front of the sign. Then we found a ?van selling what I believe to be the best hot dogs I have had anywhere, ever. Great spot for people watching before you trek back to your hotel

Great place for day hangout. When we are out for vacation, we want to utilize each and every second. We want to see every corner to place so that we do not miss the fun and major attraction of that city. Even the museums are quiet interesting thing to visit.Museumplein of Amsterdam is the big square, where all the major museums are located. Museumplein is centrally located park, which has a big sign of “I AMSTERDAM”. Most of the tourist love to capture their photos with that sign. This is the place to visit and gain some knowledge about the history and culture of Amsterdam. Everything can be seen under the one roof.

Walking around. Plaza around important museums, several hotels and restaurants. There is a tourist information place near the lazy where you can buy the Holland City Pass and get information about attractions.

Relax & Unwind. This is a lovely neighborhood situated close to Amsterdam's three most important museums. The Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh Museum and the national museum.The museumplein has the 'Iamsterdam' sign, and is very popular with kids and adults alike clambering all over it. It is a nice photo opportunity.Next to the sign is a souvenir shop and ticket shop where you can buy tickets for the museums. Just behind the shop is a large park frequented by locals playing soccer or just picnicking. The traditional Dutch buildings in the background form a really picturesque scene.By the side of souvenir shop is a lane that lead to a small lane that is filled with waffle shops, souvenir shops and burger joints all serving relatively cheap and fresh food. This is a great place to take a break from all the museum walking and to just unwind and take in a bit of the local color. There are also shops selling replica oil paintings and the like.Museumplein is easily accessible by tram and bus.
Good place to hang out. Good location to stop and take a brief break while visiting the local museums. Love the little sculptures and the famous I amsterdam sign.

good but not special. okay yeah its a novelty, its cool to see, and yes i got a photo taken at it. but its so busy and people are clambering over it to get photos. its a bit un-personal. it is clean and beautiful but not something that strikes me as a huge tourist attraction. i wouldnt go back to this part of amsterdam
Take a break here.... Nice, clean park where you can relax between museums and admire the surrounding architecture, let the kids blow off some steam, eat a quick bite, etc.

Msueumplein is happily what is more or less used to be. This is the place where you will finds the most important museums of the city, but it is a nice place to stick around for a while, playing soccer with locals or just watch the people going by.

Relax between sightseeing. Museumplein is the square between 3 of the biggest museums in Amsterdam, Van Gogh, Modern Art and Rijksmuseum. So it is a great place to relax between seeing these museums, take a picture next to the giant ''I amsterdam'', have a coffee and buy some souvenirs.In my visit I saw a lot of locals having a picnic there, and I totally recommend it.

Couture shops. Couture shopping Amsterdam style, really relaxed and laid back place to pick up disigner gear if you don't like the crows in Knightsbride or Bond Street this would be good place to max out on your credit card.

relax in Museumplein. Nice area to hang out a few cafe's on one side and on the other there is a skater park and chiildren's play area, loads of grass and free space largely bicycle free to let your kids run around in, good chill out and picnic area.

Great place to hang out.. This park area is surrounded by Museums so there are lots of tourists but it is fun to hang out when the weather is good. There is a nice outdoor cafe and museum shops around. Great place to enjoy the outdoors after a day in the Musuems.

Excellent little park to rest between museums. Excellent location to stop and take a brief break while visiting the local museums. Quirky little sculptures and the famous I amsterdam sign. Lots of tourist during the warm weather taking their obligatory photos and an overall fun and funky little park. Well worth a visit.

3 world-class museums in a park-like setting. There are very few places in the world where you can find 3 world-class museums in one small area surrounded by acres of parkland. Make time to see all 3 museums. My favorite is the Van Gogh museum, followed by the Rijksmuseum and last the Stedjelik, but all are worthwhile. Trams take you to the north, west or south perimeter of the park. After your museum visits head towards Leidseplein for lunch and other festivities including street performers in warm weather.

Nice place to hang out and take some rest. This is a a good place to just have some rest and for kids to have a little fun in the park. We stopped here after making a visit to the diamond musuem. Dont go out of your way to see this, but if u happen to be around the museums, just take some snaps here

Beautiful!. This is a beautiful park with fountains and sculptures, including the Iamsterdam (like at the airport) and is surrounded by the Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh museum, and the Stadmuseum. Lotsof people picnicing, walking, biking, and playing frisbee. Wonderfully manicured lawns, surrounded by amazing architecture. Well worth it!

Fun, but BUSY. We walked through the Museumplein on our way to the Van Gogh museum, and hoping to take a photo with the iamsterdam sign (kitschy, but cool). However, by 10am there were SO many people here that it was pretty much impossible. There was no common courtesy or respect for those waiting - everyone was just pushing and shoving and walking in front of people to get what they wanted. Had we more time in Amsterdam we would have left and come back a different time of day. The grass field was full of picnicers - and a great location. All the public sculptures add to the area, and the large fountain/pond in the middle is beautiful and adds. Great place to take a "break". However, in the summer, the crowds of tourist from 10 - 4 at least, are unavoidable.
My Wife Favorite Place. Nice place to hang out, especially nowadays when Rijksmuseum is finally completed. Don't miss this popular place.
Such a NICE spot!. In such a great city with so many nice spots, this is another great one! 3 museums are right in this locale! Enjoy the flavor of local life surrounded by world famous art :)!!!!

The best place for everything. Here you can find museums, the I Amsterdam sign (I recommend you to visit in the evening so you can take a picture with only you in it), big green space to lay down or play on, this is the perfect relaxation place. It's full of energy, it's fun, i'd come here every day. I did that when I was in Amsterdam. There are benches, free water :), small souvenir stores and food to go

Nice place for a break. It's a lovely place to just hang out. A somewhat cool looking lake and the huge IAmsterdam letters seem to attract a lot of people to this area and the green zones around it. Overall, a pretty nice place to take a break, relax and enjoy the scenery.

T'was nice.. Nice little park bit surrounded by the Rijks and Van Gogh museum. Its a nice relaxing place, a lot of tourists in the area, but its not too crowded, I could have stayed there most of the afternoon. Surrounded also by little cafes, got waffles and all sorts!

The iconic I amsterdam sign.. You must visit early (by 9am i would say) if you want to get a photo with the I amsterdam sign and be the only person in it. The sign quickly fills up with people standing and climbing all over it with no regard for anyone elses photo. The museums will also be less busy then. There is a kiosk to buy tickets for the Van Gogh museum which is a must to avoid insanely long queues. Its a beautiful area, the Rijksmuseum provides a nice backdrop to the iconic I amsterdam sign and a water feature, with artistic statues and designs, in the foreground. A large area of grass leads to the Concert Hall.Theres also a kiosk that sells freshly made, hot Stroopwaffels. A must try in Amsterdam.

something you have to Do. Its a big grass field with a large reflecting pool and the "I Amsterdam" sign which pulls it all together. Its simple but brilliant, the "I amsterdam/I am Amsterdam" sign draws you to it like a magnet, I don't know why, but I challenge you to go see the sign with its brilliant Rijksmuseum backdrop and not want to immediately have your picture taken in front of it. The atmosphere is actually better in the evening when the crowds around the sign are less, but the grassed field fills with scattered groups of Amsterdam youth enjoying the outdoors and maybe a beer or local specialty.
Pretty!. Very pretty area of Amsterdam. Very busy though! Lovely when the weather is nice and hot and sunny! Lots of museums to look around. Brilliant spot for taking pictures and making memories!

great to just sit. We ended up here accidently as it is between two of the museums and there is a lovely cafe as well. The food was very good (we had salads and a sandwhich) and not exorbitantly priced. The park is a great place to just sit and watch the kids play in the water or relax before moving on to the next attraction.

Great place to meet people and just relax. We reached this place by accident. It is very close to the museums and very refreshing. The sculpture pool was a lot of fun. Arrive early as many your people and old like to climb on the sign (I AMSTERDAM).

Iamsterdam. This was a lovely huge park with the now famous sign/art display IAMSTERDAM-( someone really had their tourist-attraction cap on for this!) but its fun.  There's a beautiful poolw/ some art installations, in the center of the park where people , on a hot day , can dip their feet or wade in (unfortunately dogs can too).Very well kept grassy area , lots of places to sit & rest , between the 2 popular museums-hence the name, Museumplein-which if you don't speak dutch, was confusing.Also had a cafe on the border to eat/ drink-very nice place to stop!

Lovely place to relax. Sightseeing can be a tiring experience and Museumplein is just the place to take it easy and unwind. The sunny afternoons and evenings are the perfect scenario for peaceful moments. You can take your food and have a picnic there - just like the local people, especially on weekends.

Apart from venue for museums, Iamsterdam!. Apart from being a venue to a host of museums and a vast expanse of green grass where locals relax during summer, Museumplein is also the site of the Iamsterdam sign which is a great photo-op. A bit further away from other attractions, you can get a tram here from Centraal and most other places.

Everyone take a photo here. Pull out of the tram and go to the museuns !!! All around here can be visited, there is a large grass that you can rest or read your book. Don´t lose time, go to the museum!

Chill out. Lovely area to unwind after a busy day sight-seeing. We loved the open grass, and our 2 year old really enjoyed bombing about exploring. It's really beautiful and the I amsterdam sign is a must-see.

Good for all ages and weather conditions. Although we had read the reviews, it was still a wonderful surprise to walk through the arches of the Rijksmuseum into such a beautiful space. There are a variety of open spaces, shops, bars and restaurants and none of them felt like a "rip off". A really pleasant space to spend the day.

Photo opportunity. Great place to take some pictures. It is at the end of museumplein and very close to van gogh museum and the national museum. During weekends there the space next to the sign is a market (or at least it was when we were there).Tip 1: Get there early so there is less crowded. in the weekends before 8-9 and during workdays 9-10.Tip 2: To get there yo can take 2 or 5 from he central station and get off at "rijksmuseum". Or if you are coming from the eat of the city number 1 to Hoygedstraat and switch to 3 or 12 going south for 1 stop(get off next to bagels and beans, which is a great place for lunch by the way).

Lots of things to do here. You could spend an entire vacation with all the museums surrounding Museumplein. The Museumplein itself is a nice greenspace with some modern sculpture and a reflecting pool. Two of the best museums are here - Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh. Places to eat in the plaza and nearby, plenty of tram access. What's not to like?

Great Place to Unwind After Visiting Museums. This is essentially a very large, open area with a lawned area that links the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh, Bols, Concertbouw, Stedelijk and Diamant Musuem. There are three candy like scuplures in water, which is shallow enough to paddle in. We saw lot of people dipping there toes in here to cool there feet (which you will need to do after Rijksmuseum, that place is HUGE). There is a Albert Heijn supermarket near Stedelijk if you wanted to have mini picnic here, which is great.Many people come here to take a picture of the I Amsterdam sign, the other permanent one is located at Schiphol Airport and there is one temporary one (which we didn't find). Good spot for photos.

Nice place to relax on a sunny day. Only Came here to see the I AMsterday sign, did not really expect to find what i did. the big open lawns was fantatice place to just sit and enjoy the sun (which we had lots of on my visit) the fountain was had a great view of the musuem and again a lovely place to relax by, of course the now iconic IAMsterdam sign was busy but if you take your time it tends to go really busy and then you have a 30 sec window, i climbed it to get my photo done people did tend to be paitent and friendly. we had no time to see the musuems but loved just relaxing and having a peacefull time here.

You must take a picture with the "I am Amsterdam" sign. Another must do in Amsterdam: to take a pic with that huge thing. Don't even think it would be all clear and without any other tourists climbing it to take their pictures. Just share the moment. LOL.=)
Great place to relax. The open grass areas are wonderful. There are benches for relaxing. The I Am Amsterdam sign is iconic, but a bit crowded for my taste. Worth spenfding some time here.

Green square where you also find the "I amsterdam". This is a large open grassy space with benches and flower trees in the sides as well as the large "I amsterdam" (there is a much smaller version in the Amsterdam RAI). The "I amsterdam" letters are huge and some people climb the letters for taking photos. Of course, the earlier one is, the better for photo taking without other people (I visited around 830am). In addition, there are a few small kiosks for drinks and snacks with seating areas.This green square has Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, and Concertgeubow along its borders so there is no need to target Museumplein on its own. Great option for kids to run around in after a few hours of viewing in the museums, or tired tourists to just plop on the grass, get some sun and rest those legs!Museumplein can be reached by tram which stops right in front of Concertgeubow.
Big square of Amsterdam museums). Nice place to spend a lot of time with profit in Amsterdam! All important museums are here. Besides it's quite big and is good even just for strolling))

Cool sculptures & neat place to chill out. This is a pretty cool centrally located park. There's a huge I Amsterdam sign where EVERYONE attempts to get a photo. There are also some interesting structures to see, some cool shops for neat souvenirs and some food stands. It's definitely a neat place to stop by and visit while you're in town.

A quick view. When you make a trip to Amsterdam you really need to check this square! You can find a nice spot to chill out on the grass or enjoy the activities over there. At the museumplein, Dutch for museumsquare, you can find the concertbuilding and the Van Gogh museum but maybe the most important for your pictures the kingsize text 'IAmsterdam'. This is the trademark of the city for public relations and commercials. Ofcourse very nice to have a picture of you on one of the letters.One thing, don't expect to have only yourself on the picture with the text. It is very crowded and every tourist has the same mission; make a picture of yourself with the kingsize text!How to get there? From central station or damsquare tramline 16 and many others!

Chill out space. Visited here on a Sunday afternoon. Tried to get into the Rijksmuseum but the queues were way too long. Walked through and into this wonderful open space and although there were lots of people you could easily find a quiet area to sit and enjoy the sunshine. The over sized scultures in the pond, the ball display and the other museums in the area make it a great place to chill out and relax, away from the busy streets of the city.

More than the Iamsterdam sign. This area consist of the Concertgebouw and 3 museums, the Rijks, Van Gogh and Stedelijk. Very large area and we were there a day before Queen's Day and massive set up of the stage for the Queen's Day Concert. Great to spend time here if it is a sunny day with lots of people watching. There are food and souvenirs stalls along the walking path from Concertgebouw to Rijks. Not too fascinated by the Iamsterdam sign though, it can be quite crowded as people attempt to climb up and down the sign. There is actually one just outside Schiphol Plaza/ Airport

beautiful!. Visited the I Amsterdam sign yesterday. Was very busy but it was hot and sunny so I didnt expect anything less!! We got some photos of us on the I amsterdam sign, yes so there were about 50 other people in our pic but we weren't bothered that much as we were probably in their photos too! The water pond area in front of the sign is beautiful - clear water, free of rubbish and lovely and cool. There were small children paddling and people dipping their feet in, which we did too. spent a lovely afternoon there!

iAmsterdam. This is one of a few places where you get to take photos of the famous I Amsterdam sign, the other is across from the train station, across the canal I mean. But be here early if you plan on climbing it and having a photo of you in it without any other strangers milling about, trying to take their own photos of this famous advertisement board.There is no restriction in climbing the sign, so feel free to do so. Now with the reopening of the Rijksmuseum, makes this a must-visit place. You have everything here - Van Gogh Museum, Diamond Museum, Rijksmuseum, Concertgebouw, and the Vondelpark is just a stone's throw away.

Picnickin' perfection.. C'mon, when in Amsterdam you just have to swing by the Museum quarter to get a photo with the I Amsterdam sign. Yes, there are going to be at least 50 strangers in every photo you take and maybe you won't be as successful at climbing the letter T as you'd hoped, but it's definitely worth a quick visit. Trams pull up right out front for easy reach and, of course, it is very easy to bike to. The good thing is there are all those great museums to explore while you're there - the Stedelijk Museum of Modern Art, the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum (arts and history). There is also an Albert Heins supermarket! Which is not that majestic but you will be so, so grateful for it when you realise just how much you want to picnic on the beautiful big grassed area underneath the blossoming trees.

A stop on the way to the museums. The famous I AMsterdam sign is here. Good luck trying to get on it with only yourself. It will have 10-15 people on it continuously 24 hours a day. There are some cafes to eat here and even an Albert Heins. The square has skating on it in the winter. Easily reached by tram this will be your base for the big museums in Amsterdam. If you are looking for an open space that is not as crowded I recommend Vondal Park. But still, snap that photo in front of the sign..

Pretty square. Absolutely fell in love with this square. Was very beautiful with the blossoms and the buildings surroundings, like the concert house, the rijkmusuem, and the beautiful classic Amsterdam houses surrounding. The I Amsterdam sign is located here, although avoiding coming here in the middle of the day. I enjoyed being here in the evening and in the early morning when it was more quiet. A must visit for Amsterdam!

Luxury surrounded by incredible art. What is fantastic about being surrounded by 3 top museums of the world, is the possibility makes to enjoy some of the best art of the last 6 centuries, including of course the Golden Century the 18th.

The crowds...ugh!. Oh my goodness the amount of people there made the experience very short and frustrating! It wouldn't have been so bad however people taking pictures were so close they ended up in all the photos when I tried to take one of the whole I AMSTERDAM sign. We went back twice and it was awful both times...quite disappointing! On the upside there is an I AMSTERDAM sign at the airport which had NO ONE on it so I was able to take several pictures and enjoy walking around it. The other thing that annoyed me was the price of merchandise for the I AMSTERDAM stuff - way overpriced! The landscape around the area was am amazing - there is a grocery store Albert Heijn (ah on the sign) near the slopped area so we bought some lunch snacks and ate on the grass and enjoyed the wonderful day and scenery. It was a lovely way to have lunch and cheaper than restaurants.

Uncrowded and nicely landscaped.. What I like about Museumplein is that it is a large and open. It is always nicely landscaped with a huge 'pool-like' feature in the centre. Lots of venues are held here. It gets busy on those days but usually I find that it is not overly crowded on a regular day. Rijksmuseum is an immpressive feature building. The Van Gogh Museum and Concert Gebouw both sit at the plein (square).

Place for photos. In this place have a sign with the word Amsterdam that many persons take a picture in the big square. If you wait stay only for take a picture, you go wait very much, because the concurrence is big and is probably that your photo has many strange persons.

Nice place to chill out.. Cool open space with a play ground and lot's of touristy places to eat. One van sell's lovely veggie burgers, can't remember the name now though. Wasps everywhere in the summer. Museums all around.

Open area...with a famous sight. Museumplein offers some awesome views and a very famous sight. It offers a quieter more relaxed version of Amsterdam than you would get in the city centre which was nice. Easy to get to and near alot of other attractions and great restaurants.

Most museums closed. Most of the museums were closed when we visited, but the grounds are still worth a visit, particularly for the I amsterdam sculpture (which is more difficult to climb on to than it seems) good for photos.

Interesting designs in the middle of the city. The architecture is pretty spectacular, but in strong contrast to the rest of this old and lovely city. There is a super market under an angled sod roof and several modern buildings perched on this open (AND WINDY) plain. You either like it or you don't. The museums in the area have something to offer, but it will pay you to do some research about what each offers and allocate your time accordingly.

One of the great views of Amsterdam - if you look in the right direction. A beautiful place, especially now, when the restauration of the Rijksmuseum comes to and end. On the other side the concertgebouw would make the place nearly perfect - unfortunately also the restauration of the Stedelijk museum is done. The backside of this formerly beautiful museums has been transformed into one of the most ugly structures I have seen in European cities. I fail to understand why the authorities decided to damage the beautiful museum plain and destroy the great impression the Stedelijk museum could have. Have a look at the front and close your eyes in the back.

Huge Open Space!. Museumplein is a nice spot where you can grab a picture with the I am Amsterdam display and enjoy the huge open spaces. Any visitor has to add this spot to there list when visiting easy.

Need to visit at dawn to get a photo!. We visited in February - at midday - and it was heaving with people. To get a great photo with the iAmsterdam sign you would need to be there at dawn. Nice grassed area to walk and relax. On the day we visited it was sunny and warm for the time of year.

A must when in Amsterdam :). This is a really nice area to visit, the park was very busy with people playing soccer, taking photos and relaxing. There are a lot of people taking photos of the letters and climbing on them, but it ticks a box on the must see places list in Amsterdam.Worth a visit and a photo :)

The original IAMsterdam sign. This square is located between some of the main and best museums in Amsterdam - the Rijksmuseum, Stedelijk and van Gogh museum. The original I AMsterdam sign is there, which is always busy with people taking many photos. When its warm outside, there is a large green space which is great for laying in the grass or having a picnic.

Iamsterdam, Iamimpressed.. This "heart of Amsterdam" area is a great photo opportunity place. The huge sign with museums all around and an ice rink in the winter when we were there, also little outdoor cafes and shops on the parallel streets. Great for everyone and definitely worth a few snaps. Adamthetraveller x
Nice place. really nice area. great for photos and to relax. park was very busy with people playing soccer and taking photos of the letters. if you have time to go there, you should go.

Um....... Too much people and every one try to Cimb on it.
That's not something that i expected.
If you want a good memory, may be you have to visit here in the dawn.
Nice place for tourist to take photos. In the winter you can ic scate on the square. Also take nice pictures of the rijksmuseum. Also centrally located close to the nicest shopping streets.

Huge words, a great check point. This place, to me, was like the centre of the arts universe in Amsterdam. Fine buildings everywhere. So with me and my Top Deck mates, we did what most young guys would do, pose and relax on those alphabets. Seriously, a good area, you cannot miss it.

This must be ground zero of Amsterdam. We somehow passed by this area every day once or twice as we walked to most places while in Amsterdam (sometimes took the trams one way and that is a great experience also). Coming or going, we would use this park as a landmark and know which way to get back to our hotel. There is a kids park here with the most unique basket swings I ever saw. Our little daughter could lay in it, or sit in it or move around and we swung her gently. Various museums are all around, one of which is a diamond museum but the hours it is open are very limited. This area around the park is oozing culture..... it is a must pass by location.... a good photo shoot spot also.

Large square with museums all around. Often there are events that take place on the large lawn that acts as the anchor for the three museums that outline it. The modern art, the van Gogh and the National museum. All three worthy museums to visit - this is a great place to spend some time. Easily accessible via many trams, this area also showcases some phenomenal architecture. So, if you are not into museums, this location is still wonderful for people watching, grabbing a coffee and wandering around, soaking in the gorgeous architecture - from historic to modern.

Identity of Amsterdam. Nested in between two museums, Van Gogh and Rijk, with lot of open space, garden, play area and a reflecting pool.. says a lot about Amsterdam.. It seems to say to me "Creativity come in a Relaxed Frame of Mind" Took a coffee from a nearby vendor, chatted with the painter selling Ts and mused over Van Gogh.. Completely Relaxed..
Must've seen.. The best landmark in Amsterdam! :D Always be prepared for the photo you want, because you never know when the moment comes... Then there's the Van Gogh and the Rijk museum

I AM BETH AMSTERDAM. After touring the museum we happened to stumble across the lifesize sign that states " I AM AMSTERDAM ". Which contains a refecting pool and open park space in a very pretty and relaxing area in the heart of the city. Purchased a hot chocolate and coffee from a vendor named Derek Mcgee (who spoke english-everyone in amsterdam speaks english).
A lot to do round here. Two big museums round here, the rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum. The big open space is good to. Some good cafes to sit in and get a well earned drink

OK ........ Shame that the area is like one big building site at the moment with two of the largest Museums under renovation. Wall to Wall tourists who seem o be lost is how to best sum up Museumplein ....

Wonderful Apple Kraffen!. The Museumplein is a field that is surrounded by the Williem Stdelijk Museum and the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum both of which are currently undergoing renovations. However adjacent to the Plein and just on the sidewalk of Van Baerlestratt and across the street from the Concertgebouw is a food wagon that serves the most wonderful freshly made hot doughnuts or kraffen. The apple one is to die for!!!

Stedelijk museum. After 6-7 years renevation Stedelijk had open doors agein.And it has been worth of the wait. Combination of new and old part of building is great. New part is fasination architecture. Inside you will see permanent collection, at the moment they show from Winsent van Gogh,Chagall, Matisse to Bruse Numan, Andy Warholl... Collection set up is really intresting. I had gerat day there, higlly recommed place to see unigue archeture and art.inside nice restaurant too. jormaa

"I Amsterdam" - not just the touristic picture!. Ok, so everyone has a picture on the "I Amsterdam" enormous letters.But seriously, after doing so, start walking in the gardens just in front (that is, if you haven't got there through them already).It's amazing to look at the place from far away, it's so magnanimous!The best time to go there is in the late afternoon, when you still have light enough to have some good pictures, but not many people. The place is crowded with tourists...Go get your photographic souvenir from Amsterdam ;)

Nice area. Convenient - the most famous museums in one area. Spacious place nice for walking. Don't miss famous IAMsterdam letters (always crowded with teenagers climbing on the top of letters for making photos).
I amsterdam. So much going on, buskers, street food, kids playground...plus 'those letters', most photographed landmark around, apparently.

Iamsterdam. In this area is the Iamsterdam sign which is popular for photos. It is free to take photos. Tip - visit early so that you can have a photo with the big structure on your own! Luckily i was staying around the corner so i woke up at about 6am and went for a walk past. Surrounding the area is spacious parkland and cute terrace houses. There are quite a few museums in the area nearby to visit.

Photo op. Nice place to get a quick refreshment, and ease the feet after the museum visits...and there's the Iamsterdam sign, like everyone else says-impossible to NOT get other tourists in pics, but fun!

museum area and the famous iamsterdam sign :). walking distance to museums and go get a picture at the famous iamsterdam sign (although there are many people wanted to take pic so might sort of queue), this place is quite near to centraal station.

Go and get a photo infront of the Iamsterdam sign. We went for a walk one evening after all the museums were closed but had lots of fun taking photos sitting on the massive red and white Iamsterdam sign

Nothing spectacular - can hang out here after a museum visit. There's is long pool there which can be transformed into an artificial ice skating area during winter if weather permits. Also, there is the huge iamsterdam sign where an unending crowd hangs about taking pictures - pretty much impossible to take a picture in the day without someone photobombing you (and vice versa).Not a bad place to hang out after visiting the Rijksmuseum - there are some nice waffle stands with white canopies around the "square".However, there is currently unsightly construction work taking place very near to the pool (at the southwest end) - too bad about the potentially good view of the pool!

So beautiful, STAY Here when visiting Amsterdam!. We are staying above Tiffany & Co. in an apartment, poshest place ever! Must see, Louis V, Oger and Burberry are right out my window. Friendly, not snobby. You will love it! :)
Great Novelty. It was fun to have our photo taken on the I Amsterdam sign. Located right beside the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum we only stumbled upon it by accident.

I AMSTERDAM and Museum site. This is a MUST do when you get to Amsterdam. This place has the famous I AMSTERDAM sculpture, plenty of field space to sprawl out on or to play some football, hit the skatepark, and of course the museums. Be advised that this place is usually very busy with people getting their pictures in and people playing sports on the endless green grassy fields, or dining in one of the cafes. With so much in one place you must be prepared for it to be busy. We went immediately over after checking into the Hotel and found ourselves in a sea of people crawling all over the I AMSTERDAM sign getting pictures. I will admit it was tough with our 8 year old but allowed her to play a little as we got into the mix of picture taking with all the other tourists. There is a playground there and a huge water reflecting pool, although not much reflecting with all the dogs splashing around. A great little secret- go early in the morning here and there is nobody on the sign, much less in the whole entire area. We went early the next morning after our initial trip and had the entire sign to ourselves with another pair taking pics. They were polite,as we were, and shared the picture opportunities that just don't exist later in the day. Imagine only 6 people at the sign taking pictures...a great area to be in at all times of the day depending on what your looking for.

Great spot for photos ..... As others mentioned, this is a great place to take a few pictures while you are waiting to get into one of the various museums or when you are finished with them. They have the Big Amsterdam sign that people climb all over to take photos on and that is fun. But the area also has a big field you can sit down and read a book or just catch up on your sun tanning. We saw a bit of that.Just a great area to stroll through and take it all in.

Touristy but fun!. One of the Anmspterdam landmark! taking pictures in front of the I Amsterdam sign is a fun thign to do!. It is touristy and a bit crowded,but hey, people wanna go here for a reason:). Going with your friends is really recommended!
Nice area with a lot of musea. It is a nice area in a busy city with some nice buildings/musea around it. The square itself is not particularly nice.

Crawling with people, with good reason!. We were there before the opening of the museums and it seems like we weren't the only ones that thought of getting to the area and to the museums early. The famous (I am)sterdam letters can be found there, but beware getting a picture can be challenging if you don't want anyone else in the picture
nice. It is really cool to have w photo with "I AMSTERDAM" but be prepared for crowds. By the way, museums in Amsterdam are great :)
Great location. Great Place to find a hotel at as there is so much to do , eat and transportation is easy
The photo opportunity. It;s the place everyone takes pictures, it is close to all the museums of course with plenty of place to eat.

Not my Style. I LOVED Amsterdam, but this was the only part of it that I didn't particularly enjoy. I'm glad I saw it once, but in the future, I very well may never venture down to this area, the only part that feels like an impersonal big city. I'll stick to the Jordaan and the Nine Streets for some charm.

Great place to relax after visiting the museums. Large open plaza located between the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum. It has a water fountain, places to sit and relax as well as shops where you can buy coffee and snacks. In the background is the large I Amsterdam sign.

Interesting place to visit in Amsterdam. Two of the best museums in Europe - Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum are here, but place is more than that. You can sit by the fountain, listen musicians, have a picnic on a grass, children can play on the playground and than you can go and shop for dimonds. It's all there.
Fabulous!. This attraction was one of my favourites! Mostly as it was a little unexpected. I also managed to climb onto the wording & have a photo taken - like most of those who visited....

Cappucino and looking at the skaters, lay in grass. Great resting place and all most important museums concentrated round the Museumplein. Like to be lazy there, when others basketball, skate, lay in the grass, cool their feet in the water or sit on a terrace with great snacks.

Fun photo spot. This park between the museums was very nice -- a good place to get some sun and relax for a bit. It's busier than some other parts of town, thanks to the museums and the I.am.sterdam sign -- which is a cool sign and, despite the crowd, a great place for a fun vacation picture! It's also great to see people interacting with a piece of public art. There's a large reflecting pond, lots of green space, and a couple of places to purchase a sandwich or a drink. A nice spot in a nice city.

The park in between the museums (Museumplein). The Amsterdam Museumplein (park) is good for a quick break. It has a few kiosk style food places, one place to grab an overpriced meal and a beer. It also has the famous "I Amsterdam" sculpture. It's between the Rijks and the Van Gogh museum. If you are looking for food, stand in front of the I Amsterdam sculpture and look left - you will see a green rooftop the shape of a bell. walk in that direction about four blocks and you will come to the platz (plaza) with the hardrock cafe. follow the bike path down hill, under the archway, and you will find dozens and dozens of restaraunts. Many very dutch, many pizza joints, greek, pancake houses, etc. From this point you are about 1.2 kilometers from the Ann Frank house and west church. Also, there is a Q Park garage here for the museums. very expensive, but underground, convenient and well lit. For a few hours in the museum, the Q park works well.

Place for Photos. The Museumplein is the area of Amsterdam where you can find the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum. There is the famous sign "I amsterdam", with big letters and where everyone wants to have his photo taken. Nearby is a large man-made reflecting pond. There is an area where one can buy food and shops that feature art.

Nice Open Area Great for Picture Opportunity. The Museumplein is a great open area where you can take in some great views of some of the main museums and a great picture opportunity with the I Amsterdam sign in front of the Rijksmuseum and the Concertgebouw. On a nice day you can just relax and people watch without even worrying about the heck pace of travel and museum visiting.
Nice place. Walk around the green area is kind Amsterdam experience. Place from category: must see and touch. Respect for creators of "I amsterdam".

A lovely area. A beautiful area of green space and culture. Hosts the van Gogh, Rijksmuseum, Concertgebouw, Diamond stores and P.C Hoofstraat.. what more could you want?
It's great to enjoy the culture, the shopping, and just get a taste of Amsterdam in this relaxed neighborhood.

High fashion and museums in one. Hoofstraat especially and other nearby streets host the majority of designer shops. Name a designer and he's there to claim your wallet. Apart from the shops, it's a beautiful area to walk around and marvel at the lovely houses with their gardens.

I Amsterdam!. Didn't actually go to any of the museums, but the area is nice. looking. Lawns are ideal for sitting in the sun, and maybe having a picnic or a rest. Worth it just to go take pictures with the big I AMsterdam letters. Found it a challenge just to get up on the E properly... but Im pretty short. But beware, when the ice rink is up in Winter, it's hard to get a proper picture!

Not very special place in Amsterdam. City seems to struggle as to how make this huge square attractive for visitors but sofar without success. I always feel a bit 'lost' when I have to cross it. Of course, you have the Van Gogh museum and Concertgebouw there so that compensates.
Great place to walk and take a picture with the I AMSTERDAM sign. You gotta go to love it. Nice on a sunny or cold day.
Museum hot spot. Just start walking through Museumplein (Museum square), passing museums one by one, litteraly based across the street of each other. Once you go in, you spend there hours...
Nice area. Access point to a few of the main museums in town, boasts concerts in summer.
Museumplein is very plain. Just not a lot there really, a big open space of grass, very average cafe with bad slow service, netter places to go.
Nice area to visit. It's a nice area to walk around and eat something. You could even take a photo in front of famous " I amsterdam" sign. I really loved it.
nice area. This is a nice area to chill out, grab something to eat, people watch. Lovely part of Amsterdam.

The Famous Amsterdam Sign in between all the Museums. The biggest attraction in the area is the Famous giant I AMSTERDAM sign, in front of the Rijksmuseum. It became an icon of the city and area much sought after photo opportunity. It is favourite for visitors to be photographed with, in, around and on top of.
nice place to visit. great place to visit to access most of Amsterdam's museums and attractions
busy. tourist area of Amsterdam.great to have a walk, people watch and grab a sandwich
Beautiful area of a beautiful City. So many great museums & designer brand shops, lots to see & do in this part of town.

Excellent little area. We loved it here, we spend two of our days wakling around this area. We also went ice skating which was hilarious and 5 Euros each for 2 hours. It's such a beautiful little place and the little restaurants and cafes are lovely.

Nice place to hang out in the summer - next to all the museums. This large "plein" is obviously called Museumplein because it is basically a large "square" that is located opposite the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. It is a large outdoor space, with cafes, outdoor souvenir shops, friet stands, another general museum souvenir shop in case you missed something in the museums you had just been to, or perhaps just wanted to buy a souvenir without the "trouble" of actually visiting a museum. In the summertime the square is a very busy place, with impromptu performances, and a little bit of everything else. Mostly famous now because of the enormous AMSTERDAM sign. You can't miss it if you are in the area, but it is certainly nothing worth going out of your way for on its' own merit.
